description:
Like most of us, Matt Kepnes longed to travel, to quit the daily grind of a cubicle job and simply get out there, to call the world home and never stop moving. Unlike most of us, Matt actually did that, and six years later, he’s still traveling. Learn how to do the same as “Nomadic” Matt shows you the ropes with his book How To Travel The World on $50 A Day, a guide to getting more bang for your buck and stretching out even the smallest of backpacking budgets.

Matt will teach you how to:

* Avoid paying bank fees anywhere in the world
* Earn thousands of free frequent flyer points
* Find discount travel cards that can save on hostels, tours, and transportation
* Get cheap (or free) plane tickets

Get started on your next big adventure with Matt and Strand!

Buy a copy of the featured event book or a $15 Strand gift card at the main floor registers or at the door in order to attend this event. All options admit one person. Please note that payment is required for all online event orders at the time of checkout. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Matt Kepnes

description:
Elizabeth Wurtzel, the writer and journalist celebrated for her memoir Prozac Nation, is coming to Strand to chat about her new book, Creatocracy! Elizabeth has written for The Wall Street Journal and The Guardian among other publications, and covered topics varying from David Foster Wallace to human rights in China, and her new book posits that the Constitution is the source of basically everything cool that ever happened in America.

Elizabeth will be joined in conversation by Only Love Can Break Your Heart writer David Samuels.

Buy a copy of the featured event book or a $15 Strand gift card at the main floor registers or at the door in order to attend this event. All options admit one person. description:
Strand and The Norman Mailer Center partner to bring you a special evening examining the life and letters of Norman Mailer, through Selected Letters of Norman Mailer. Editor of the collection and official Norman Mailer biographer J. Michael Lennon, author of Norman Mailer: A Double Life, will be in to discuss the author as only he can.

He will chat with writer, critic, and American literary scholar Morris Dickstein.

description:
Cartoonist Lucy Knisley celebrates the launch of her brand new graphic book, Displacement right here at Strand! Lucy is the writer and artist behind the Slate and Publisher's Weekly critically-acclaimed title, French Milk. Lucy’s newest comic follows her as she cares for her grandparents on a cruise, illustrated in dreamy, oceanic watercolors that match the water surrounding them in all directions.

She will be joined for the evening in conversation by critic Marie Anello of The Absolute.

description:
Join us for a special evening in the rare book room with University of Baltimore School of Law professor John Bessler as he showcases his book on Italian Enlightenment scholar Cesare Beccaria, The Birth of American Law: An Italian Philosopher and the American Revolution. John will be joined in conversation by Rebecca Haile and Jean Manas.

There is no cost to attend this event, which will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: John Bessler, Rebecca Haile + Jean Manas

description:
Come to Strand to meet one of the strong young voices in fiction as Shari Goldhagen discusses her second novel, In Some Other World, Maybe. Shari’s first novel, Family and Other Accidents, was heralded as an attentive perspective at family ties. In her sophomore effort, Shari shifts focus to a group of teenagers whose lives intersect both in their youth and beyond.

She’ll be in conversation with Michelle Herman, the novelist and essayist whose most recent books are the essay collection Stories We Tell Ourselves and a book for children, A Girl's Guide to Life.

Buy a copy of the featured event book or a $15 Strand gift card at the main floor registers or at the door in order to attend this event. All options admit one person. description:
Join Strand as author Kevin Morris presents his new short story collection, White Man's Problems! Morris, a producer from the Tony Award-winning musical The Book of Mormon, brings up the philosophical quandaries of the average man's life, as characters in his nine stories attempt to deal with the challenges associated with adult life. The stories move between the affluent west coast to the working class east in what proves to be an influential and welcomed new voice in fiction.

Joining Kevin will be NPR host Ophira Eisenberg, who recently released her memoir Screw Everyone: Sleeping My Way to Monogamy.

Buy a copy of the featured event book or a $15 Strand gift card at the main floor registers or at the door in order to attend this event. All options admit one person. description:
Beat the chill with the Strand and Farran Smith Nehme as we celebrate the release of her book Missing Reels, about a girl who ditches a small town in favor of the glamorous but fading old movie houses of New York City. What she finds in New York--romance, intrigue, a secretly famous silent movie star in the apartment below--rival the dramatic revelations of the old Hollywood films that inspired the novel itself.

Farran’s invited a panel of film experts, including Vanity Fair’s James Wolcott; critic and author of the fan favorite Wes Anderson Collection Matt Zoller Seitz; and Anne Helen Petersen, author of the recent release Scandals of Classic Hollywood. It’s a must for film buffs and Hollywood historians alike!

Buy a copy of the featured event book or a $15 Strand gift card at the main floor registers or at the door in order to attend this event. All options admit one person. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.

description:
Though you’ve seen Molly Sims in Sports Illustrated’s Swimsuit Issues and on TV, she wasn’t born that way—in her new book The Everyday Supermodel, she details how she maintains her look, including personal weight loss strategies, and reveals the stories and mishaps that shaped her.

Now you have a chance to meet the modeling icon at the Dry Bar’s Meatpacking District location!

Please RSVP to mollyny@brandlinkcommunications in order to attend. Purchase of The Everyday Supermodel in-person at the event is required to join the signing line. This event will be held at the Dry Bar’s Meatpacking District location at 317 West 13th Street between 8th Avenue and Hudson Street.
title: Molly Sims at the Dry Bar

description:
Due to high volume of ticket sales, entry tickets for this event are no longer available at this time. Don't fret—a standby line will form outside our store on the corner of 12th Street and Broadway at 5 PM and Kim will stay to meet all of her fans!

Exclusively at Strand! Alternative icon Kim Gordon returns to Strand, this time for the release of her memoir Girl in a Band, which details not only the years of her life in Sonic Youth, but also illuminates up previously unlit parts of Gordon’s life, from a childhood in California in the ‘60s and ‘70s through New York in the ‘80s and ‘90s. Girl in a Band also serves as a platform to discuss art, partnership, and dissolving identity like no other book since Patti Smith’s Just Kids.

Kim will be in conversation with Brooklyn-based writer and Vanity Fair contributing editor Elissa Schappell, who also co-founded the literary magazine Tin House. Her most recent release Blueprints for Building Better Girls was declared “Best Book of the Year” by the San Francisco Chronicle, Boston Globe, Wall Street Journal, Newsweek, and O Magazine.

The line for ticket-holders will begin outside our store at 828 Broadway beginning at 5 PM. Please note that while we have seating available, it will be on a first come, first serve basis, and we cannot reserve chairs. Once seating is filled, there will be standing room further back. Entry for this event will be through our building’s entrance at 826 Broadway.

Tickets for this event are no longer available at this time. Please note that we will have a standby line outside our store on the day of the event, separate from the line for ticket-holders, beginning at 5 PM. Customers in the standby line are not guaranteed entry into the event, and will need to purchase a ticket if let upstairs. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 826 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Kim Gordon + Elissa Schappell

description:
Alan Lightman, author of the international bestseller Einstein's Dreams, comes to Strand to celebrate the release of his new book, Screening Room. Alan's latest is a memoir of his family's rise to prominence in Memphis through his grandfather's movie theater empire, and all that comes with success in the south. Filled with accounts of the music and the politics of the time, Screening Room is a must-read solely by merit of Alan's family members' firsthand accounts.

Buy a copy of the featured event book or a $15 Strand gift card at the main floor registers or at the door in order to attend this event. All options admit one person. Please note that payment is required for all online event orders at the time of checkout. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Alan Lightman

description:
There's nothing quite like a Mast Brothers chocolate bar—filled with nuances like a trace of vanilla and smoke or a citrusy sweetness, their bars are a far departure from the chocolate of your childhood. When we went to a tasting at their factory in Williamsburg, we were floored. We loved the experience so much that we wanted it for our customers.

Join Strand and Mast Brothers for a FREE tasting! Experts from our friends at Mast Brothers will be on our store's main floor to pass out samples, talk about their different varieties, and answer any questions you may have about the chocolate. This is all happening on the main floor of our store at 828 Broadway, on February 13th from 4 PM till 6 PM. Don't miss it!

This tasting will be held on Strand Book Store’s Main Floor at 828 Broadway at 12th Street, and is free to attend.
title: Free Mast Brothers Chocolate Tasting

description:
New York Magazine's Matt Zoller Seitz leads an awesome, dynamic discussion on the production and making of visionary filmmaker Wes Anderson's The Grand Budapest Hotel in support of Matt's gorgeous new book, The Wes Anderson Collection: The Grand Budapest Hotel.

Joining Matt for the night’s conversation are two experts on the film: Randall Poster, who was the music supervisor for The Grand Budapest Hotel, Moonrise Kingdom, Spring Breakers, The Wolf of Wall Street, and many other critically acclaimed films; and Montreal Gazette and RogerEbert.com film critic Olivia Collette, whose essay on the music of The Grand Budapest Hotel is featured in the book.

Buy a copy of the featured event book or a $15 Strand gift card at the main floor registers or at the door in order to attend this event. All options admit one person. description:
Historian and professor Stephen Kotkin presents his New York Times critically acclaimed biography Stalin: Volume 1: Paradoxes of Power, 1878-1928 at Strand. Hailed as an innovative work, this first volume sheds new light on the personalities and powers that molded an infamous world leader. A perfect night for history buffs!

Stephen will be joined for the chat by n+1 editor and novelist Keith Gessen.

description: Winter is here and who better to celebrate the season with than the Frozen princess herself, Elsa! Her touch may be icy but she’s warmed our hearts with her love and joyful voice that’s second to none. Come join us on February 28th and March 1st from 2 - 3 p.m. for a very special storytime and crafts session with this beloved character.

description:
Rolling Stone's Rob Sheffield interviews "Dean of American Rock Critics" Robert Christgau on his new memoir, Going into the City: Portrait of a Critic as a Young Man. Robert’s title isn’t simply vanity—he’s navigated the world of music criticism since 1967, and his new memoir takes us both through his life in New York and his tales of Woodstock, Chicago '68, and many more.

Rob Sheffield has become a cultural sensation of his own—with books like Turn Around Bright Eyes and Love Is a Mixtape, Rob has carved out his place in the world of music criticism.

Don't miss this exclusive evening with the scribe to some of twentieth century music and culture's most legendary moments!

Buy a copy of the featured event book or a $15 Strand gift card at the main floor registers or at the door in order to attend this event. All options admit one person. Please note that payment is required for all online event orders at the time of checkout. description:
Just in time to snag a Valentine: Strand + Autostraddle partner once again to bring you a brand new, fun-filled mixer with our Queer Ladies Trivia Night! Cozy up in our rare book room with complimentary wine and refreshments and other awesome, literary singles like yourself. Refreshments from Fat Witch Bakery and Doughnuttery will be served, and extra special awesome prizes from Fat Witch, Shake Shack, Think Coffee, and Num Pang will be given to the brainiest trivia masters!

Admission for this event is $20 and can be purchased in-store at the registers and at the door. This event will be held in the Strand's third floor rare book room at 828 Broadway.
title: Strand + Autostraddle present Queer Ladies Trivia night!

description:
Okay, let's be real: for many people, Valentine's Day isn’t so fun. If you're in a relationship, there's pressure to make it truly special… And being alone? Also not the most fun in the world. It's all about finding the sweet spot, that feeling of new found romance that requires zero commitment and also doesn't make you feel like complete garbage.

Curb your Valentine's Day woes and join Strand and OkCupid for yet another Boozy Book Swap! Mix and mingle with some sexy literary singles in our cozy rare book room and bring a copy of your favorite book to trade. We’ll keep the room warm, and the music and wine flowing. Complimentary refreshments from Fat Witch Bakery and Doughnuttery will be served!

Purchase a $20 ticket through the OkCupid website. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: OkCupid + Strand's Boozy Book Swap!

description:
In her gutsy new memoir How to Grow Up, Michelle Tea describes the process of becoming a full-fledged adult while living in San Francisco—from the less-than-sanitary communal living spaces, drugs and alcohol to responsibility, health and self-awareness. Come meet Michelle, get your books signed, and maybe even gain some insight on how Michelle got to where she is—it’s all in Strand’s Rare Book Room!

Michelle will be joined for the evening by BuzzFeed LGBT editor Saeed Jones, NBCC Poetry Award finalist with the recent book, Prelude To Bruise.

Buy a copy of the featured event book or a $15 Strand gift card at the main floor registers or at the door in order to attend this event. All options admit one person. description:
Join Lee Kelly for a special night of celebration for her debut novel, City of Savages. Set in a post-Third World War Manhattan where Central Park has become a prisoner-of-war camp and the island is a cage that traps heroines Sky and Phee, Lee's gripping first release promises a thrilling journey through a transformed city.

Lee will celebrate the release of City of Savages in the Strand's third floor Rare Book Room! Wine and snacks will be served before a scene from the novel is acted out and Lee gives a special presentation about the novel.

This event is FREE and open to the public. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Lee Kelly

description:
Tuna the chiweenie, of @tunameltsmyheart fame, wants to celebrate his new book, Tuna Melts My Heart: The Underdog with the Overbite by meeting YOU! Come out to shake paws with everyone's favorite Instagram pup, who BuzzFeed calls "the most inspiring dog on the Internet." With the help of his owner Courtney Dasher, Tuna's new book will reveal previously unseen exploits from the unique pet's daily life. Social Tees animal shelter volunteers will be on hand to give out information about fostering, adoptions, and how you can help an animal in need! Because we want to make Tuna’s experience at Strand the best it can possibly be, please be advised that we will strictly adhere to the following rules:

  • No flash photography.
  • No photos with Tuna, though you’re free to snap cell phone pics in passing!
  • No touching Tuna.
  • Entry for this event will be through Strand's 826 Broadway entrance, to the direct left of our store's main entrance.

Help Tuna celebrate and join Strand for an exciting night with the world's beloved "underdog with the overbite.”

Buy a copy of the featured event book or a $15 Strand gift card at the main floor registers or at the door in order to attend this event. All options admit one person. Please note that payment is required for all online event orders at the time of checkout. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 826 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Tuna the Chiweenie

description:
This week at Strand, it's a special Purim storytime! Come hear stories about the history and traditions of this Jewish holiday, and design your own Purim mask! Children (and adults) are encouraged to come in costume!

This event is free and open to the public, and will be located in the Strand's 2nd floor Children’s Department at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Storytime: Special Purim Stories

description:
Tom Brokaw interviews fiction writer Thomas McGuane in an exclusive chat on McGuane's newest collection, Crow Fair. The latest in a long list of penned titles, Crow Fair breathes new life into a wide spectrum of classic conflicts, from a man on his own and confronted by the violence of nature, to a time-tested friendship finally breaking under the pressure of mutual dislike.

Tom Brokaw is a longtime NBC newsman, anchor and Special Correspondent, and was awarded the Presidential Medal of Freedom in 2014. He has published a number of books, perhaps most famously The Greatest Generation.

Buy a copy of the featured event book or a $15 Strand gift card at the main floor registers or at the door in order to attend this event. All options admit one person. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.

description:
Children’s book author Kirsten Hall and illustrator Dasha Tolstikova are coming to share their smash hit of 2014, The Jacket! The story of a girl, a book and her dog, this is a must for anyone who loves books and books about loving books. If you know the mania of seeing a favorite book dirty or broken, you’ll relate to the turmoil the little girl feels when her book is damaged by her dog, Egg Cream, and see the ingenuity in how she fixes it.

Kirsten will be reading and Dasha will lead a craft, which will guide everyone in making jackets for their favorite books! Don’t miss the presentation of what the Huffington Post named the Honorable Mention for “Most Charming Picture Book of 2014.”

This event is free and open to the public, and will be located in the Strand's 2nd floor Children’s Department at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Children’s Storytime: Kirsten Hall + Dasha Tolstikova

description:
Writer, translator, and New Yorker contributor Joel Agee presents his translation of ancient Greek tragedy Prometheus Bound. Joel's new adaptation of the Aeschylus tale comes after a wealth of achievements, both in translating works and in writing his own. This latest translation of Prometheus Bound, according to the Hollywood Reporter, "blows away" previous translations.

Joel will be supported by Ron Cephas Jones, who starred in the acclaimed Getty Villa production of Prometheus Bound, in a special performance segment!

Buy a copy of the featured event book or a $15 Strand gift card at the main floor registers or at the door in order to attend this event. All options admit one person. description:
Rachel "Yoga Girl" Brathen visits our Strand outpost at the Flatiron Club Monaco for an exclusive Q&A and signing of her new book, Yoga Girl. With over a million Instagram followers, Rachel inspires health, fitness, and positive vibes in fans the world over! Follow @yoga_girl on Instagram, and don't miss out on this special opportunity.

This event will be located in the Strand's Shop at Club Monaco, at 160 5th Avenue, between 20th and 21st Streets. Guests must purchase a copy of Yoga Girl in order to join the signing line.
title: Rachel "Yoga Girl" Brathen at Club Monaco

Come down to the Strand for a sports themed weekend of story fun! We'll read sports books, color sports pictures, and do sports activities!

This event is free and open to the public, and will be located in the Strand's 2nd floor Children’s Department at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.

description:
Celebrated writer Geoff Dyer is known as a leading voice in contemporary British literature, and has the accolades to prove it. Join Geoff and Strand in an exclusive, in-depth panel discussion surrounding society's impact on literature, through Raymond Williams' interviews in Politics and Letters. A new edition of the now classic Raymond Williams set of interviews still serves as a vast contribution to the intellectual culture of the left and includes an updated introduction written by Geoff.

Joining the discussion will be n+1's Nikil Saval, whose Cubed: A Secret History of the Workplace was published last year; as well as novelist Jenny Davidson, who teaches English and Comparative Literature at Columbia University.

Buy a copy of the featured event book or a $15 Strand gift card at the main floor registers or at the door in order to attend this event. All options admit one person. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.

Spreading smiles and hugs along the way he decided to stop by and share in a few of his very own adventures. Come join us March 21st and the 22nd from 2 - 3 p.m. as one of the greatest characters the world over visits the Strand for stories and crafts!
title: Sesame Street’s Elmo Visits Strand! Day 2

description:
Celebrated independent filmmaker Gary Hustwit's Design Trilogy famously brought in the insight of experts to beautifully present the subjects of typography, graphic design, urban design, architecture, and industrial design. Now, with the release of Helvetica / Objectified / Urbanized: The Complete Interviews, Gary presents even more depth to the content in his trilogy. Join Gary in our Rare Book Room to celebrate the launch of the new book!

Gary will lead a panel on the book with Paula Scher, a designer and Pentagram studio's first female principal, prolific type designer Tobias Frere-Jones, industrial designer Karim Rashid, Smart Design founder Davin Stowell, and architecture expert Noah Chasin.

description:
Even before the inception of Devo, Mark Mothersbaugh had launched into a life intertwined with the arts. Acclaimed by Wes Anderson as "unified and singular," the work that Mark produces is now collected in one gorgeous Princeton Architectural Press release, titled Myopia. Join Strand as Mark gives an exciting, personal look at Myopia and a lifetime of creative inventions in painting, photography and more!

Mark will be in conversation with Myopia editor and the Director of the Museum of Contemporary Art in Denver, Adam Lerner.

Event Rules:

  • Mark will sign copies of Myopia and the Collected Facts & Lies postcard box. No other memorabilia, please. 
  • Photography is allowed at this event, including quick photographs with Mark for guests in the signing line.
  • Guests must have purchased a copy of Myopia or the Collected Facts & Lies postcard set through Strand in order to join the signing line after Mark's talk.

Buy a copy of the featured event book or a $15 Strand gift card at the main floor registers or at the door in order to attend this event. All options admit one person. Please note that payment is required for all online event orders at the time of checkout. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Mark Mothersbaugh + Adam Lerner

description:
The New York Times-bestselling author Graeme Simsion brings the sequel to his beloved The Rosie Project to the Rare Book Room! Join us for an up-close-and-personal reading and talk about his Goodreads 2014 Best Fiction Nominee The Rosie Effect. 

Joining Graeme will be Bustle senior culture editor Meredith Turits. It’ll be a discussion of contemporary fiction that no reader will want to miss!

description:
Strand hosts beloved storytelling titan Kazuo Ishiguro in a lunchtime signing for his latest, long-awaited book, The Buried Giant. Celebrated as an "original and remarkable genius" by the likes of The New York Times Book Review's Louis Menand, Mr. Ishiguro's work is held in utmost regard by critics and readers the world over. This is rare, once-in-a-lifetime opportunity for all fans of literary fiction! 

Event Rules:

  • A signing line will form outside Strand along Broadway at 11:30am.
  • Guests must purchase a copy of The Buried Giant at Strand in order to join the signing line.
  • Copies will be available at our main floor registers by the store's opening on the day of the event.
  • Guests must present valid receipts as proof of purchase.
  • Signing of additional books will be at Mr. Ishiguro's discretion.
  • Brief photography will be allowed.

Thank you in advance for choosing to join Strand for this momentous literary event!

Purchase a copy of The Buried Giant in-store at Strand in order to join the signing line. Strand is located at 828 Broadway, New York. Please note that proof of purchase (Strand receipt) is required to attend the signing line.
title: Kazuo Ishiguro

description:
St. Patrick's day is around the corner! Wear something green to come hear some Irish folktales and color some shamrocks! St. Patrick drove the snakes out of Ireland, so we'll be making some snakes of our own!

This event is free and open to the public, and will be located in the Strand's 2nd floor Children’s Department at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.

description:
An insider's evening celebrating a legacy in spy fiction: Strand and Penguin Random House partner to bring you a memorable night with powerhouse novelist Alan Furst. Alan's mastery of the historical spy novel manifested most recently in his novel Midnight in Europe, about a lawyer thrown into a world of international espionage and the fight against fascism. Help us celebrate its paperback release with a talk dedicated to the historical spy novel.

Alan will chat with editor and Wired and New York Magazine contributor Mark Horowitz. Cozy up in our Rare Book Room for a night of espionage with wine and nibbles provided by Penguin Random House!

Admission for this event is $20 and includes one new paperback copy of Midnight in Europe, which guests will receive at the door on the night of the event. Admission can be purchased in-store at the main floor registers and at the door. All options admit one person. Please note that payment is required for all online event orders at the time of checkout. This event will be held in the Strand's third floor rare book room at 828 Broadway.
title: Alan Furst + Mark Horowitz

St. Patrick's day is around the corner! Wear something green to come hear some Irish folktales and color some shamrocks! St. Patrick drove the snakes out of Ireland, so we'll be making some snakes of our own!

This event is free and open to the public, and will be located in the Strand's 2nd floor Children’s Department at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Storytime: St. Patrick’s Day

description:
Famous for his roles in movies like Steven Spielberg's E.T. the Extra-Terrestrial, Erin Brockovich, and multiple iterations of TV favorite Law & Order, Peter Coyote gives an exclusive chat in our Rare Book Room on his new memoir, The Rainman's Third Cure: An Irregular Education. Drawing on a metaphor from an early Bob Dylan song, the memoir delves into Peter's complicated balance between the competition of success and the transcendental inclusion of love, and how Peter found Zen through poet Gary Snyder.

Buy a copy of  the featured event book or a $15 Strand gift card at the main floor registers or at the door in order to attend this event. All options admit one person. Please note that payment is required for all online event orders at the time of checkout. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Peter Coyote

description: April is the only month with enough rain to satisfy the world's most famous pig and her love for muddy puddles! That’s right, it’s Peppa Pig! The star of the hit Nick Jr. TV series is coming to The Strand! Well-loved by preschoolers and families all around the globe, Peppa is making very special visits on April 18th and April 19th from 11 am – 12 noon and 2 – 3 pm! In addition to meet-n-greets and photo opps, fans can enjoy Peppa Pig story time and a special craft session. So stay dry and come by – and don’t forget your camera!
title: Peppa Pig Visits Strand! Day 2

description: April is the only month with enough rain to satisfy the world's most famous pig and her love for muddy puddles! That’s right, it’s Peppa Pig! The star of the hit Nick Jr. TV series is coming to The Strand! Well-loved by preschoolers and families all around the globe, Peppa is making very special visits on April 18th and April 19th from 11 am – 12 noon and 2 – 3 pm! In addition to meet-n-greets and photo opps, fans can enjoy Peppa Pig story time and a special craft session. So stay dry and come by – and don’t forget your camera!
title: Peppa Pig Visits Strand!

description:
**Five attendees at this event who buy Sarah Manguso’s Ongoingness will be chosen at random to receive a FREE custom Moleskine with a quote from Ongoingness printed on its cover!

Indies love indies: Strand presents an insider's night with Graywolf Press, the publisher of Claudia Rankine's Citizen and other award-winning titles. Graywolf's Director and Publisher Fiona McCrae will moderate a chat between poet Sarah Manguso (Ongoingness) and author Leslie Jamison (The Empathy Exams).

Stop by our rare book room to mix and mingle with the awesome folks from one of Strand's favorite independent publishers!

Buy a copy of either featured event book or a $15 Strand gift card at the main floor registers or at the door  in order to attend this event. All options admit one person. Please note that payment is required for all online event orders at the time of checkout. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: An Evening with Graywolf Press

description:
This week at Strand, it's a special Purim storytime! Come hear stories about the history and traditions of this Jewish holiday, and design your own Purim mask! Children (and adults) are encouraged to come in costume!

This event is free and open to the public, and will be located in the Strand's 2nd floor Children’s Department at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Storytime: Special Purim Stories

description:
Take 30% off all Americana titles during The Great Strand Americana Sale! Ten days only. In-store and online. You can browse our Americana section on at Strand's 828 Broadway location or online here.

Discount is applied at time of checkout and applies to item price only. Does not include tax or shipping fees. Not valid for special accounts. Offer valid April 24th through May 3rd.
title: The Great Strand Americana Sale!

description:
Join us for an exclusive panel of some of the best and brightest women working in letterpress and paper design today! Jessica White (of Heroes & Criminals Press) and Kseniya Thomas (founder of Thomas-Printers) lead a discussion based on their new book, Ladies of Letterpress: A Gallery of Prints, which catalogs beautiful work from around the United States and includes 80 gorgeous poster inserts.

Rounding out the panel will be two ladies featured in the book: visual artist Sarah Nicholls and Gina Houseman of Papersheep Design.

Buy a copy of the featured event book or a $15 Strand gift card at the main floor registers or at the door in order to attend this event. All options admit one person. Please note that payment is required for all online event orders at the time of checkout. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Ladies of Letterpress

description:
There is seldom a history on the rise of punk that does not mention John “Johnny Rotten” Lydon. From Sex Pistols lead singer to Public Image Ltd. and beyond, John has remained one of the most dynamic figures in the music world, and this translates directly into his new memoir, Anger Is an Energy: My Life Uncensored. He'll chat with Buzzfeed Books editor and Pen & Ink co-founder Isaac Fitzgerald. 

Join us for a rich night of punk music history with the legend himself in an exclusive chat about the new memoir!

After his talk, John will sign copies of his book. No other memorabilia, please.

Limited tickets available! Buy a copy of the featured event book in-store at the main floor registers in order to attend this event. All options admit one person. Please note that payment is required for all online event orders at the time of checkout. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street. The line will begin forming at the 826 entrance at 6:00pm. A separate stand-by line will also form beginning at 6:00pm and additional guests will be able to purchase tickets depending on availability shortly before the start of the event. Please note that the stand-by line does not guarantee admission and admission is based on ticket and space availability at that time.
title: John "Johnny Rotten" Lydon

description:
History's great philosophers have approached one of life's fundamental questions for centuries: What is happiness and how do I achieve it? This is the subject of French-Madagascan philosopher, sociologist, and religious historian Frédéric Lenoir's European massive bestseller, Happiness. Now published for the very first time in English by Melville House, Frédéric's smash hit considers that perhaps true, lasting happiness actually is possible. Join Strand and Frédéric in a night of conversation about the book, happiness, and what that means.

Frédéric will be in conversation with The New Yorker's Alexandra Schwartz, who won the National Book Critics Circle’s Nona Balakian Citation for Excellence in Review in 2014.

Buy a copy of the featured event book or a $15 Strand gift card at the main floor registers or at the door in order to attend this event. All options admit one person. Please note that payment is required for all online event orders at the time of checkout. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Frédéric Lenoir + Alexandra Schwartz

description:
Join us as we celebrate the release of Big Gay Ice Cream’s debut cookbook in a big gay way! Since its debut in a beat up ice cream truck in the summer of 2009, founders Douglas Quint and Bryan Petroff have always focused on a simple mission: bring rainbows and sprinkles—and great ice cream—to the masses. That mission has garnered them numerous awards and accolades, including being named the #5 ice cream parlor in the world (and #1 in the U.S.) by USA Today, The Daily Beast, and Yahoo. The duo’s yearbook-inspired cookbook, a year by year guide to frozen desserts full of saucy stories from the history of the business, is another step towards Big Gay Domination. Come meet—and eat—with the authors as they transform The Strand into their own ice cream social.

Stacy London of TLC Network's "Love Lust or Run" will moderate what is sure to be a memorable and hilarious discussion and drag personalities Bambi Galore and Bertha Mason will serve as your hostesses.

Admission for this event is $35 and includes a copy of Big Gay Ice Cream: Saucy Stories & Frozen Treats, Big Gay Ice Cream served at the event, and meet-and-greets with Bryan and Doug. Admission can be paid at the main floor registers or at the door to the event. All options admit one person. Please note that payment is required for all online event orders at the time of checkout. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Big Gay Ice Cream: Bryan Petroff + Douglas Quint

description:
A fun, tongue-in-cheek look at the anguish that is... the creative process! Louise is trying to concentrate on her art, and is experimenting with ways to manifest her imagination on the outside. However, Louise's little brother Art (yup!) and her pet cat seem to be conspiring against her, and it takes an Eloise-ian adventure for Louise to realize that she has room in her life for both forms of Art.

Author and Illustrator Kelly Light will be here to read and lead us in a Louise-inspired illustration lesson, so join us at 11 AM in the Children's department and find the artist in you!

This event is free and open to the public, and will be held in our second floor Children's Department.
title: Kelly Light

description:
Journalist and Sirius XM Radio host Michelangelo Signorile presents a special night launching his new book, It's Not Over: Getting Beyond Tolerance, Defeating Homophobia, and Winning True Equality! Michelangelo has been an outspoken gay rights supporter and in many ways a pioneer—his first book Queer in America famously exposed hypocrisy in American institutions, and in It's Not Over, he maps out the long road ahead to true equality.

Michelangelo will be joined in conversation by Tim Teeman, Senior Editor at the Daily Beast and author of In Bed With Gore Vidal: Hustler, Hollywood, and the Private World of an American Master.

Buy a copy of It's Not Over or a $15 Strand gift card at the main floor registers or at the door in order to attend this event. All options admit one person. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Michelangelo Signorile + Tim Teeman

description:
Please RSVP to our Facebook event in order to attend. 

*If you plan on attending this event, please arrive early to ensure admittance, as we expect the room to reach capacity fairly early. The line for this event will form at 12 PM the day of the event outside our store at 828 Broadway.

Senator Elizabeth Warren returns to Strand to celebrate the paperback launch of bestseller A Fighting Chance, a book heralded as "moving" by the Washington Post and "a potent mix of policy and memoir" by the New York Times, in which the senator has written arguments the New York Review of Books says "demand to be taken seriously." In honor of its paperback release, Senator Warren will be in the Rare Book Room for a special, free-to-attend afternoon talk about the book. Don't miss this opportunity to hear from the senator herself!

Signed paperback copies of A Fighting Chance will be available for sale at the event. Due to time constraints, Senator Warren unfortunately won't be able to personalize, or stop to sign additional material. Please refrain from bringing signs into the event space.

Please RSVP to our Facebook event if you plan to attend this event, which will be free to attend and located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street. Signed copies of A Fighting Chance will be on sale during and after the talk.
title: Senator Elizabeth Warren

description:
Join TIME magazine journalist and former Newsweek foreign correspondent Carla Power for a special evening dedicated to her new book, If the Oceans Were Ink. This new book comes after a breadth of work dedicated to Islam, and follows Carla as she, a secular American, explores the Quran with friend and madrasa-trained sheikh Mohammad Akram Nadwi. Hear about her studies, the places she went, the people she met and what she learned along the way in this exclusive chat.

Carla will be in conversation with Homeland TV series actress Sarita Choudhury for what promises to be a fascinating conversation on bridging the gap between Middle Eastern and Western culture.

Buy a copy of the featured event book or a $15 Strand gift card at the main floor registers or at the door in order to attend this event. All options admit one person. Please note that payment is required for all online event orders at the time of checkout. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Carla Power + Sarita Choudhury

description:
Join Strand and the editors of Please Excuse This Poem: 100 New Poets For The Next Generation to kick off National Poetry Month in style! Brett Fletcher Lauer (deputy director of the Poetry Society of America) and Lynn Melnick (author of If I Should Say I Have Hope) will present an awesome showcase of renowned and rising-star poets from their newly published collection, which delves into American poetry by young writers from a variety of backgrounds and sources ranging from The New Yorker to Twitter.

Mark Bibbins (They Don't Kill You Because They're Hungry), Dorothea Lasky (Rome), Alex Dimitrov (Begging for It), Ada Limon (Sharks in the Rivers), and Camille Rankine (Slow Dance with Trip Wire) round out the night's discussion,  perfect for poetry fans and aspiring young writers!

Buy a copy of the featured event book or a $15 Strand gift card at the main floor registers or at the door in order to attend this event. All options admit one person. Please note that payment is required for all online event orders at the time of checkout. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Please Excuse This Poem

description:
Folks may know Amber Tamblyn from her acting career, where she has earned nominations for Emmy, Golden Globe, and Independent Spirit Awards. That's not all there is to her, though—fans should also take note of her poetry, which has been praised by Poet Laureate Lawrence Ferlinghetti and Nick Flynn, amongst others. Amber is a contributor to the Poetry Foundation and Bust Magazine, as well as Amy Poehler's Smart Girls at the Party. Her third collection of poetry, Dark Sparkler, explores the lives and deaths of child star actresses, with art work by Marilyn Manson and David Lynch. The Guardian calls the collection "a devastatingly haunting work."

Join Amber and This American Life's Ira Glass for an intimate conversation and reading.

Buy a copy of the featured event book or a $15 Strand gift card at the main floor registers or at the door in order to attend this event. All options admit one person. Please note that payment is required for all online event orders at the time of checkout. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Amber Tamblyn + Ira Glass

description:
Princeton English professor Jeff Nunokawa is somewhat of an essayist phenomenon, having posted a few contemplative thoughts in the Notes section of his Facebook page every single morning since 2007. Join Strand and Jeff in an exclusive celebration of this truly unique distillation of the 250 best posts, titled Note Book!

In conversation with Jeff will be Rebecca Mead, author of My Life in Middlemarch, who called Note Book “a strange and enduring wonder.”

Buy a copy of the featured event book or a $15 Strand gift card at the main floor registers or at the door in order to attend this event. All options admit one person. Please note that payment is required for all online event orders at the time of checkout. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Jeff Nunokawa + Rebecca Mead

description:
Called "a movement" by The New York Times, Karl Ove Knausgaard's multi-part memoirs under the title My Struggle are a literary phenomenon permeating critical and public readerships alike. Join us at Strand for a special opportunity to meet Karl Ove in celebrating the release of My Struggle: Book Four. Karl Ove will sign copies of Book Four as well as his other titles on Strand's main floor.

Event rules:

  • Guests must purchase a copy of Book Four at Strand in order to join the signing line.
  • Please have your Strand receipts ready to check. 
  • Books may be inscribed.
  • Brief photography will be permitted.
  • Mr. Knausgaard will sign a maximum of four books per guest.

Purchase a copy of My Struggle: Book Four in-store at Strand in order to join the signing line. Strand is located at 828 Broadway, New York. Please note that proof of purchase (Strand receipt) is required to attend the signing line.
title: Karl Ove Knausgaard

description:
Actor, stand-up comedian, and TV host Greg Proops of "Whose Line Is it Anyway?" visits Strand for the launch of his first-ever book, The Smartest Book In The World! Greg's book is a hilarious, rapid-fire collection of pop culture trivia, ancient wisdom, and fantasy baseball teams. Don't miss out on this Strand-exclusive chat!

Greg will be joined by actor, TV personality, and comedian John Fugelsang.

*In addition to signing books, Greg will sign ONE piece of additional memorabilia per guest.

Buy a copy of the featured event book or a $15 Strand gift card at the main floor registers or at the door in order to attend this event. All options admit one person. Please note that payment is required for all online event orders at the time of checkout. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Greg Proops + John Fugelsang

description:
Strand celebrates Independent Bookstore Day alongside 400 other shops, countrywide. Get lost in the stacks (and all of our 18 miles while you're at it!) as we invite you to special programs for kids and grownups alike and shop some special edition books, prints and merchandise unique to Independent Bookstore Day!

Head up to our second floor Children’s Department for a special character visit with Sesame Street’s Elmo at 11 AM and 2 PM. Stick around at 2-4 PM to get a portrait by the amazing illustrator behind the Last Night’s Reading blog, Kate Gavino, in the Graphic Novel section of the second floor!

Also not to be missed are a signed chapbook by Bad Feminist author Roxane Gay, signed prints by cartoonist Chris Ware, a signed infographic by Knowledge Is Beautiful author David McCandless, and more!

To help our customers worldwide celebrate Independent Bookstore Day, Bustle's senior culture editor Meredith Turits will take the reins on our Instagram. From wherever you are, follow @strandbookstore and you'll be part of the festivities!

Come and shop our EXCLUSIVE Independent Bookstore Day products. Available in store only!
Original Chris Ware Signed Print
David McCandless Signed Infographic
Roxane Gay Signed Chapbook
Hyperbole & A Half Signed Broadside
Signed Captain Underpants Print
Huck Finn Literary Map
Days Like This: Good Writers on Bad Luck, Bum Deals and Other Torments 
“Sweet” Literary Tea Towel Set
“Salty” Literary Tea Towel Set
title: Independent Bookstore Day

description:
The famed story of The Southern Review’s conception follows the Louisiana State President in his Cadillac over to Robert Penn Warren’s house—now, after 80 years of supporting incredible and exciting new writing, the prestigious literary journal comes to Strand for a special celebration hosted by the Writers Studio!

The stellar line-up includes novelists Jayne Anne Phillips (Quiet Dell; Lark & Termite) and Karl Taro Greenfeld (The Subprimes; Triburbia), as well as poets Stephen Dunn (Lines of Defense; Here and Now, What Goes On), David Wojahn (Interrogation Palace; World Tree), and Chloe Honum (The Tulip Flame).

Mix and mingle with some of the quarterly magazine's finest contemporary contributors, hear readings from these award-winning writers, and help Southern Review celebrate their 80th birthday in style in the Rare Book Room!

This event is hosted by The Writers Studio.

Buy a copy of The Southern Review’s 80th Anniversary Issue or a $15 Strand gift card at the registers or the door in order to attend this event. All options admit one person. Please note that payment is required for all online event orders at the time of checkout. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: The Southern Review 80th Anniversary

description:
"Bleed for your work, but never let anyone see the blood. Make it look easy." That's the life and art motto of renowned poster artist Dan Stiles, whose sought-after posters have promoted such internationally acclaimed acts as Sonic Youth and Arctic Monkeys. Visit our Rare Book Room for a talk about his new, beautifully compiled powerHouse volume, One Thing Leads to Another!

Dan will talk with Cooper Hewitt's Ellen Lupton, whose forthcoming How Posters Work focuses on design principles and visual language in posters.

Buy a copy of the featured event book or a $15 Strand gift card at the main floor registers or at the door in order to attend this event. All options admit one person. Please note that payment is required for all online event orders at the time of checkout. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Dan Stiles + Ellen Lupton

description:
2016 Presidential Candidate & Kentucky Senator Rand Paul visits Strand's Rare Book Room for a special launch of his book, Taking a Stand: Moving Beyond Partisan Politics to Unite America. Don't miss this opportunity to hear the senator talk about his new book and the politics that surround it!

 Senator Paul will be joined for the evening by his wife, Kelley Paul, author of True and Constant Friends.

Buy a copy of the featured event book or a $15 Strand gift card at the main floor registers in order to attend this event. All options admit one person. Please note that payment is required for all online event orders at the time of checkout. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Senator Rand Paul + Kelley Paul

description:
Join us for an evening with the Braff brothers! Actor and director Zach Braff will celebrate his novelist brother Joshua Braff's newest book, The Daddy Diaries. This third title by Josh dives into the lives of a family recently relocated from San Francisco to St. Petersburg, Florida. Humorous and poignant, Josh's latest release has been compared to Nick Hornby and Jonathan Tropper, among other praise.

Zach Braff is the director of the film Garden State, and most recently, Wish I Was Here. As an actor, he gained recognition for his longtime role in TV's Scrubs, as well as in his films.

Buy a copy of the featured event book or a $15 Strand gift card at the main floor registers or at the door in order to attend this event. All options admit one person. Please note that payment is required for all online event orders at the time of checkout. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Joshua Braff + Zach Braff

description:
Join us for an evening with esteemed artist and illustrator Jules Feiffer as he looks back over 70 years' worth of imagination and innovation. Jules will present his catalog of work through the eagerly anticipated Out of Line: The Art of Jules Feiffer, a comprehensive volume that touches on such career highlights as The Phantom Tollbooth, Pulitzer Prize-winning Village Voice comics, and Jules' film and theater work.

He'll be in conversation with essayist Martha Fay, author of Do Children Need Religion? and A Mortal Condition: Eight Stories of Survival, Loss, and Hope.

Buy a copy of the featured event book or a $25 Strand gift card at the main floor registers or at the door in order to attend this event. All options admit one person. Please note that payment is required for all online event orders at the time of checkout. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Jules Feiffer + Martha Fay

description:
Join Long Island University Associate Professor of Victorian Literature and Culture Deborah Lutz for a highly personal look at the famous Brontë sisters through her new book, The Brontë Cabinet: Three Lives in Nine Objects. From the sisters' walking sticks to books they made as children, the artifacts within this latest of Deborah's works paints a riveting and unprecedented portrait of Emily, Charlotte, Anne, and the unconventionality of their Victorian existence.

She’ll be in conversation with her editor, Amy Cherry. Don’t miss it!

Buy a copy of the featured event book or a $15 Strand gift card at the main floor registers or at the door in order to attend this event. All options admit one person. Please note that payment is required for all online event orders at the time of checkout. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Deborah Lutz + Amy Cherry

description:
Regular Rolling Stone contributor Michaelangelo Matos' new history in the electronica genre, The Underground Is Massive: How Electronic Dance Music Conquered America dives into the birth of EDM through the nascent parallel blossom of the internet, '90s rave culture, Ecstasy (and Molly), and the coalescence of cultural factors that led to what today is the biggest genre on the concert circuit.

Rolling Stone reporter and Turn Around Bright Eyes author Rob Sheffield will interview Michaelangelo. Don't miss it!

Also, check out Matos' massively awesome playlist—featuring some of the artists mentioned on the book—here.

Buy a copy of the featured event book or a $15 Strand gift card at the main floor registers or at the door in order to attend this event. All options admit one person. Please note that payment is required for all online event orders at the time of checkout. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Michaelangelo Matos + Rob Sheffield

description:
In 1966, Richard Goldstein became Village Voice's first rock columnist—almost 50 years later, Richard's memoir Another Little Piece of My Heart: My Life of Rock and Revolution in the '60s is packed with riveting, front-row-seat stories about the revolutionary music icons and cultural milestones of the '60s that he documented firsthand. Join Richard as he celebrates his new release in our Rare Book Room!

Richard will be in conversation with Rolling Stone's Anthony DeCurtis.

Buy a copy of the featured event book or a $15 Strand gift card at the main floor registers or at the door in order to attend this event. All options admit one person. Please note that payment is required for all online event orders at the time of checkout. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Richard Goldstein + Anthony DeCurtis

description:
In the spirit of Howard Zinn's widely taught People's History, award-winning Temple University professor Ralph Young presents his latest book, Dissent: The History of An American Idea! Ralph's latest uses the idea of American dissent as it runs through the vein of our nation's history, from Anne Hutchinson to the modern day Tea Party, and his discussion promises to enliven the spirit of dissent.

Ralph will be in conversation with teacher and public intellectual Claire Potter for an important discussion centered on the long tradition using freedom of speech to challenge what it means to be an American.

Buy a copy of the featured event book or a $15 Strand gift card at the main floor registers or at the door in order to attend this event. All options admit one person. Please note that payment is required for all online event orders at the time of checkout. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Ralph Young + Claire Potter

description:
Guns N' Roses and Velvet Revolver bassist Duff McKagan's smash hit first book, It's So Easy (and other lies), gave his fans a candid and self-aware look at the hard-rock life that took him through sobriety, the American dream, and beyond. Now, for the release of his much-awaited second effort, Duff makes a triumphant return to Strand. Join Duff as he debuts How To Be A Man (and other illusions) in our Rare Book Room!

Duff will be in conversation with New York Times book reviewer Alan Light, who has also been a rock critic for Rolling Stone and an editor-in-chief at both Vibe and Spin.

* Entry for this event will be through our building’s elevator lobby at 826 Broadway.

Buy a copy of the featured event book or a $20 Strand gift card at the main floor registers or at the door in order to attend this event. All options admit one person. Please note that payment is required for all online event orders at the time of checkout. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Duff McKagan + Alan Light

description:
First-time author Kevin McEnroe visits Strand's Rare Book Room to launch his novel, Our Town! This striking debut brings to life the glitter and fallout of a Hollywood starlet, her failing marriage, and a life spent in the wake of a string of bad decisions. It's been called "insightful, ironic, and very well written," by Peter Bogdanovich and has received praise from Hilton Als and Matthew Specktor, among others.

Kevin will be in conversation author, playwright, and essayist Darryl Pinckney, who called Our Town "an intense and wonderful experience."

Buy a copy of the featured event book or a $15 Strand gift card at the main floor registers or at the door in order to attend this event. All options admit one person. Please note that payment is required for all online event orders at the time of checkout. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Kevin McEnroe + Darryl Pinckney

description:
When Imogen Tate returns to her position as Editor-in-Chief of Gloss Magazine, she finds that her assistant has turned the office into a digital-age dystopia and has launched a plan to take over the magazine—so begins The Knockoff, a stylish new novel by Lucy Sykes and Jo Piazza! 

Lucy Sykes has worked in the fashion world as a stylist, fashion editor, and fashion director. For six years Lucy was the fashion director at Marie Claire magazine, and was most recently fashion director for Rent the Runway. Her own children’s clothing line, Lucy Sykes New York, was sold in more than a hundred department stores worldwide.

Jo Piazza is the managing editor of Yahoo Travel and a regular contributor to the Wall Street Journal. She is the author of Celebrity, Inc.: How Famous People Make Money and a novel, Love Rehab: A Novel in 12 Steps and If Nuns Ruled the World: Ten Sisters on a Mission.

Come mix and mingle with the authors at Strand's Club Monaco location in the Flatiron in celebration of their new novel!

This event will be located in the Strand's Shop at Club Monaco, at 160 5th Avenue, between 20th and 21st Streets. Guests must purchase a copy of The Knockoff from Strand in order to enter the signing line.
title: Lucy Sykes + Jo Piazza at Club Monaco

description:
Alice Cooper group bass player and Rock and Roll Hall of Fame inductee Dennis Dunaway comes to Strand for the official launch of his memoir, Snakes! Guillotines! Electric Chairs! Dennis will share stories from his shock-rock life as the lead songwriter and theatrical conceptionalist of Alice Cooper before giving an exclusive live acoustic performance with his band, Blue Coupe, and special guests Tish and Snooky from Manic Panic singing back-up! A night no music fan should miss.

Dennis will be in conversation with former longtime Rolling Stone staff writer Chris Hodenfield.

Buy a copy of the featured event book at the main floor registers in order to attend this event. All options admit one person. Please note that payment is required for all online event orders at the time of checkout. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Dennis Dunaway

description:
Dennis Hopper's daughter, Marin Hopper, presents an exclusive talk on her father's photography collection, Dennis Hopper: Drugstore Camera. This striking, clothbound collection showcases photographs that feel like stumbled-upon treasures. Gay Berlin comes after a wealth of research and work Robert has done on sexuality in Germany.

He'll be in conversation with former Broadway dancer and Tequila Mockingbird author Tim Federle. Tim provided the narration for Ann Bausum’s Stonewall: Breaking Out in the Fight for Gay Rights.

description:
Presented by The Type Directors Club: Type Nite comes to Strand!

What could possibly go wrong? In a discussion of "Mess-Ups and Do-Overs," Tobias-Frere Jones, Peter Mendelsund, and Abbott Miller will take you inside the creative process for a look at projects that went south or turned sour. Why learn from your own mistakes when you can learn from theirs? Tobias Frere-Jones is one of the world's leading typeface designers. Book designer Peter Mendelsund is the author of What We See When We Read and Cover, a monograph about his design process. Abbott Miller is a partner at Pentagram and author of Abbott Miller: Design and Content, published by Princeton Architectural Press. The conversation will be moderated by Ellen Lupton, Cooper Hewitt's senior curator of contemporary design and author of two new books, Graphic Design: The New Basics, 2nd Edition and How Posters Work, both released this summer.

A perfect evening for design professionals and students alike!

description:
Renu Balakrishnan is an Indian novelist and teacher. Her first novel, Four Aleys, traces the lives of four Syrian Christian women over the first half of the twentieth century in an India changing from the old feudal ways to the new. Early last year, Renu and the students of her Creative Writing class at St Xavier’s Institute of Communication, Bombay, brought out a collection of their short stories, Potluck, A Literary Collection of the Critique Group, which was well received in India. She is active in women’s empowerment programs in her neighborhood in Bombay, where she lives. She is at work on her second novel.

This book tells the story of four women – all named Aley - connected by blood, marriage and love. The story is told mainly through the bewildered eyes of the youngest one who tries to unravel and make sense of the doings around herin the behemoth of a home they all inhabit: Big House. The story unravels against the setting of a feudal society where the bonded strain against the chains of loyalty, dependence and fear to finally free themselves from their masters who themselves, as a result of decadent living, are victims of self-destructive tumultuous passions. It is a story of human bondage, endurance and loyalty and obsession. And through it a child searches for answers to hidden secrets and herself.

Admission to this event is free and open to the public.
title: Renu Balakrishnan

description:
Peek into the collections of some of the world’s most obsessive record geeks with Eilon Paz as he releases Dust & Grooves, a book of photos and interviews with collectors from around the world. Paz spent five years traveling the world of vinyl fetishists, spinning sides with pros like Gilles Peterson and Questlove, record store owners from Brooklyn to Ghana, and plenty of living-room selectors in between. Joining him are several of the book's contributors:

  • Sheila Burgel, writer, girl-group enthusiast, and WFMU DJ
  • Ahmed Gallab, DFA Records’s Sinkane
  • Pat James Longo, DJ, artist and musician
  • Jamison Harvey, aka DJ Prestige, founder of Flea Market Funk
  • Jason Trammel, aka J-Tram, drummer and musician
    •  

Buy a copy of the featured event book or a $15 Strand gift card at the main floor registers or at the door in order to attend this event. Please note that payment is required for all online event orders at the time of checkout. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Eilon Paz + Sheila Burgel

description:
Legendary photographer Danny Lyon signs his re-released investigation of prison life, Conversations With the Dead, in Strand's Rare Book Room. Only copies of Conversations will be signed.

Purchase a copy of the featured event book at the main floor registers or at the door in order to attend this event. Please note that payment is required for all online event orders at the time of checkout. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.

description:
Astronaut Buzz Aldrin will sign copies of his new children's title, Welcome to Mars: Making a Home on the Red Planet. Mr. Aldrin will also sign copies of Mission to Mars: My Vision for Space Exploration. Join us at Strand for Mr. Aldrin's only NYC appearance for Welcome to Mars!

Up to 3 books purchased at Strand per customer will be signed. No outside titles and no memorabilia will be signed. Mr. Aldrin will not personalize books. Photos are permitted from the line only.

Signing line will form in front of Strand at 828 Broadway beginning at 5:00 PM on Tuesday, September 8th. Please purchase a copy of Welcome to Mars or a copy of Mission to Mars in-store on the day of the event in order to attend the signing.

If you're unable to attend the event, signed copies of Welcome to Mars can be pre-ordered here, and signed copies of Mission to Mars can be pre-ordered here. Pre-orders can be sent or picked up the day after the event. Purchase of pre-ordered copies does not grant entry into the signing line on Tuesday, September 8th.
title: Buzz Aldrin

description:
Join Book Riot for the first ever live recording of Reading Lives, hosted by co-founder Jeff O’Neal and featuring special guest Tanwi Nandini Islam, author of the acclaimed debut novel Bright Lines.

Buy a copy of the featured event book or a $15 gift card at the main floor registers or at the door in order to attend this event. Please note that payment is required for all online event orders at the time of checkout. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Book Riot presents Reading Lives with Tanwi Nandini Islam

description:
Strand & David Zwirner Gallery present: an evening with painter Lisa Yuskavage and artist and writer Jarrett Earnest. Internationally lauded, Lisa's art is characterized by an ongoing interaction with the history of painting and the female body’s place within it. A new retrospective book by Rizzoli, The Brood: Paintings 1991-2015, showcases 25 years of work, particularly Lisa's specialized treatment of the female nude.

Buy a copy of The Brood or a $15 gift card in-store at Strand's main floor registers or at the door to attend this event. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.

description:
The Strand will be at this year’s Designers and Books Fair for 3 days of great design at the Fashion Institute of Technology! We’ll have books galore, with talks and signings planned as well. Drawings for Experiences with Authors™ will also be held, with some stunning opportunities to meet vanguard talents like Andre Leon Talley and Pentagram's Michael Bierut.

For more information and a complete schedule, check out http://designbookfair.com/.

description:
Come up to the Rare Book Room and get down with Marnie, the queen of senior rescue pups on Instagram and in the hearts of millions. She’ll be here with her bae, Shirley Braha, to talk about her journey from the streets to the Strand and take pictures with her adoring public.

Marnie and Shirley will be joined in conversation by senior Buzzfeed editor and host of the Internet Explorer podcast, Katie Notopoulos.

Buy a copy of Marnie the Dog: I’m a Book or a $15 gift card in-store at Strand on the main floor or at the door to attend this event. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Marnie the Dog + Katie Notopoulos

description:
Join music producer, author and photographer Hank O’Neal in conversation with Ken Schles and Andrew Savulich, two NYC photographers, as they discuss the changing streets and sights of the city.

For more Steidl x Strand events, click here.

Please purchase a copy of Invisible City, a copy of The City, or a $15 gift card at Strand's main floor registers or at the door in order to attend this event. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Ken Schles + Andrew Savulich w/ Hank O'Neal

description:
Ringo Starr looks back with Photograph, a collection of pictures he's taken throughout his long career in the Beatles and after. He'll be at the Strand for a presentation of the photographs, and to say a few words of peace and love.

Ringo will NOT be signing books. Customers can purchase a copy of Photograph and receive a limited edition bookplate featuring a reproduction of Ringo’s signature. Photos may be taken from the audience. This event is standing room only.

A limited number of signed prints of Ringo's photographs are available through Genesis Publications. Purchase of the prints affords customers a front row seat at his Strand appearance, as well as entry into a drawing to meet and be photographed with Ringo. Information about the prints can be found here.

Buy a copy of Photograph in-store at Strand's main floor registers to attend this event. When purchasing online, your name will be added to our guest list, and your copy will be given to you at the end of the line. The line for this event will form beginning at 12:00 noon on the day of the event in front of Strand on Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Ringo Starr

description:
Join Luc Sante for a look at The Other Paris, an investigation of the subversive and suppressed history of the iconic city. The raconteur behind Low Life brings his under-the-paving-stone perspective to the artists, the homeless, and the otherwise outcast population of Paris throughout its history--a history, he argues, that has largely vanished from view.

Buy a copy of The Other Paris or a $15 gift card in-store at Strand's main floor registers or at the door to attend this event. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Luc Sante

description:
Join Brigid Berlin--Andy Warhol associate, Factory documenter, Interview staffer, and storied socialite--as she launches her raucous and debauched collection of Polaroids! The legendary photographs give an inside look at the glamour and gaucherie of the downtown art scene of 60’s and 70’s New York. She’ll be joined in conversation by Vincent Fremont, editor of the Polaroids, Warhol biographer Bob Colacello, and Gerard Malanga, poet, photographer, filmmaker, and fellow Factory denizen.

Buy a copy of Brigid Berlin Polaroids or a $20 gift card in-store at Strand's main floor registers or at the door to attend this event. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Brigid Berlin Polaroids

This event will be located in the Strand's Shop at Club Monaco, at 160 5th Avenue, between 20th and 21st Streets. Guests must purchase a copy of Love Style Life from Strand to enter the signing line. description:
The Dogist himself, Elias Weiss Friedman, comes to the Strand! He'll be talking with Stacie Grissom (of the BarkPost newsletter) about pooches and pictures in celebration of the release of The Dogist: Photographic Encounters with 1,000 Dogs.

In honor of October--Adopt a Shelter Dog Month--the ASPCA will be there too, with a few kindly canines in need of a home.

Please leave your own dogs at home--BarkBox will be on hand with materials for you to build your own pup-pampering parcel to bring them so they don’t miss out. We'll also have beer from Radiant Pig Craft Beers so owners can toast to their absent friends!

Buy a copy of The Dogist or a $15 gift card at the main floor registers or at the door in order to attend this event. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.

description:

Philip-Lorca diCorcia has worked in both staged and informal portraiture and street photography, achieving alternately hilarious and heartbreaking, sacred and profane beauty. His latest work, Hustlers, focuses on the lives of male prostitutes in Los Angeles.

For more Steidl x Strand events, click here.

Please purchase a copy of Marzia’s Family or a copy of Hustlers in-store at Strand to attend this signing. The authors will sign other Steidl titles purchased at Strand. Be sure to hang onto your receipt.

For more Steidl x Strand events, click here.

description:
Part poetry, part photography, part collage, Magic Mountain/Home Movies is all James Franco. Containing new work as well as reworked elements of his RISD thesis in visual art, it’s an unclassifiable post-modernist workout that takes fame and photography (specifically of the paparazzi variety) among its subjects. James will be at the Strand once again to sign copies of the work and meet his fans.

Buy a copy of Magic Mountain/Home Movies in-store at Strand to attend this event. This event will be held on Strand's main floor at 828 Broadway. The line for the signing will form beginning at 5:30 PM on the day of the event in front of Strand on Broadway.

For more Steidl x Strand events, click here.

description:
This year’s breakout Sundance documentary The Wolfpack delved into the submerged world of New York City’s Angulo family, a sheltered group under their father’s strict instructions not to leave the house. Seen haunting the Lower East Side in abeyance of the rule, in suits and Ray-Bans like a Tarantino poster come to life, their strange and stilted world was pieced together from moments in films they’d seen in the confines of their 16th-floor home.

Dan Martensen, a fashion and portrait photographer whose commercial work has appeared in Vogue, GQ, and more, and whose travels have seen him document life in the Southwest, was admitted to the fold of the Angulo brothers. His keen eye and naturalistic sensibility depicts their imaginative straining against the confines of their upbringing, and his Wolves Like Us is a collaborative portrait of their interactions with each other and the outside world.

Dan will be joined in conversation by Jennifer Pastore, Photography Director of WSJ Magazine.

Buy a copy of Wolves Like Us or a $15 gift card at the Strand's main floor registers or at the door to attend the event.. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Dan Martensen

description:
Peter Guralnick, award-winning biographer of Elvis, critic and historian of American popular music, spins the story of Sam Phillips: The Man Who Invented Rock and Roll. Phillips was present at the creation, founding Sun Records, discovering Presley and nurturing Orbison, Cash, and many more. Peter will be joined in conversation by author and television producer Bill Flanagan.

Buy a copy of Sam Phillips or a $15 gift card in-store at Strand's main floor registers or at the door to attend this event. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Peter Guralnick

The author of the Wes Anderson Collection brings his obsessive eye to all seven seasons of the modern classic TV series. He’ll be joined by fellow Draperites Megan Abbott (Edgar Award-winning author of The Fever) and Roberta and Deborah Lipp (of "the best Mad Men site on the Internet" per Seitz himself, Basket of Kisses).

Buy a copy of Mad Men Carousel or a $15 gift card in-store at Strand's main floor registers or at the door to attend this event. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.

description:
Grownups may know B.J. Novak from his deadpan wit and biting satire (as shown in One More Thing as well as onscreen in The Office and The Mindy Project), but don’t let them fool you--this one's for the kids. B.J. will be at the Strand to read his hilarious Book With No Pictures, all the way through--no matter what it makes him say!

Buy a copy of The Book With No Pictures  or a $15 gift card at a register in the store to attend this event. Hold on to your receipt, and hop in line on Broadway. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street. Stroller parking will be available.

description:
Writer and journalist Simon Winchester chats about his new book, Pacific, an enthralling biography of the Pacific Ocean and its role in the modern world, exploring our relationship with this imposing force of nature.

Buy a copy of Pacific or a $15 gift card in-store at the Strand's main floor registers or at the door to attend this event. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.

description:
Join us in the rare book room for a special night with all-star illustrator and storyteller Maira Kalman, celebrating her latest book, Beloved Dog. Maira is the author of And the Pursuit of Happiness and The Principles of Uncertainty, and illustrator for Michael Pollan's Food Rules and the best-selling edition of Strunk & White's The Elements of Style.

description:

Their continued work in large-format portraiture renders environments as disparate as barber shops, delis, furriers, and more in all their faded glory. Don’t miss this conversation on photography, New York, and the passage of time.
