description:
You and three of your smartest friends will form a team in order to prove once and for all that you are the ultimate fans of The Hunger Games. A citizen of the Capitol will be on hand to host 4 rounds of questions varying in category and difficulty. If you survive, your team will be the proud winners of a set of 4 tickets to the movie and 4 tickets to The Exhibition in Times Square. Prizes will be given to second and third place teams as well. Please take a moment to read over the rules of the game here, before you volunteer as tribute.

Snacks will be provided by Insomnia Cookies. This event is in partnership with The Hunger Games: The Exhibition.

Purchase a $15 gift card at the door to participate in this event (and make sure your teammates do the same). The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.

description:
Join us at the Village Community School for a very special event, celebrating the Pushcart Prize’s 40th Anniversary and launching the release of The Pushcart Prize XL - Best of Small Presses 2016. For this big birthday, an all-star lineup will read from their work: fiction writers Zadie Smith, Colum McCann, and Ben Marcus; poets Sharon Olds and Philip Schultz; poet/memoirist Mary Karr; and poet/novelist and president of Farrar, Straus and Giroux, Jonathan Galassi. Pushcart Prize’s founder and editor Bill Henderson will introduce the evening.

This event is in partnership with The Writers Studio.

Tickets will be $10 at the door followed by book signings. Buy titles by these authors, as well as The Pushcart Prize XL, at the event. The event will be located at the Village Community School at 272 West 10th Street between Greenwich St. & Washington St.

She'll be talking about the artistic, culinary, and cultural history of the fabled lane where Parisian street life reaches its apogee. Attendees will also receive a print of the Rue des Martyrs by Carol Gillot.

description:
Join NYC street photographer Robert Herman for a conversation and Q&A to celebrate the release of The Phone Book, his highly anticipated collection. On the heels of The New Yorkers, his stunning debut collection of decades’s worth of restored Kodachrome all taken here in New York, The Phone Book flips the script--it's Herman's first iPhone-only photobook, taken all over the world. 

Robert will be joined in conversation by Sean Corcoran, Curator of Prints and Photographs at the Museum of the City of New York.

description:
Join For the Makers founder Janet Crowther and her team for a little book-themed crafting at Strand this holiday season, perfect for a gift--for a loved one or for yourself!

During this workshop, you’ll create unique boxes from authentic vintage books, straight from the shelves of the Rare Book Room. This experienced team will walk you through the process and offer expert advice while you and your pals craft the night away.

We’ll also have hot tea and wine on hand, along with delicious treats from Macaron Parlour.

Register for the workshop in-store at Strand's main floor registers or at the door to claim your spot. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Holiday DIY Workshop: For the Makers II

description:
Susanne König, director and buyer at PowerHouse Books, knows from fine dining--at their Arena, they’ve hosted dozens of culinary roundtables and parties for a diverse array of Brooklyn chefs and restaurants. She’ll be at Strand’s pop-up shop at Industry City’s WantedDesign location to sign copies of Made In Brooklyn, which features profiles of the borough’s contemporary food lodestars!

This event will be located at WantedDesign’s pop-up space in Industry City, Sunset Park, 220 36th Street, Brooklyn, NY 11232. Copies of Made In Brooklyn will be available on-site.
title: Made in Brooklyn @ IC Store WantedDesign

description:
This compilation showcases some of the most memorable photographs published in Vogue from 1972 to 2002. It features the work of Grace Coddington, creative director of Vogue and one of the leading forces in fashion today. First published in 2002, Grace: Thirty Years of Fashion at Vogue has long been out of print and is highly sought-after in the rare books market.

Note: Grace will sign copies of Grace: Thirty Years of Fashion at Vogue. No memorabilia will be signed. Pictures are permitted.

Purchase a copy of Grace: Thirty Years of Fashion at Vogue in-store at Strand's main floor registers or at the door to attend the event. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Grace Coddington

description:
Rave reviews and accolades flooded in after Spring Awakening by Deaf West Theater came to Broadway this fall. Join us in the Rare Book Room for an intimate conversation with key players from the team that produced “not so much a revival as a reinvention” of the modern classic (Variety):

  • Ken Davenport, producer
  • DJ Kurs, artistic director of Deaf West Theater
  • Sandra Mae Frank, Wendla
  • Katie Boeck, voice of Wendla
  • Daniel N. Durant, Moritz
  • Alex Boniello, voice of Moritz

The panel will be moderated by Jill Rafson, director of new play development of Roundabout Theatre Company, and associate producer for Roundabout Underground.

We’re launching our brand-new Strand Ovation series with one of the biggest shows on Broadway. Don’t miss this one-of a kind opportunity to hear how Spring Awakening came to be!

Your attendance at this event will automatically enter you into a raffle to win a poster signed by the cast of Spring Awakening as well as a lottery for a pair of free tickets to see the show!

Buy a $15 gift card to attend this event. Please note that payment is required for all online event orders at the time of checkout. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Strand Ovation Series: Spring Awakening on Broadway

description:
Join For the Makers founder Janet Crowther and her team for a little book-themed crafting at Strand this holiday season, perfect for a gift--for a loved one or for yourself!

During this workshop, you’ll create a set of delicate paper mache ornaments from books to decorate your home. This experienced team will walk you through the process and offer expert advice while you and your pals craft the night away.

We’ll also have hot tea and wine on hand, along with delicious treats from Macaron Parlour.

Register for the workshop in-store in the Rare Book Room. The workshop costs $50, but please note that price includes materials for the workshop and a $15 gift card to Strand (just in time for your holiday shopping)! The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Holiday DIY Workshop: For the Makers I

description:
Pulitzer and National Book Award-winning biographer T.J. Stiles joins us for an exclusive chat in the rare book room celebrating the release of his new book, Custer's Trials, a radical, brilliant new account of the life of General George Armstrong Custer. T.J. will be joined in conversation by literary critic and essayist Brenda Wineapple, author of Ecstatic Nation.

Buy a copy of Custer’s Trials or a $15 gift card in-store at the main floor registers or at the door to attend this event. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: T.J. Stiles + Brenda Wineapple

description:
Hiroshi Sugimoto, acclaimed photographer and architect, comes to Strand in celebration of Seascapes, his latest collection of photographs. This meditative second volume in his decade-spanning work with the ocean at its most placid features shots from around the world and across the spectrum, from fog-choked vistas to breathtakingly clear horizons.

Mr. Sugimoto will be joined by Darius Himes, the International Head of Photographs at Christie’s.

Please note that only copies of Seascapes will be signed.

Buy a copy of Seascapes or a $20 gift card in-store at Strand's main floor registers or at the door to attend this event. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Hiroshi Sugimoto

description:
RuPaul's best friend and Drag Race judge extraordinaire Michelle Visage graces our Rare Book Room for a fun and ferocious evening. The vibrant performer and host will speak exclusively about her new book, The Diva Rules: Ditch the Drama, Find Your Strength, and Sparkle Your Way to the Top.

Michelle will be joined in conversation by the Dean of Drag herself, DJ, perfomer, and founder of Wigstock, Lady Bunny.

Buy a copy of The Diva Rules or a $15 gift card in-store at Strand's main floor registers or at the door to attend this event. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Michelle Visage

description:
In 1965, Gay Talese traveled to L.A. for Esquire to write a major profile on Frank Sinatra, but arrived to find Sinatra sick and unwilling to be interviewed. Undeterred, Talese observed the star from a careful distance and interviewed his friends, associates, family, and hangers-on. His profile went down in history as a tour de force of literary nonfiction.

In this signed and numbered edition, "Frank Sinatra Has a Cold" is given new life. Letterpress printed by TASCHEN, the text is paired with photographs by Phil Stern, facsimile reproductions of manuscript pages, and correspondence from the author’s archive. Advance copies of the book are being flown in for the event and stock is limited. Pre-orders are recommended to secure a copy.

David Brancaccio from NPR’s Marketplace will be joining Gay in conversation. David has just launched a podcast series with Esquire magazine exploring classic nonfiction works and their cultural resonance. 

Please join us in the Rare Book Room to celebrate Ol’ Blue Eye’s 100th birthday with an intimate affair with author Gay Talese. Arrive early at 6:30 for wine and charcuterie provided by Eataly. 

Please purchase a copy of Frank Sinatra Has a Cold or a $25 gift card in-store at Strand's main floor registers or at the door to attend this event. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Gay Talese on Frank Sinatra

description:
Jennifer Wright, sex-and-dating columnist for the New York Observer and Post, chronicles the saltiest splits of all time in It Ended Badly: Thirteen of the Worst Breakups in History. She'll be joined by the New York Times's Sarah Maslin Nir. We’ll also have a few drinks to try courtesy of Small Girls PR.

Buy a copy of It Ended Badly or a $15 gift card in order to attend this event. Please note that payment is required for all online event orders at the time of checkout. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Jennifer Wright + Sarah Maslin Nir

description:
Strand hosts the years-awaited, record-breaking novel, City on Fire, by The Millions' Garth Risk Hallberg. Discover the story behind the making of one of the most eagerly anticipated novels in publishing history, an epic slice of NYC life from the heights of power to the depths of street life revolving around the blackout of ‘77.

Buy a copy of City on Fire or a $15 gift card at the main floor registers or at the door to attend this event. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Garth Risk Hallberg

description:
Punk rock icon Richard Hell joins Strand once again, this time for the official New York City launch of his brand new essay collection, Massive Pissed Love. Punk buffs won’t want to miss this evening with the man behind the Voidoids and other seminal groups, whose wide-ranging sensibility informs these pieces from the last decade and a half, drawn from Village Voice, Art in America, the New York Times, and others.

Buy a copy of Massive Pissed Love or a $15 gift card from the main floor registers or at the door in order to attend this event. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Richard Hell

description:
After chronicling The American Way of Poverty and writing on politics at home and abroad for the New Yorker, Atlantic, Village Voice, and many others, Sasha Abramsky turns his keen eye on his own grandfather in The House of Twenty Thousand Books. A Jewish historian, a socialist, a collector (hence the pentadactylic hoard of the title), Chimen Abramsky’s long life in the short twentieth century (and into the twenty-first) is vividly chronicled and analyzed by Sasha in this tale of a lost leftist.

Sasha will be joined in conversation by Robin Blackburn, former editor of the New Left Review and professor at the New School and the University of Essex.

Buy a copy of The House of Twenty Thousand Books or a $15 gift card at Strand's main floor registers or at the event in order to attend. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Sasha Abramsky + Robin Blackburn

description:
Neil Strauss, New York Times bestselling author of the controversial pickup artist book The Game, visits Strand for an exclusive conversation surrounding the launch of his most personal story yet: The Truth. In this book, Neil grapples with social ills that can plague our personal relationships. He’ll be joined in conversation by Christopher Ryan, PhD, co-author of Sex at Dawn, and Esther Perel, author of Mating in Captivity.

Please purchase a copy of The Truth or a $15 gift card from the main floor registers or at the door to attend this event. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Neil Strauss

description:
Best American Comics series editor Bill Kartalopoulos leads a dynamic, fun panel with selected artists from the Best American Comics 2015 anthology! Joining Bill are the longtime New Yorker artist Roz Chast, graphic memoirist of Lucky fame Gabrielle Bell, and the experimental frame-changer Blaise Larmee for a fascinating look at some of the work that went into the past year in words and pictures.

Buy a copy of the featured event book or a $15 Strand gift card at the main floor registers or at the door in order to attend this event.
title: The Best American Comics 2015

description:
Join Caitlin Doughty, mortician, blogger, and author, to celebrate the paperback release of her hit book, Smoke Gets In Your Eyes: And Other Lessons from the Crematory. Caitlin is the creator and curator of The Order of The Good Death, a group of fellow morticians as well as artists and intellectuals that investigates our “death phobic culture” and strives to demystify the inevitable end. From funerary rites throughout history to jewelry of hair and bone, follow your guide down into the world of the macabre and mortified--without leaving the Rare Book Room.

Buy a copy of Smoke Gets In Your Eyes or a $15 Strand gift card at the main floor registers or at the door in order to attend this event.
title: Caitlin Doughty

description:
Mary Louise Wilson - of Grey Gardens, Louis C.K.'s Louie, and Broadway's On the Twentieth Century, just to name a few - brings her wry, fabulously unsentimental voice to our Rare Book Room for a conversation celebrating the release of her book, My First Hundred Years in Show Business. Mary Louise will be joined by stage and screen titan Alan Cumming, for a night that film and theater buffs would be sorry to miss!

Please purchase a copy of the featured event book or a $15 Strand gift card at the main floor registers or at the door in order to attend this event. Please note that payment is required for all online event orders at the time of checkout. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Mary Louise Wilson + Alan Cumming

description:
Join Grumpy Cat at the Strand for the premiere of her latest book, No-It-All: Everything You Need to No, ahead of its release date! The cantakerous kitty will be pawtographing copies and taking pictures.

Pawtographed copies of No-It-All will be given to purchasing customers at the end of the line. No other titles will be pawtographed. Photos may be taken from the line, but no flash, please.

Please purchase a copy of No-It-All in-store at the main floor registers to attend this event. The line for this event will form beginning at 5:00 PM on the day of the event in front of Strand on Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Grumpy Cat

description:
Join Wisconsin English professor Ramzi Fawaz as he discusses his brand-new, paradigm-shifting study of the comic book form, The New Mutants: Superheroes and the Radical Imagination of American Comics. Dissecting the history of the medium through the lens of queer theory, Fawaz delves into the creation and composition of such seminal series as X-Men and Fantastic 4 and finds a history of selves deconstructed and rebuilt on the page.

Joining Fawaz in discussion is Phil Jimenez, acclaimed artist artist and writer known for his work on Infinite Crisis, The Invisibles, Wonder Woman, and many other beloved series.

To attend this event, please purchase a copy of The New Mutants or a $15 gift card in-store at Strand's main floor registers or at the door. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Ramzi Fawaz + Phil Jimenez

description:
Best-selling author, filmmaker, fashion editor and artist Liz Goldwyn supports her story collection, Sporting Guide: Los Angeles, 1897--a historical fiction inspired by the 1890s Los Angeles demimonde, where real consumer guides were printed (think Zagat and Yelp!) for making acquaintance with ladies of the night.

Liz will be joined by the Paris Review’s Sadie Stein. Don't miss out on Sporting Guide's official New York City launch! (Photo: Keegan Allen)

Buy a copy of Sporting Guide or a $15 gift card from the main floor registers or at the door to attend this event. Please note that payment is required for all online event orders at the time of checkout. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Liz Goldwyn

description:
As a veteran stand-up comic, an actor in beloved movies and series like The State, Stella, Wet Hot American Summer, and more, and a New York Times best-selling author, Michael Ian Black has seen a lot. Which is why the surprise of seeing middle age rear its ugly head in the form of a grim medical diagnosis was so, well, surprising. In Navel Gazing: True Tales of Bodies, Mostly Mine (but also my mom's, which I know sounds weird), he trains his irreverent comedic eye on the foibles of the forty-and-up set. For a different perspective on middle-aged man in general, and on one very funny middle-aged man specifically, join Michael and Slate’s editor-in-chief and Culture Gabfest co-host Julia Turner for a conversation in the Rare Book Room.

Buy a copy of Navel Gazing or a $15 gift card in-store at Strand's main floor register or at the door to attend this event. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Michael Ian Black + Julia Turner

description:
Join us for 5 awesome rounds of book-themed trivia! A uniquely competitive and highly engaging event, Strand has partnered with professional trivia event production company TrivWorks to create a raucous, laugh-filled evening which no NYC book-lover will want to miss!

Bring your smartest friends and your knowledge of the greatest bestsellers, authors, fiction, nonfiction and books in pop culture the Rare Book Room for a chance to win Strand prizes and the title of the Ultimate Bibliophile.

Check out the rules here.

Buy a $10 gift card at Strand's main floor registers or at the door to attend this event. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street. Be ready with your team name!
title: Shelf Obsessed: Strand’s Ultimate Literary Trivia Night

description:
Twenty years ago, Lisa Nichols was a single mother, dependent on public assistance, working dead-end jobs and living in despair. Determined to leave scarcity behind, she resolved to change her life. She’s transformed the negative behaviors that held her back into a life rich in possibility, and in Abundance Now: Amplify Your Life & Achieve Prosperity Today, she shares the secrets that can help anyone achieve a fulfilled existence.

Lisa will be joined in conversation by fellow motivational superstar, 2014 Woman of the Year from the National Association of Professional Women, and lifestyle & relationships editor at Essence magazine, Charreah Jackson.

Buy a copy of Abundance Now or a $15 gift card in-store at the main floor registers or at the door to attend this event. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Lisa Nichols

description:
Join Maria Konnikova, bestselling author and New Yorker columnist, as she looks into The Confidence Game: Why We Fall for It . . . Every Time. From Melville to The Usual Suspects to Bernie Madoff, the art of the con in fact and fiction remains enduringly fascinating. Learn the ins and outs of why we’re wired to get roped in, fleeced, and spun back out, from one of our leading psychological storytellers.

Maria will be joined in conversation by filmmaker, producer, and writer Brian Koppelman, whose work on the screenplay for Ocean’s Thirteen places him squarely in the lineage of the con-fascinated.

Buy a copy of The Confidence Game or a $15 gift card in-store at Strand's main floor registers or at the door. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Maria Konnikova

description:
From the Tony-Award winning director of Les Misérables comes the intimate new musical Daddy Long Legs. Based on the classic novel which inspired the 1955 movie starring Fred Astaire—a beloved tale in the spirit of Jane Austen, The Brontë Sisters, and "Downton Abbey"—this heartwarming Cinderella story about a witty and winsome young woman and her mysterious benefactor has charmed audiences of all ages from Los Angeles to London.  Critics and audiences are charmed by its "echoes of She Loves Me and top-notch performances," making it "one of the most enthralling, entertaining and moving love stories on the American musical theater stage."

Join Megan McGinnis (Jerusha) and Adam Halpin (Jervis) as they talk about the songs, the staging, and the storybook romance at the heart of the play. Strand’s Ovation series is back for a witty and wonderful evening with the cast of this “little gem."

Buy a $15 gift card in-store at Strand's main floor registers or at the door to attend this event. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Strand Ovation Series: Daddy Long Legs

description:
Slate correspondent Justin Peters comes to Strand to launch The Idealist: Aaron Swartz and the Rise of Free Culture on the Internet. He’ll be talking with James Marcus, author, translator, and deputy editor of Harper’s, about Swartz’s tumultuous life as a coding wunderkind, his co-founding and development of Reddit and Creative Commons, and the federal case against him that allegedly pushed him to suicide.

Buy a copy of The Idealist or a $15 gift card in-store at Strand's main floor register or at the door to attend this event. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Justin Peters + James Marcus

description:
Judy Batalion, debut author of White Walls: A Memoir About Motherhood, Daughterhood, and the Mess In Between, and Sue Shapiro, New School professor and bestselling author of What’s Never Said, host a panel on the Secrets of Book Publishing, sponsored by Harvardwood. Join luminary editors, agents, and authors as they spill inside secrets about how to break into the publishing industry in the new year.

Panelists include:

  • New York Times editor Peter Catapano (editor of The Stone Reader)
  • Beacon Press book editor Rakia Clark
  • Literary agent Alia Hanna Habib
  • NYU professor Frank Flaherty (author of The Elements of Story)
  • Tablet editor Wayne Hoffman (author of the novel An Older Man)
  • Vogue editor Lauren Mechling (author of the novel Dream Life)

Buy a copy of White Walls or a $15 gift card in-store at Strand's main floor registers or at the door to attend this event. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Judy Batalion + Sue Shapiro

description:
In the tradition of Elizabeth Wurtzel and Augusten Burroughs, Sam Lansky’s debut memoir, The Gilded Razor, tells a story of chaotic addiction, botched recovery, self-harm, self-doubt, and transcendence. His promising young life torn to shreds by prescription painkillers and a reckless romantic life, Lansky found himself sloughing off a dangerous overdose, in need of serious help--but the stations on his road to recovery only provided him with new stages on which to act out. The Gilded Razor is an unsparing plunge into a heedless young mind, one that spans the country and the internal life of a young man refusing, and finally assenting, to know himself.

Sam will be joined in conversation by Aaron Hicklin, editor-in-chief of Out Magazine.

Buy a copy of The Gilded Razor or a $15 gift card in-store at Strand's main floor registers or at the door to attend this event. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Sam Lansky + Aaron Hicklin

description:
For a little pre-Valentine's Day cheer, we're welcoming our favorite chocolatiers, Mast Brothers, to celebrate the holiday with a small chocolate tasting. Join us and some of their staff as we taste some of their newest creations.

There's nothing quite like a Mast Brothers chocolate bar—filled with nuances like a trace of vanilla and smoke or a citrusy sweetness, their bars are a far departure from the chocolate of your childhood. When we went to a tasting at their factory in Williamsburg, we were floored. We loved the experience so much that we wanted it for our customers.

Join Strand and Mast Brothers for a FREE tasting! Experts from our friends at Mast Brothers will be on our store's main floor to pass out samples, talk about their different varieties, and answer any questions you may have about the chocolate.

Samples are free, but you’ll be able to buy their products in store if you love what you taste! This tasting will be held on Strand Book Store’s Main Floor at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Mast Brothers Chocolate Tasting

description:
Tommy Wallach, Brooklyn-based musician and author of the best-selling We All Looked Up, comes to the Strand for a night of stories and songs to celebrate his brand-new novel! Thanks for the Trouble is a story of first and last loves that blurs the line between real and make-believe. Tommy will be in the Rare Book Room to discuss the characters, the story, and how it all came together with Adam Silvera, fellow chart-topping author of More Happy Than Not.

Buy a copy of Thanks for the Trouble or a $15 gift card in-store at Strand's main floor registers or at the door to attend this event. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Tommy Wallach

description:
Bring your little ones for a Strand storytime special with the Diverging Elements Theatre Company. Their adaptation of Angelica Cheri’s A Letter to Auntie Rosa tells the inspiring story of Rosa Parks’ historic stand against entrenched racism from the point of view of her young niece, and brings home a message of compassion and strength. Featuring a craft and songs by RANGE a capella, the show stars Betty Etheredge, featuring the voices of Izzie Flores, Angela Travino, and Jeremiah Haley, and directed by Sammy Lopez, it’s an insightful and delightful way to learn the story of a remarkable woman.

This free event will be located on Strand’s second floor, in the children’s department. Please note that there will be two performances, one starting at 2:00 PM, and another starting at 3:30 PM.
title: Diverging Elements Theatre Co.: A Letter to Auntie Rosa

description:
Clara Parkes’ life in wool and yarn began when she left Silicon Valley to pursue a slower, more equanimitous life on the coast of Maine. Since then, she’s founded the Knitter’s Review and written several best-selling books and toured the country uniting circles and individual crafters. Now she’s dropping by the Strand to share the stories of her travels and the people she’s met in Knitlandia: A Knitter Sees the World. Cozy up for an evening dedicated to the joys of mending and weaving, with warm drinks courtesy of courtesy of Harney & Sons Fine Teas.

Buy a copy of Knitlandia or a $15 gift card to attend this event. Please note that payment is required for all online event orders at the time of checkout. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Clara Parkes - Knitlandia

description:
Laura Lane and Angela Spera, the comics behind the hit podcast and bestselling book This is Why You’re Single, come to Strand for a night of commiseration and comedy. They’ll be joined by an all-star panel of readers:

  • Chiara Atik, playwright and dating columnist and author of Modern Dating: A Field Guide
  • Jennifer Wright, author of It Ended Badly
  • Jasmine Lobe, the Observer's J-Spot sex columnist
  • Julie Vadnal, Senior Editor at Cosmopolitan

Whether you’ve been through it all or you’re looking to avoid the pitfalls, you won’t want to miss the chance to cackle and commiserate over cocktails on the eve of the most reviled, most anticipated day in the romantic calendar--Valentine’s Day.

Please note that this event will be 21 and over.

Buy a copy of This is Why You’re Single or a $15 gift card at Strand's main floor registers or at the door to attend this event. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: This is Why You're Single Hosts a Heart-to-Heart: An Evening With Some Very Funny Women

description:
Kia Corthron, American playwright, screenwriter, and activist celebrates the highly anticipated release of her first novel, The Castle Cross the Magnet Carter. Her book sweeps American history from 1941 to the twenty-first century through the lives of four men--two white brothers from rural Alabama, and two black brothers from small-town Maryland.

Kia will be joined in conversation by Robin D.G. Kelley, one of the most distinguished experts on African American studies in the nation.

Buy a copy of The Castle Cross the Magnet Carter or a $15 gift card in-store at Strand's main floor registers or at the door to attend this event. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Kia Corthron + Robin D. G. Kelley

description:
Once again, in the spirit of _____, it’s time for _____!

...industrialism, grape stomping
...wildlife conservation, fraternal hazing

Valentine’s Day, Cards Against Humanity!!

That’s right--get pricked by the arrow of prickliness and round up your closest enemies for some snacks, laughs, and all-around debased fun. Bring your teammates or meet them here--we’ll have prizes to raffle off, along with booze (from our friends at Beer Table) and food (from the always-delectable Sigmund's Pretzels) to keep you going till the last card is played. Hosted by John Sullivan of the largest CAH meetup on the planet, you won’t want to miss this race to the bottom.

Buy a $15 gift card in-store at Strand's main floor registers or at the door to attend this event. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: We Hate the Same Stuff: Cards Against Humanity @ Strand

description:
Join Adam JK, Brooklyn-based author, artist, and designer, for a signing and pop-up shop at WantedDesign’s location in Industry City. He’ll have toys and trinkets from his Gift Shop, as well as copies of his 1 Page at a Time diary/journal/calendar/creative companion/whatever-it-is to sign. Fudge artisans Izzy & Tallulah will be there as well with delicious samples.

 

This event will be located at the IC store by WantedDesign, Sunset Park, 220 36th Street, Brooklyn, NY 11232 (subway: D, N, & R, 36th St. Station). Copies of 1 Page at a Time will be available on-site.
title: Adam JK @ IC Store by WantedDesign

description:
The Whiteness of the Whale brings together Paul Graham’s three bodies of American photographs: American Night, a shimmer of possibility and The Present, made from 1998 to 2011. These 3 remarkable photographic series reflect upon the social fabric of contemporary America, whilst trying to find something closer to the experience of being and seeing in the world today.

He will be joined in conversation by Nicholas Dawidoff.

Rare indeed is the opportunity to meet Graham. He will sign previous collections and works as well. No memorabilia will be signed.

Buy a copy of The Whiteness of the Whale or a $20 gift card in-store at Strand's main floor registers or at the door to attend this event. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Paul Graham

description:
Longtime NPR host Diane Rehm speaks about the death of her husband and her life in his absence in her new memoir, On My Own. She’ll be joined in conversation by WNYC’s Anna Sale, host of the Death, Sex & Money podcast.

Please note that Diane will sign (no personalizations) only copies of On My Own. Photos are permitted from the signing line.

Buy a copy of On My Own or a $15 gift card in-store at Strand's main floor registers or at the door to attend this event. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Diane Rehm + Anna Sale

description:
The Lost Time Accidents is the triumphant, outsize return of Whiting Award-winning novelist John Wray. Coming on the heels of the best-selling Lowboy, it’s a wild ride through time, space, history, and science, with a burning core of heartbreak. Telling the story of a man unstuck in time, it’s a blisteringly inventive work that cements Wray’s reputation as a vanguard talent in American fiction.

John will be joined in conversation by another wide-ranging 21st-century talent, New York Times columnist and novelist Colson Whitehead, He's the author most recently of The Noble Hustle, as well as Zone One, The Colossus of New York, and sundry other modern classics, the recipient of Guggenheim and MacArthur fellowships, and a fellow Whiting Award winner.

Copies of The Lost Time Accidents will be available at the event, located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: John Wray + Colson Whitehead

description:
Bedlam’s Sense and Sensibility weaves a brilliant work of theatre in a flexible, raw space in this contemporary reappraisal of the classic Jane Austen gifted us so long ago. Join the creative minds and performers behind this innovative production to discuss their process and work. Writer Kate Hamill and actress Andrus Nichols will lead a group of the cast and creative team in a discussion of their wildly inventive adaptation of the beloved novel.

You may “wish, as well as everybody else, to be perfectly happy; but, like everybody else, it must be in [your] own way.” Come find your happiness at Strand with the newest edition of the Strand Ovation Series.

This event is FREE. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Jane Austen's Sense and Sensibility by BEDLAM

description:
Dr. James Doty, head of Stanford’s Center for Compassion and Altruism Research and Education (CCARE), has spent his career looking into the mind, learning what makes it tick, its limits and its capabilities. With Into the Magic Shop: A Neurosurgeon's Quest to Discover the Mysteries of the Brain and the Secrets of the Heart, he tells his life story, from poverty-stricken childhood to the forefront of medicine, and delves into the connection between who and what we are--between the scientific facts of our brains and the truths of our hearts.

Joining Dr. Doty in conversation will be joined by the internationally renowned Rabbi Irwin Kula, president of the National Jewish Center for Learning and Leadership.

Buy a copy of Into the Magic Shop or a $15 gift card in-store at Strand's main floor register or at the door to attend this event. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Dr. James Doty + Rabbi Irwin Kula

description:
In the spirit of Mindy Kaling, Kelly Oxford, and Sarah Silverman, join us for the launch of this compulsively readable and outrageously funny memoir of growing up as a fish out of water, finding your voice, and embracing your inner crazy-person, from popular actress, writer, director, and comedian Bonnie McFarlane. She’ll be talking about You’re Better Than Me: A Memoir with fellow comedian Jim Gaffigan.

Buy a copy of You're Better Than Me or a $15 gift card in order to attend this event. Please note that payment is required for all online event orders at the time of checkout. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Bonnie McFarlane + Jim Gaffigan

description:
Spring may not be springing yet, but a bumper crop of new novels is sprouting up! Join Igoni Barrett, author of the brand-new Blackass, Idra Novey, author of Ways to Disappear, and Mark Doten, author of The Infernal, as they read from and discuss their first forays into long-form fiction. The conversation will be moderated by fiction and non-fiction author Tobias Carroll.

This event is open to the public. If you're interested, please let us know and RSVP to events@strandbooks.com. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Debut Novelists Spotlight

description:
Daniel Clowes’ beloved comics and graphic novels have reached millions of fans right where they live, and beyond: from the stultifying suburban sprawl of Ghost World to the bleak-yet-uplifiting Mister Wonderful, he’s delved into the lives of strivers and cynics, turning up their darkest thoughts and their most generous impulses, often in the same panel. He returns to the page with Patience, a gorgeous trip into sci-fi psychedelia, unlike anything he’s done before, yet simultaneously and unmistakably “Clowesian.”

Join Daniel Clowes in conversation with Nicole Rudick, managing editor of the Paris Review, for a celebration of the release of Patience!

Buy a copy of Patience or a $15 gift card in-store at Strand's main floor registers or at the door to attend this event. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Daniel Clowes + Nicole Rudick

description:
The Strand helps launch New York’s 2016 Teen Author Festival with readings from:

  • Libba Bray, author of Going Bovine, the Gemma Doyle trilogy, and others
  • Tim Federle, author of Better Nate Than Ever and the upcoming Great American Whatever
  • Jenny Han, author of P.S. I Still Love You and others
  • Barry Lyga, author of the I Hunt Killers trilogy, Mangaman, and others
  • Goldy Moldavsky, author of the forthcoming Kill the Boy Band
  • Len Vlahos, author of The Scar Boys and the forthcoming Scar Girl 
  • Luanne Rice, author of The Secret Language of Sisters

We'll also have signed copies of Jesse Andrews' Me and Earl and the Dying Girl!

Also on hand to moderate the evening will be superstar author of Every Day, Will Grayson, Will Grayson, and countless other fantastic books, David Levithan!

This event will be free and open to the public. Signing is predicated on purchase of at least one book by any of the authors present. RSVP to events@strandbooks.com
title: NYC Teen Author Festival Kickoff

description:
Just over ten years ago, John Perkins’ Confessions of an Economic Hit Man shocked readers with its tales of financial marauding across the globe, detailing the corporate greed that drove high-powered firms to coerce developing countries into enormous debt. Now he’s updated the modern classic with 15 new chapters of material bringing it up to date with the last tumultuous decade. Join us in the Rare Book Room for a far-reaching conversation about American avarice at home and abroad.

Buy a copy of New Confessions of an Economic Hit Man or a $15 gift card in-store at Strand's main floor registers or at the door to attend this event. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: John Perkins

description:
Jim McDermott’s Bitter is the Wind is a touching coming of age story tracing the lives of father and son. It is a meditation on the purpose of work, the meaning of freedom, and the satisfactions of parental sacrifice. McDermott sheds new light on the American working class and its aching desires for financial security, recognition, and respect. Join us at Strand to celebrate the arrival of a brand-new voice in fiction.

Buy a copy of Bitter is the Wind or a $15 gift card in-store at Strand's main floor registers or at the door to attend. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Jim McDermott

description:
Notoriously good readers and pretty okay writers, Michael Wolf and Colin O’Brien, host a sort of adult version of Reading Rainbow/drunk college writing workshop complete with free drinks, low-brow fiction, high-brow erotica and celebrity guests performing stand up, storytelling, music and more. Join them for a hilarious night of literature that will leave you wanting to pick up a pen and start writing…. concerned letters to The Strand questioning Michael and Colin’s qualifications to run a show about books.

Guest stars for this installment of PageMasters include Jo Firestone, Catherine Cohen, Mary Houlihan, and Graham Smith!

Beer will be generously provided by the Bronx Brewery. Wine will generously be provided by City Winery. 

These two dashing young comedians (often referred to as the George Clooneys of the New York comedy scene) and together make up the comedy duo Nancy. They've performed at San Francisco Sketchfest, Comedy Central 'Comics to Watch' Showcase, MTV, The Upright Citizens Brigade Theater, Brooklyn Comedy Festival, NYC Sketchfest, the Boston Comedy Arts Festival, Austin Sketchfest, and The Special Without Brett Davis as well as running a monthly show at Union Hall. You can listen to some their album Nancy Screams the Hits here or watch web series called Triplets of Kings County here. They also produce the monthly sketch show O.S.F.U.G. at The Upright Citizens Brigade Theatre and the fake author reading show (and soon to be podcast) Literati at Union Hall. Busy guys. 

Tickets for this event are $10 and include a Strand gift card for that very amount. You can purchase them at the main floor registers or at the door of the event. Please note that payment is required for all online event orders at the time of checkout. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: PageMasters with Colin & Michael

description:
Drawing on his unique experience as a founder of Occupy Wall Street, Micah White explores the theory, tactics and principles of social change in The End of Protest: A New Playbook for Revolution. This refreshing manifesto inaugurates the future of social activism and the end of protest as you know it. Intellectually ambitious and spiritually compelling, The End of Protest is sure to be one of the most important non-fiction books in 2016.

Buy a copy of The End of Protest or a $15 gift card at Strand's main floor registers or at the door to attend this event. Please note that payment is required for all online event orders at the time of checkout. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Micah White

description:
Nick Brandt’s East African trilogy documented the effects of climate change and ceaseless upheaval on a wracked landscape and dwindling wildlife. With Inherit the Dust, his first book since the final volume in the trilogy, he returns to the ravaged landscape and creates panoramic vistas in which life size panels of his animal portraits are placed within scenes of environmental devastation. Reviving the images of long-dead elephants, zebras, and giraffes within the fraught context of ongoing life, Brandt investigates the irrecoverable memories that haunt the plains.

Nick will be joined in conversation by The New York Times' Andrew Revkin.

Buy a copy of Inherit the Dust or a $20 gift card in-store at Strand's main floor registers or at the door to attend. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Nick Brandt + Andrew Revkin

description:
Laura Prepon, star of Netflix’s hit Orange is the New Black, visits Strand at Club Monaco with her nutritionist and co-author, Elizabeth Troy, to sign copies of The Stash Plan: Your 21-Day Guide to Shed Weight, Feel Great, and Take Charge of Your Health. Its combination of Eastern holistic medicine and food science is calibrated for a healthy on-the-go lifestyle, and provides a pathway to achieving your goals on your budget.

Please RSVP to rsvp@clubmonaco.com. Buy a copy of The Stash Plan from Strand’s Club Monaco location to have it signed by Laura. The flagship store is located at 160 Fifth Avenue (at 21st Street). Be sure to hang onto your receipt. Please note, only the first 300 guests in line will be guaranteed admission.
title: Laura Prepon + Elizabeth Troy

description:
Carly Cylinder, creative director of Flour LA, comes to Strand to celebrate the release of The Flower Chef. It’s a modern take on the classic art of floral arranging, whether you’re looking for a crafty outlet for your creative juices or for a way to spruce up your personal and professional spaces. Check out her installation on the 2nd floor on February 27th, and join us for her demonstration of her techniques (with take-home keepsakes!) in the Rare Book Room on Tuesday.

This demonstration is open to the public. Copies of The Flower Chef will be available for purchase at the event. Purchase of a book enters you in a raffle for a chance to win an Objects With Purpose gift basket curated by owner Ianthe Mauro.
title: Carly Cylinder / The Flower Chef

description:
William Wegman’s lifelong exploration in manifold forms of comedy, strangeness, and philosophical quizzicality (and not just in his beloved Weimaraners’ befuddled gazes) is in full display in his Paintings, a book full of images built from postcards into strange and wonderful worlds. It’s a culmination of a long life in art, one that has taken many forms but always displayed a humorousness and openness to the plenitude of experience. Join us in the Rare Book Room for a conversation between Wegman and Peabody Award-winning Radiolab co-host, NPR science correspondent, and fellow all-around enthusiast Robert Krulwich.

Buy a copy of William Wegman: Paintings or a $20 gift card in-store at Strand's main floor registers or at the door to attend this event. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: William Wegman + Robert Krulwich

description:
Jon Ronson, intrepid journalist, filmmaker, and best-selling author, launches the paperback edition of his look into the world of democratized justice, So You’ve Been Publicly Shamed. From Twitter drags to high-profile collapses of journalistic integrity, it’s a tour of the modern landscape of stigma and contrition.  

Joining Jon will be Alex Goldman, co-host of the Reply All podcast. The two will discuss “telling human stories about the often dehumanized tech world,” ...but in a funny I've-been-there way. 

Buy a copy of So You’ve Been Publicly Shamed or a $15 gift card in-store at Strand's main floor registers or at the door to attend. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Jon Ronson
eventImage: http://www.strandbooks.com/resources/strand/images/events/SO YOU'VE BEEN PUBLICLY SHAMED by Jon Ronson PPBK.thumbnail.jpg

description:
Will the second generation to grow up with the internet be different from the first? Is the real you the one on Facebook or the one on Twitter or the one on Snapchat? Or could it still be the one with flesh and bones? In this discussion, Tricia Wang (researcher of global internet culture) and Nathan Jurgenson (social media theorist and consultant for Snapchat) will shed light on American culture after the digital revolution.

Tricia Wang (@triciawang) researches global internet culture and has done extensive ethnographic research in China and Mexico. She holds positions at Harvard University’s Berkman Center for Internet & Society and at Data & Society, a research center in New York. She is writing her first book on the internet and personal identity.

Nathan Jurgenson (@nathanjurgenson) is a sociologist and social media theorist. He is the co-founder and chair of the Theorizing the Web conference, an editor of The New Inquiry, and is also a researcher at Snapchat.

Buy a $12 ticket in-person at Strand's main floor registers or at the door. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 826 Broadway at 12th Street. Enter the lobby and take the elevator to the third floor.
title: How has the internet changed us?

description:
Award-winning playwright Lisa Kron and similarly lauded composer Jeanine Tesori come to the Rare Book Room for an evening in celebration of the tenth birthday of Fun Home, the graphic novel that they adapted for its five-Tony (including Best Musical!) Broadway run. Their stellar careers intersected in this stunning story of a truly nontraditional family, from perspectives all along the spectrum of sexuality and the continuum of time.

Fans of the show and the book alike won’t want to miss this installment of Strand’s Ovation series with two of the most accomplished women in theater!

Buy a copy of the Fun Home cast recording, a copy of the graphic novel, or a $15 gift card at the door tongiht to attend this event. Please note that payment is required for all online event orders at the time of checkout. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Strand Ovation Series: Fun Home

description:
2015 saw a revolution in genetic science. New techniques have drastically simplified bioengineering, raising urgent questions about what genes we should and shouldn’t modify. In this conversation, Carl Zimmer (award winning science writer) and Daniel Kevles (Historian of Science at Yale University) will explore the past, present, and future of biotech ethics.

Carl Zimmer (@carlzimmer) is a science columnist for the The New York Times, and has also been published in Discover, National Geographic, Quanta, among many others. He’s written 13 books, the most recent of which is Evolution: Making Sense of Life. His next book will be on the science of heredity.

Daniel Kevles explores the interactions between society and science. He is an historian of science at Yale University, and has written extensively about a wide range of topics, including physics, eugenics, scientific fraud, and intellectual property. His most recent book is Living Properties: Making Knowledge and Controlling Ownership in the History of Biology.

Buy a $12 ticket in-person at Strand's main floor registers or at the door. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 826 Broadway at 12th Street. Enter the lobby and take the elevator to the third floor.
title: Should we re-engineer humanity?

description:
The Real Art Therapists of New York come to the Strand to host a Pop-Up Coloring Bar for a day of relaxation, creativity, and self-reflection. The Real Art Therapists of New York Coloring Book features artwork by 50 professional art therapists living and working in New York who invite you into their inner worlds with personal illustrations and interviews. Join a few of the artists in the Rare Book Room and choose a page from their brand-new coloring book to see first-hand how art can be used for wellness and discovery. Let one of the on-site art therapists guide you on a personal coloring journey.

Purchase of a book enters you in a raffle for a chance to win a private art therapy session with a licensed art therapist. 

Derwent® Coloursoft color pencils and Derwent® Inktense color pencils will be provided.

This event is free and open to the public; it is for individuals ages 18+ The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Pop-Up Coloring Bar

description:
Join David Chang, the founder of the globally sensational Momofuku restaurants and co-creator of the beautiful food quarterly Lucky Peach, as he discusses his epicurean taste and the life of a gourmand with Peter Meehan, the magazine’s editorial director. The magazine’s first cookbook, Lucky Peach Presents 101 Easy Asian Recipes, features their signature blend of traditional and forward-looking ingredients and techniques, beholden to no strictures of authenticity devoted only to flavor. Come by for a chance to hear all about one of the 21st century’s greatest culinary success stories, and pick up a signed copy of the cookbook!

Buy a copy of Lucky Peach Presents 101 Easy Asian Recipes or Lucky Peach subscription at Strand's Club Monaco shop to attend this event. Books and subscriptions will be available to purchase at the event. Club Monaco is located at 160 Fifth Avenue at 21st Street. RSVP is required--please email RSVP@clubmonaco.com to reserve your spot. This event is first come, first serve.
title: David Chang + Peter Meehan @ Club Monaco

description:
Michèle Flournoy, Under Secretary of Defense for Policy from 2009 to 2012 and advisor to Secretary of Defense Leon Panetta on national security and defense policy, and Bret Stephens, foreign affairs columnist and deputy editorial page editor of The Wall Street Journal, dive into the 250 year-old debate about how America should influence the lives and politics of people around the globe—a substantive preview of the discussion to come in the general election this fall.

Michèle Flournoy served as the Under Secretary of Defense for Policy from 2009 to 2012, advising Secretary of Defense Leon Panetta on national security and defense policy. She is also the co-founder of the Center for a New American Security, a nonpartisan think tank dedicated to developing national security policies, and serves as a foreign policy adviser for Hillary Clinton.

Bret Stephens (@StephensWSJ) is the foreign affairs columnist and deputy editorial page editor of The Wall Street Journal. He is the winner of the 2013 Pulitzer Prize for commentary and the author of America in Retreat: The New Isolationism and the Coming Global Disorder.

Buy a $12 ticket in-person at Strand's main floor registers or at the door. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 826 Broadway at 12th Street. Enter the lobby and take the elevator to the third floor.
title: What is America's role in the world?

description:
Science is driven by questions--by what we don’t know. To understand the scope of human ignorance, neuroscientist Stuart Firestein interviews top scientists about the big mysteries in their fields. Firestein will talk with virologist Vincent Racaniello regarding the unknowns about viruses, including recent, and vital, questions about Zika.

Stuart Firestein is the Chair of Columbia University’s Department of Biological Sciences, where he and his colleagues study the vertebrate olfactory system. He is the author of Ignorance: How it Drives Science and Failure: Why Science Is so Successful.

Vincent Racaniello (@profvrr), Professor of Microbiology at Columbia University Medical Center, has done laboratory research on viruses for over 35 years. He produces podcasts on viruses, parasites, bacteria, and more, and is “Earth’s Virology Professor” at the Virology Blog.

Buy a $12 ticket in-person at Strand's main floor registers or at the door. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 826 Broadway at 12th Street. Enter the lobby and take the elevator to the third floor.
title: What don’t we know about Zika (and all viruses)?

description:
From their start in LA writing, recording and releasing their own music to doing the same thing but all over the planet, NOFX has stayed true to its roots and to the indie community that’s somehow kept them going through three decades of punk rock chaos. Erik Sandin, Eric Melvin, El Hefe, and Fat Mike (founder of Fat Wreck Chords) will be taking over the Rare Book Room for the New York stop on their indie bookstore tour for NOFX: The Hepatitis Bathtub and Other Stories, meeting fans, taking photos, and signing the new book.

One book per person is required for entry. Admittance guaranteed for the first 180 guests. Pre-purchase below is highly recommended. 

Buy a copy of NOFX: The Hepatitis Bathtub to attend this signing. The line will form on Broadway at 5:30pm. Only join the line if you've purchased a book already! See you tonight!
title: NOFX

description:
John Popper’s long career as a solo artist and as frontman of Blues Traveler has given him not just material for hundreds of songs, but stories to boot. In Suck and Blow and Other Stories I’m Not Allowed to Tell, he shares the cream of the crop, whether they’re about his life on the road, the jam band revival that he helped spark, his struggles with obesity, or his political views. Join us at Strand for John’s one night in New York, and hear it all in his own hilarious, self-deprecating voice, in conversation with co-author and Relix editor-in-chief Dean Budnick!

Buy a copy of Suck and Blow or a $15 gift card at the door to attend this event. Please note that payment is required for all online event orders at the time of checkout. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: John Popper

description:
Edward Mapplethorpe’s career in photography has spanned decades, but the subjects in his new collection, One: Sons & Daughters, have experienced only a fraction of that time. These startling, stunning photographs document the expressive and inimitable faces of one-year-old children, their personalities unmistakable even at the formational stages of their development. Mapplethorpe’s acclaimed and in-demand work as a baby photographer has resulted in these universal and unguarded images, and in his unique perspective on the persistence of personality from its earliest stirrings. Join him in the Rare Book Room for a searching conversation about childhood, and the preservation of fleeting innocence on film.

Special guests include Ms. Susan Orlean and Ms. Samantha Boardman reading selections from One: Sons & Daughters.

Buy a copy of One or a $20 gift card in-store at Strand's main floor registers or at the door to attend. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Edward Mapplethorpe

description:
Join us in the Rare Book Room for a live recording of a serialized podcast about math, art, literature, and everyday life. People Doing Math Live! is an unabashed celebration of the beauty, uncertainty, and wonder of exploring a world expressed in numbers. This time around, these crazy creatives will discuss Kurt Vonnegut’s “prettiest contribution to culture;” his rejected master’s thesis on the shape of story. Vonnegut proposed the shape of a society’s stories is at least as interesting as the shape of its pots or spearheads. Let's dive in! And get a little tipsy, too.

People Doing Math is a Brooklyn-based group of composers, political speechwriters, technologists, video designers, directors and writers, united by a common belief that math is an innately human experience and everyone is good at math.

This event is 21+ only. 

Tickets to this event are $10 and include a Strand gift card for that very amount.  Please purchase your ticket in-store at Strand's main floor registers or at the door to attend. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: People Doing Math LIVE: The Shape of Story

description:
Ari Seth Cohen’s lifelong fascination with the duds of the “senior set,” as he dubbed the older cohort that raised him, is on typically resplendent display in his brand-new book, Advanced Style: Older and Wiser. He’ll be joined by fellow sartorial obsessive Simon Doonan, creative ambassador-at-large for Barneys (and author of the book's introduction), for a conversation about the wildly expressive outfits on display in his photographs, and the unjust marginalization of older people in the world of fashion. Come up to the Rare Book Room (and make sure to dress your best!) for a sartorially seasoned soiree.

There will be a special guest appearances from Ilona Royce Smithkin, Lana Turner, and Beatrix Ost. 

Speciality cocktails will be provided by Hooch! Hooch is the first ever members only cocktail app. Hooch members receive 1 DRINK EVERY DAY at any participating venue. For as low as $9.99 a month, less than the price of ONE cocktail, our members can redeem up to 31 drinks per month! Hooch is currently available in NY, LA, Austin and Dallas.

This event is SOLD OUT! If you still would like to attend, there will be a stand by line in the Rare Book Room starting at 6:15pm. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 826 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Ari Seth Cohen + Simon Doonan

description:
MashReads and Strand are proud to host a bevy of up-and-coming New York poets for a night of reading and conversation about resistance, struggle, and the forces both internal and external that would prevent poetry. We're honored to be hosting:

  • Matt Petronzio, Academy of American Poets Prize-winner and Mashable editor;
  • Hafizah Geter, Cave Canem Fellow, Phantom Books poetry editor and EMPIRE co-curator;
  • Charif Shanahan, Charif Shanahan, author of Into Each Room We Enter Without Knowing, winner of the 2015 Crab Orchard Poetry Series First Book Prize and forthcoming from Southern Illinois University Press and Stanford University, where he will be a 2016-18 Wallace Stegner Fellow in Poetry;
  • Rachel Eliza Griffiths, author of Miracle Arrhythmia and The Requited Distance, and widely published photographer; and 
  • Danniel Schoonebeek, author of American Barricade and C’est la guerre, and editor of the PEN Poetry Series, who will be moderating the discussion as well as reading.

More information about the event and the participants can be found here.

Tickets are no longer available online, but will be available at the door-- See you tonight!

Event Admission
title: Writing & Resistance: Poetry presented by MashReads and Strand Books

description:
At this pivotal time in history more and more artists turned activists are using their mediums to bring issues of climate change to the forefront of the public eye. To celebrate Earth Day 2016, Strand has invited photographers Sebastian Copeland, Rachel Sussman, and Chris Jordan to discuss their work and their efforts in conservation, preservation, and sharing information.

Joining the discussion as moderator is Miriam Horn, one of the founders and builders of the Clean Energy Program at Environmental Defense Fund. With EDF President Fred Krupp, Miriam Horn co-authored the New York Times bestseller Earth: the Sequel, The Race to Reinvent Energy and Stop Global Warming (Norton, 2008).

Check out Sebastian’s documentary here, Rachel’s TED talk here, and Chris’ TED talk here.

This event is FREE.  The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Art for a Sustainable Future: a conversation on climate change and art activism

description:
In 2013 actress Anna Gunn wrote in the New York Times about the mass online anger directed at the character she played on Breaking Bad. She had realized “most people’s hatred of Skyler White had little to do with me and a lot to do with their own perception of women and wives.” This panel of novelists and essayists will talk about the onus of likeability placed on women and whether women are allowed to be flawed, in fiction and life. Presented by Buzzfeed Books and Joyland Magazine.

Panelists

  • Emily Schultz is the co-founder of Joyland Magazine, host of the podcast Truth & Fiction, and creator of the blog Spending the Stephen King Money. Schultz’s newest novel, The Blondes, was published by St. Martin’s Press in 2015 and will be available in paperback from Picador. It was selected for NPR as a Great Read of 2015 and Kirkus declared it a Best Fiction Book of 2015. She lives in Brooklyn. 
  • Chloe Caldwell is the author of the novella, Women, and the essay collection Legs Get Led Astray. Her upcoming essay collection, I’ll Tell You In Person, will release fall of 2016 from Coffee House Press & Emily Books. Her work has appeared in VICE, Salon, The Rumpus, Nylon, The Sun Magazine, Jewcy, and Men’s Health. She lives in Hudson, New York.
  • Anna North is a graduate of the Iowa Writers’ Workshop, and her writing has appeared in the San Francisco Chronicle, The Atlantic, Glimmer Train, Nautilus, and Salon; on Jezebel and BuzzFeed; and in the New York Times, where she is a member of the editorial board. The author of the novels America Pacifica and The Life and Death of Sophie Stark. She lives in Brooklyn, New York.
  • Jenny Zhang is a poet, fiction and non-fiction writer who has published work in Bomb, Iowa Review, the Hairpin, Glimmertrain, Rookie, and Poetry Magazine. Her poetry collection Dear Jenny, We Are All Find was released from Octopus Books, and her forthcoming collection of short stories We Love You Crispina, will be published by Random House in 2017. She was born in Shanghai and raised in New York. She is a graduate of Stanford University and the Iowa Writers’ Workshop.
  • Moderator Isaac Fitzgerald is the books editor of Buzzfeed and co-founder of Pen & Ink.

Please note that due to overwhelming interest, this event has sold out. There will be a limited amount of standby room, but space is unfortunately limited. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room. Please enter through the lobby at 826 Broadway.
title: Bad Women: A Discussion About Women, Character, and Likability

description:
Both known for their innovative, playful, and ambitious storytelling, Oyeyemi and Link push and redefine the boundaries of reality. Isaac Fitzgerald (BuzzFeed Books) will lead a short conversation with the authors.

"[What Is Yours is Not Yours] contains the same sly humor, gorgeous writing and magical characters as her previous efforts. It is, in a word, flawless... another masterpiece from an author who seems incapable of writing anything that's less than brilliant."

--NPR Book review of Helen Oyeyemi's new collection What is Yours is Not Yours

“With every tale [Link] conjures a different universe, each more captivating than the last. . . . You’ll long to return the minute you leave." --Entertainment Weekly review of Kelly Link's collection Get In Trouble Actors subject to change.

A limited number of premium seats are available, with a $50 tax-deductible contribution per ticket to Symphony Space. Please reserve your tickets here. This event will take place at Symphony Space, in the Peter Jay Sharp Theater.  2537 Broadway at 95th Street, New York, NY 10025-6990. Please call (212) 864-5400 with questions.

Media Sponsor: Buzzfeed Books
title: Selected Shorts: Kelly Link and Helen Oyeyemi

description:
The Writers Studio will celebrate the Kenyon Review, which was founded by critic John Crowe Ransom back in 1939, and which has published early works by generations of important writers such as Robert Penn Warren, Flannery O’Connor, Thomas Pynchon, and Maya Angelou.

The line-up for this evening will include novelists Lily Tuck (The News from Paraguay, The Double Life of Liliane), Laura van den Berg (The Isle of Youth, Find Me), and Daniel Torday (The Last Flight of Poxl West), along with poets Meghan O’Rourke (Half Life, The Long Goodbye), Kimiko Hahn (The Unbearable Hart, Brain Fever), and Kenyon Review’s Poetry Editor David Baker (Changeable Thunder, Never-Ending Birds).

Tickets for this event are $10 and include a gift card for that very amount; they can be purchased at the door this evening. Please note that payment is required for all online event orders at the time of checkout. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: The Writers Studio Celebrates The Kenyon Review

description:
Want to rediscover the joys and surprises of great literature? We’re spending 2016 reading and discussing great novels alongside Laura Miller and her fellow Slatesters. This month, Laura and Slate Group editor-in-chief Jacob Weisberg will be talking about Charlotte Brontë’s Jane Eyre.

Join Laura, Jacob, and fellow book lovers for a live conversation on Charlotte Brontë's classic and its place in English literature. Hear their conversation, ask questions, and suggest topics.

This is event is free to Slate Plus members. or those who buy a copy of Jane Eyre or a $10 gift card at the door. Please note that payment is required for all online event orders at the time of checkout. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.

Use your Upcoming Events tool in the Slate Plus dashboard on the right side of the Slate Plus home page to receive your individualized access code. If you’d like to become a Slate Plus member, click here.
title: A Year of Great Books with Slate: Jane Eyre

description:
Since opening its first recording booth in Grand Central Terminal in 2003, StoryCorps has recorded more than 60,000 conversations between family members, friends and even strangers—a ground-breaking oral history project heard by millions of listeners every Friday on NPR’s Morning Edition.

Founder Dave Isay has written several books inspired by the project, whose mission is this: to remind us of our shared humanity.

Isay joins us live in conversation with WNYC’s The Takeaway host John Hockenberry at the The Greene Space to talk about StoryCorps' history, its future and his latest book, Callings: The Purpose and Passion of Work.

A collection of inspiring stories from the heart of the American workforce, Callings is a tribute to the passion, determination, and courage it takes to pursue the work we feel called to do.

This event has sold out. It can be livestreamed here, or in the video below. This event will be located at The Greene Space at WNYC & WQXR, 44 Charlton Street, New York, NY 10014.
title: Dave Isay + John Hockenberry

description:
Join Jasmine and Melissa Hemsley, sisters devoted to natural, unprocessed, delicious food, have run their own catering and cooking company, Hemsley + Hemsley, since 2010, providing gut-healthy dishes to celebrities and brands like Louis Vuitton, Chanel and Vivienne Westwood. Now, with Good and Simple: Recipes to Eat Well and Thrive, they’re sharing everything they’ve learned, with 140 beautiful recipes that are so tasty you’ll forget that they’re designed with nourishment in mind. Join them at Strand’s Club Monaco shop for a signing of the helpful, vibrant book and see how simple good food can be!

This event will be located at Strand’s Club Monaco shop at 160 Fifth Avenue (at 21st Street). Please buy a copy of Good and Simple from Strand to have it signed.
title: Hemsley + Hemsley @ Club Monaco

description:
Eunice Lipton, art historian, cultural critic, memoirist, and New Yorker by birth, stumbles upon a buried legacy in A Distant Heartbeat: A War, a Disappearance, and a Family’s Secrets. With her discovery of her uncle Dave Lipton’s passionate politics both at home in the Bronx and across the ocean as the Spanish Civil War began, she begins to understand the complicated web of relationships that ended in a family’s betrayal. Join Eunice Lipton and Tim Teeman, senior editor at the Daily Beast, for a unique discussion of this moving exhumation of one family’s war.

Check out the book trailer for Lipton's A Distant Heartbeat here. 

This event is supported by ALBA, Abraham Lincoln Brigade Archives.

Buy a copy of A Distant Heartbeat or a $15 gift card in-store at Strand's main floor registers or at the door to attend. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Eunice Lipton + Tim Teeman

description:
Lucy Foley comes to Strand’s Club Monaco shop to sign The Book of Lost and Found, a captivating tale of lost love redeemed. Kate Darling's enigmatic mother--a once-famous ballerina--has passed away, leaving Kate bereft. When her grandmother falls ill and bequeaths to Kate a small portrait of a woman who bears a striking resemblance to Kate's mother, Kate uncovers a mystery that may upend everything she thought she knew.

Kate's journey to find the true identity of the woman in the portrait takes her to some of the world's most iconic and indulgent locales, revealing a love story that began in the wild 1920s and was disrupted by war and could now spark new love for Kate. Alternating between Kate's present-day hunt and voices from the past, The Book of Lost and Found casts light on family secrets and love--both lost and found.

This event will be held at Strand’s shop at Club Monaco’s flagship store, 160 Fifth Avenue at 21st Street. Purchase a copy of The Book of Lost and Found at Strand to have it signed. Please RSVP to RSVP@clubmonaco.com so we know you’re coming.
title: Lucy Foley @ Club Monaco

description:
Dan Dunn, author of the popular booze column The Imbiber and several previous books on the wild life of a professional drinker, turns to the daunting and status-anxious world of terroir and tannins with American Wino: A Tale of Reds, Whites, and One Man's Blues. Spun out into an existential crisis and stunned by a fateful tasting experience, Dunn hits the road to understand the complexities of the cork, the vicissitudes of vino. From Sonoma to South Carolina, his journeys into cellars and vineyards, spirited highs and crushing lows, will inspire, edify, and make you thirsty.

Joining Dan in conversation will be actor Harry Lennix. You may recognize him from NBC's The Blacklist, or Spike Lee's most recent controversial film, Chi-Raq.

Wine is included with purchase of book or gift card below. 

Buy a copy of American Wino or a $15 gift card in-store at Strand's main floor registers or at the door to attend. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Dan Dunn

description:
Join the Vulture Insiders, Vulture’s most tuned-in pop-culture obsessives, Vulture books editor Boris Kachka, and writer Rebecca Traister to discuss her book All the Single Ladies: Unmarried Women and the Rise of an Independent Nation. It’s a nuanced and heroically well-researched look into the history of social change as effected by women looking beyond early heterosexual marriage, and a "singularly triumphant work of women presented in beautiful formation" (Los Angeles Times).

Rebecca Traister is writer at large for New York Magazine and a contributing editor at Elle. A National Magazine Award finalist, she has written about women in politics, media and entertainment from a feminist perspective for The New Republic and Salon and has also contributed to The Nation, The New York Observer, The New York Times, The Washington Post, Vogue, Glamour and Marie Claire. Traister's first book, Big Girls Don't Cry, about women and the 2008 election, was a New York Times Notable Book of 2010 and the winner of the Ernesta Drinker Ballard Book Prize. She lives in New York with her family. 

Please RSVP to vultureinsiders@vulture.com. Feel free to buy a copy of All the Single Ladies, but purchase is not required. It’s more important to bring your questions, comments, and insights! The event will be located on the 2nd floor of Strand at 828 Broadway at 12th Street. If you can’t make the meeting, we’ll be broadcasting the event on Periscope. Download the Periscope app from the App Store or Google Play, follow Vulture, and tune in Wednesday, April 4 at 7:30 p.m.!
title: Vulture Insiders Book Club with Rebecca Traister

description:
The upstate Shangri-La of Woodstock, NY has long served as both a satellite town for the cultural vanguard of NYC and as a bohemian enclave with a life of its own. Its story is both a rich and vital element to the larger story of the musical explosion of late-20th century America and a strange, engrossing tale all its own.

Barney Hoskyns’ long career writing about music for outlets like Rolling Stone, NME, Spin, and more, as well as the founder of online criticism archive Rock’s Backpages, has given him a perspective on both these histories of unsurpassable breadth and depth. Small Town Talk: Bob Dylan, The Band, Van Morrison, Janis Joplin, Jimi Hendrix and Friends in the Wild Years of Woodstock is his study of a crucial link in the long chain of American music. Join us at Strand for a conversation between Hoskyns and Michael Azerrad, author of Our Band Could Be Your Life, for a conversation about its heyday.

Buy a copy of Small Town Talk or a $15 gift card in-store at Strand's main floor registers or at the door to attend. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Barney Hoskyns + Michael Azerrad

description:
Richard Danne, multi-award winning designer and former AIGA president, joins Pentagram’s Michael Bierut (also former head of the AIGA) for a discussion of the exquisite reissue of his firm’s 1974 NASA Graphics Standards Manual.
