Spearheaded by Jesse Reed and Hamish Smyth, also of Pentagram (and of the runaway Kickstarter hit reissue of Massimo Vignelli’s legendary manual for the NYCTA), the reissue celebrates a lost era of American space exploration, featuring the notorious “worm” logo and iconic color schemes, all scanned and printed in beautiful Pantone® color. Join these icons for a discussion of a bygone era, from the jumpsuits to the signage to the shuttles themselves.

Due to overwhelming interest, advance tickets to this event have sold out. A standby line will begin forming on Broadway at 5:30 PM on the day of the event. The event will be located in Strand's Rare Book Room on the 3rd floor, accessible via 826 Broadway.
title: DISCOVERING DESIGN: Richard Danne + Michael Bierut

description:
She’s graced the pages of the New York Times and Us Weekly, and has appeared on Good Morning America and the Today Show. She’s starred in designer Karen Walker’s advertising campaign, and pens her own weekly column in People Magazine: Pets. Her jet-setting friends include Karlie Kloss, Reese Witherspoon, Jane Lynch, and, of course, her Internet celebrity dad, The Fat Jew. She has hundreds of thousands of fans following her every move on Instagram.

She’s Toast, the puppymill rescue Cavalier King Charles Spaniel whose toothless grin and ever-present tongue have become today’s hottest style sensation. She’ll be relaxing, taking pics, and paw-tographing books at Strand--don’t miss this chance to meet the web’s most glamorous pooch!

Buy a copy of Toasthampton or a $10 gift card in-store at Strand's main floor registers or at the door to attend. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Toast the Dog

description:
Demos and Strand Books invite you to a timely and lively discussion between Demos’ Tamara Draut, author of the new book Sleeping Giant: How the New Working Class Will Transform America, and Bob Herbert, former New York Times columnist and a Demos fellow as well.

Draut and Herbert will discuss the struggles, politics and burgeoning power of the new working class. With an eye towards our upcoming presidential election, and its impact on America’s working families, Draut and Herbert will explore how these fearless workers are shifting the political landscape.

Sleeping Giant is the first major examination of the new working class and the role it will play in our economic and political future. The book explores how the new working class — both more female and more racially diverse than its predecessors — faces major obstacles and opportunities in reclaiming the political power that defined the industrial working class. The stakes are high: Restoring the political and economic power of today’s working class, Draut argues, is the best path to securing all of our economic futures. Barbara Ehrenreich, author of Nickel and Dimed, called the book a “thorough and lively report on the ‘new working class’ that inhabits our ‘bargain basement economy.’”

Tamara Draut is Vice President of Policy and Research at Demos, a national think tank headquartered in New York City, and the author of Strapped: Why America’s 20- and 30-Somethings Can’t Get Ahead.

Bob Herbert is a Distinguished Senior Fellow at Demos and a member of Common Cause's National Governing Board. He wrote for the New York Times for over twenty years, and was the recipient of the Meyer Berger Award and the American Society of Newspaper Editors award for distinguished newspaper writing. He is the author of Losing Our Way: An Intimate Portrait of a Troubled America and Promises Betrayed: Waking Up from the American Dream.

Buy a copy of Sleeping Giant or a $15 gift card in-store at Strand's main floor registers or at the door to attend. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Tamara Draut + Bob Herbert

description:
Michael Wolf and Colin O’Brien, notoriously good readers and pretty okay writers, are back at the Strand for another night of literary debauchery. Don’t worry, it’s a thing.

Our MCs will host a sort of adult version of Reading Rainbow/drunk college writing workshop complete with free drinks, low-brow fiction, highbrow erotica and celebrity guests performing stand up, storytelling, music and more. Join them for a hilarious night of literature that will leave you wanting to pick up a pen and start writing…. concerned letters to The Strand questioning Michael and Colin’s qualifications to run a show about books.

Joining Michael and Colin, Strand is excited to host

  • Aparna Nancherla (Comedy Central),
  • Joe Pera (Late Night with Seth Meyers),
  • Sudi Green (Saturday Night Live),
  • and music by Skylar Spence.

Michael and Colin are two dashing young comedians (often referred to as the George Clooneys of the New York comedy scene) and together make up the comedy duo Nancy. They've performed at San Francisco Sketchfest, Comedy Central 'Comics to Watch' Showcase, MTV, The Upright Citizens Brigade Theater, Brooklyn Comedy Festival, NYC Sketchfest, the Boston Comedy Arts Festival, Austin Sketchfest, and The Special Without Brett Davis as well as running a monthly show at Union Hall.

You can listen to some their album Nancy Screams the Hits here or watch web series called Triplets of Kings County here. They also produce the monthly sketch show O.S.F.U.G. at The Upright Citizens Brigade Theatre and the fake author reading show (and soon to be podcast) Literati at Union Hall.

Tickets are $10 and include one drink, courtesy of Bronx Brewery. 

Event Admission
title: Pagemasters II with Colin and Michael

description:
Upstairs at the Strand collects the stirring and revelatory conversations between renowned novelists, playwrights, and poets that have taken place in the legendary Rare Book Room on the Strand’s third floor. What better way to celebrate the star-studded collection than with a reading and reception in the same book-lined literary mecca?

Join Fred and Nancy Bass, owners of the Strand, as well as literary lodestars Tina Chang, Deborah Eisenberg, Rivka Galchen, AM Homes, Hari Kunzru, DT Max, Leigh Newman, Téa Obreht, and Katie Roiphe, in celebrating a literary New York institution.

This event is FREE and open to the public. Please RSVP here.
title: Upstairs at the Strand: A Literary Reunion and Bookish Bash

description:
The photographs of Scott Schumann (aka the Sartorialist) and Amy Arbus capture life most fully expressed. Whether their subjects are Fashion Week smoke-breakers, hotel-dwelling uptown doyennes, trendsetters at Florence’s Pitti Uomo, or just a fantastically well-dressed couple going about their day, Schumann and Arbus have been at the ready for innumerable moments of poise and glamour. Join these seasoned shutterbugs for a conversation about life on the street in NYC and around the world.

This event is free and open to the public. If you’re planning to attend, please RSVP here. The line for general admission will begin forming at 5:30 PM in front of 826 Broadway, where the event will take place in the 3rd floor Rare Book Room. Copies of The Sartorialist: X and Amy Arbus’ On the Street will be available at the event.
title: The Sartorialist + Amy Arbus

description:
Join the editors of Epiphany Magazine for a reading and discussion to celebrate the publication of the spring 2016 issue, featuring work from their annual writing contest. Pulitzer-prize winning poet Vijay Seshadri, New York Times bestselling author Kathryn Harrison, and pioneering NYC literary agent Vicky Bijur judged the contest and will discuss why they chose what they chose, and how it reflects the literary world today. There will also be readings of the winning pieces.

Buy a copy of Epiphany's spring issue or a $10 gift card in-store at the Strand's main floor registers or at the door to attend. This event will be located in the Rare Book Room on the 3rd floor, accessible via 826 Broadway.
title: Epiphany Magazine Reading [Spring Contest Winners]

description:
A story of intrigue and exploration, Enchanted Islands is the latest novel from Allison Amend, author of the acclaimed A Nearly Perfect Copy. From her early life in Duluth to her mission to Galapagos for the Office of Naval Intelligence, it tells the story of Francis Frankowski and her lifelong relationship with Rosalie Mendel, her childhood friend and idol. A riveting and complex tale of female friendship and self-exploration, it’s a vivid and richly historical view of the invisible obverse of 20th century America.

Allison will be joined in conversation by Whiting Award winner Alexander Chee, author of the recently released New York Times Editor’s Pick, Queen of the Night. Join Alexander and Allison in the Rare Book Room for a reading and conversation to celebrate the launch of Enchanted Islands!

Buy a copy of Enchanted Islands or a $15 gift card in-store at Strand's main floor registers or at the door to attend. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Allison Amend + Alexander Chee

description:
When Plated customers receive a delivery at home, they know they’ll be eating and cooking well without having to think about it. Now, in their debut cookbook, Plated: Weeknight Dinners, Weekend Feasts, and Everything in Between, Elana Karp and Suzanne Dumaine, the leaders of Plated’s culinary team, arm readers with more than 125 brand new, inventive recipes. With their unique “choose your own adventure” approach, they’ve created customizable, seasonally driven dishes that are meant to be easily adaptable to highlight the season’s freshest produce, the time you have to cook, and the occasion.

The Plated team will be at the Strand to introduce hungry readers to their new recipes, with some samples on hand to demonstrate them. Come learn some new delectable and no-stress dishes, and try them out!

This tasting will take place on the Strand's main floor. Copies of Plated: Weeknight Dinners, Weekend Feasts, and Everything in Between will be available for purchase.
title: FREE TASTING! Plated @ The Strand

description:
Join the Vulture Insiders, Vulture’s most tuned-in pop-culture obsessives, Vulture books editor Boris Kachka, and acclaimed debut novelist Cynthia D’Aprix Sweeney to discuss The Nest, her rollicking farce of familial friction. It’s the story of Melody, Jack, and Bea Plumb, three siblings waiting on the receipt of “the Nest,” the trust fund put in place by their father as a midlife safeguard that’s seen unexpected and enormous growth. For their various reasonings, the Plumbs have come to rely on the soon-to-be windfall, and with the various turns their lives have taken, it’s become the surefire cure-all to their problems. Don’t miss this opportunity to discuss with the author the season’s most hotly-tipped new novel that Entertainment Weekly compared to “really good dark chocolate: sharper and more bittersweet than the cheap stuff, but also too delicious not to finish in one sitting.”

Please RSVP to vultureinsiders@vulture.com. Feel free to buy a copy of The Nest, but purchase is not required. It’s more important to bring your questions, comments, and insights! The event will be located on the 2nd floor of Strand at 828 Broadway at 12th Street. If you can’t make the meeting, we’ll be broadcasting the event on Periscope. Download the Periscope app from the App Store or Google Play, follow Vulture, and tune in Wednesday, April 4 at 7:30 p.m.!
title: Vulture Insiders Book Club Meeting with Cynthia D’Aprix Sweeney

description:
Aileen Kwun and Bryn Smith, two New York writers and designers, introduce a panel of lifelong luminaries in their fields, whether it’s architecture, graphic design, or criticism, all in their ninth decade. Their book, Twenty Over Eighty, delves into what's changed, what's stayed the same, and what brought these legends in their fields to their current stature--don’t miss an expansive conversation the history of design!  Panelists will include Seymour Chwast, Jack Lenor Larsen, and Jane Thompson.

Buy a copy of Twenty Over Eighty or a $20 gift card in-store at Strand's main floor registers or at the door to attend. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: DISCOVERING DESIGN: Legends of New York City Design and Architecture

description:
This incredible panel of heavy-hitting designers will discuss the invention of desire in design. Today, books on “design thinking” are best sellers, and computer and Web-based tools have expanded the definition of who practices design. Looking at objects, letterforms, experiences, and even theatrical performances, award-winning author Jessica Helfand asserts that understanding design's purpose is more crucial than ever. Design is meaningful not because it is pretty but because it is an intrinsically humanist discipline, tethered to the very core of why we exist. Advancing a conversation that is unfolding around the globe, Helfand offers an eye-opening look at how designed things make us feel as well as how—and why—they motivate our behavior.

Panelists include:

  • Jessica Helfand is a designer, writer, and educator. She has written for numerous national publications, and is the author of several books on visual and cultural criticism including Screen: Essays on Graphic Design, New Media and Visual Culture (2001), Reinventing the Wheel (2002) and the critically acclaimed Scrapbooks: An American History. A co-founder of Design Observer where, with Michael Bierut, she hosts the podcast The Observatory, Helfand is a Senior Critic in Graphic Design at the Yale School of Art, a Lecturer in Yale College, and a faculty affiliate in the History of Science. In 2015, she was appointed Artist in Residence at the Yale Institute for Network Science. Named the first Henry Wolf Resident in Design at the American Academy in Rome in 2010, Jessica Helfand is a member of the Alliance Graphique Internationale and the Art Director’s Hall of Fame. She won the AIGA medal, the design profession’s highest honor, in 2013.
  • Paula Scher has been at the forefront of graphic design for more than three decades. Iconic, smart and unabashedly populist, her images have entered into the American vernacular. Scher has been a principal in the New York office of the distinguished international design consultancy Pentagram since 1991. She began her career as an art director in the 1970s and early '80s, when her eclectic approach to typography became highly influential. In the mid-1990s her landmark identity for The Public Theater fused high and low into a wholly new symbology for cultural institutions, and her recent architectural collaborations have re-imagined the urban landscape as a dynamic environment of dimensional graphic design.
  • Eugenia Bell is Executive Editor at Design Observer. She was the design editor of frieze magazine from 2007–2013, and is a longtime editor of books on art, architecture, and graphic design. Her writing has appeared in frieze, Bookforum, Artforum, New York magazine, and on Design Observer.
  • Julie Lasky is a journalist, editor and critic best known for her writings on design and popular culture. She is a frequent contributor to the New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Travel & Leisure, and many other publications. From 2012 to 2015, she was the deputy editor of the New York Times’s weekly Home section, for which she wrote a monthly column on new design called “The Details.” A widely published writer, she is the author of the books Irving Harper: Works in Paper (Skira/Rizzoli); Some People Can't Surf: The Graphic Design of Art Chantry (Chronicle Books) and Bespoke: The Handbuilt Bicycle (Lars Müller). She co-authored, with Steven Heller, Borrowed Design: Use and Abuse of Historical Form (Wiley). She has taught in MFA programs at the School of Visual Arts and Rhode Island School of Design. She is a frequent speaker at international forums on subjects from voting machines to vintage paperbacks.
  • Véronique Vienne was a magazine art director in the USA when she began to write to better analyze and understand the work of the graphic designers, illustrators and photographers who collaborated with her. Today she writes books and conducts workshops on design criticism as a creative tool.

Buy a copy of The Invention of Desire or a $20 gift card in-store at Strand's main floor registers or at the door to attend. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: DISCOVERING DESIGN: The Invention of Desire - A Panel

description:
Joe Hill, award-winning author of NOS4A2, Horns, and other chilling bestsellers, returns with The Fireman, a gripping tale of a plague unlike anything we’ve seen before.

No one knows where it came from, but Dragonscale spreads like wildfire, tracing its victims’ flesh with blackened gold, then setting them ablaze. Harper Grayson, a dedicated nurse, discovers its mark on her own skin and resolves to stay alive long enough to give birth to her son, endangering her husband and everyone around them. As society collapses around them, the ranks close around her as angry Cremation Squads rove the streets, exterminating the afflicted.

A mysterious and compelling stranger Harper met at the hospital, a man in a dirty yellow fire fighter’s jacket, carrying a hooked iron bar, straddles the abyss between insanity and death. Known as The Fireman, he strolls the ruins of New Hampshire, a madman afflicted with Dragonscale who has learned to control the fire within himself, using it as a shield to protect the hunted . . . and as a weapon to avenge the wronged.

Don’t miss this evening with a modern master as Joe Hill presents his latest white-hot tale of perseverance in the face of a civilization in flames.

Buy a copy of The Fireman or a $15 gift card in-store at Strand's main floor registers or at the door to attend. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Joe Hill

description:
This panel of takers and makers will walk the audience through the process of being a creative: what it means for each of them, and how those measures and mechanisms can be applied for those of us willing to learn.

Panelists include: 

  • Steve Heller (author of the forthcoming Graphic Design Idea Book and many others, co-chair of the MFA Designer as Author Department, Special Consultant to the President of SVA for New Programs, and Visuals columnist for the New York Times Book Review) 
  • Peter Ahlberg (author of the forthcoming Please Make This Look Nice, principal designer at AHL&CO, and professor of graphic design at SVA)
  • Kyna Leski (Professor of Architecture at RISD, founding principal of 3six0 Architecture, artist, actor, and author of The Storm of Creativity) 

The conversation will be moderated by Debbie Millman, President Emeritus of AIGA, author, and host of Design Matters, an award-winning program of interviews with eminent designers.

Tickets to this event are $20, include a gift card for that same amount, and are available at the Strand's main floor registers or at the door. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: DISCOVERING DESIGN: Taking & Making - Creativity and the Design Process

description:
Simon Hanselmann’s comics don’t spare the bawdy, broke, bad-tempered extremes of its Saturday-morning cartoon characters. Megg and Mogg in Amsterdam takes the titular weed-addled witch and her feline partner out of the suburban home they’ve made in his previous work in Megahex, at VICE, and in mini-comics aplenty, all the way to the stoner capital of Europe. Taking the gang out of their familiar down-under backwater doesn’t lift them from their singular miasma of bleak moods, dire hijinx, and unclear boundaries--join Simon at Strand for a wild night of the same.

Joining Simon in conversation will be fellow cartoonist Katie Skelly, Brooklynite creator of Nurse Nurse, Operation Margarine, the ongoing My Pretty Vampire, as well as comics for the sex-positive website Slutist. She’s also written and lectured about comics for outlets such as The Comics Journal, Fantagraphics, Japan Society, The Center for Cartoon Studies, Fordham University and The New School, and co-hosts the Trash Twins podcast with fellow cartoonist Sarah Horrocks.

Buy a copy of Megg and Mogg in Amsterdam or a $15 gift card at the Strand's main floor registers or at the door to attend. This event will be located in the Rare Book Room, on the 3rd floor, accessible via 826 Broadway.
title: Simon Hanselmann + Katie Skelly

description:
Patricia Gucci was born a secret: the love child whose birth could have spelled ruination and even imprisonment for her father, Aldo Gucci, the trailblazing businessman who transformed his father’s small Florentine luggage company into a worldwide luxury powerhouse. To avoid scandal, Aldo sent his love, Bruna, to London to deliver their baby, and then discreetly whisked her back to Rome with her newborn, hidden from the Italian authorities, the media, and the Gucci family.

“It wasn’t until I was about ten years old that I was told by my mother that my beloved Papa’, whom I saw regularly and adored, was married to another woman and had another family,” says Patricia. “There were always so many unanswered questions about my childhood; in fact, until recently it was just one big black hole.” As an adult, Patricia resolved to explore her past and fill in those blanks.

The result is the deeply personal In the Name of Gucci: A Memoir--don’t miss this opportunity to hear the story of the esteemed House of Gucci, told as only a direct descendent of its founder, Guccio Gucci, can tell it. Patricia will be joined in conversation by the Wall Street Journal’s Marc Myers, veteran journalist, author of Why Jazz Happened, and founder of JazzWax, an award-winning repository for interviews and commentary on records and performances new and old.

Buy a copy of In the House of Gucci or a $15 gift card at Strand's main floor registers or at the door to attend. This event will take place on the 3rd floor in the Rare Book Room, accessible via 826 Broadway.
title: DISCOVERING DESIGN: Patricia Gucci

description:
Lisa Congdon celebrates The Joy of Swimming at Strand! The artist and illustrator’s brand-new book on the wonders of watery locomotion gets a pop-up shop with some delightful snacks courtesy of Laurie & Sons, photobooth snapshots from our friends at OM Digital, and fun for the whole family. Celebrate the warmer season (and Mother's Day!) with a trip to Strand Book Store.

This event is free and open to the public--feel free to RSVP over on Strand's Facebook, Lisa's Facebook, or both!
title: Better than Brunch: A Mother's Day Pop-Up featuring Lisa Congdon

description:
Annabelle Selldorf is the principal of Selldorf Architects, a Fellow of the American Institute of Architects, and serves on the Board of the Architectural League of New York and the Chinati Foundation. Selldorf Architects has become known for galleries, cultural projects, as well as private homes. The Portfolio is a newly-shot, full color portfolio by renowned photographer Todd Eberle and is complimented by an in-depth look at the story behind 30 selected projects, including architectural plans and sketches.

Join Annabelle and Michael Bierut (Partner at Pentagram, Senior Critic at Yale School of Design and graphic designer of Selldorf's newly released monograph) for a conversation about her illustrious career and the buildings and landscapes that she’s shaped. The discussion will moderated by David Breslin, chief curator at the Menil Drawing Institute in Houston, Texas.

Buy a copy of Selldorf Architects or a $20 gift card in-store at Strand's main floor registers or at the door to attend. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: DISCOVERING DESIGN: Annabelle Selldorf

description:
Geoff Dyer has shunted ideas of genre, boundaries of veracity, and classification in general firmly to the side for his entire writing life. Novels that include barely disguised elements of his own life, fictionalized accounts of real-life figures, criticism couched in memoir--it would be a stretch to believe that it all came from one mind, were it not for his subtle, distinctive prose and the questing clarity of his mind, qualities that earned him the 2015 Windham Campbell Prize in nonfiction. White Sands: Experiences from the Outside World, his latest dispatch from the one-man planet on which the whole thing hangs together, details travels to China, the American Southwest, and into abiding fixations like jazz, photography, and the work of D.H. Lawrence.

Geoff will be joined in discussing White Sands by Hari Kunzru, the Somerset Maugham, Pushcart, and British Book Award-winning author of Gods Without Men, The Impressionist, Transmission, and My Revolutions.

Buy a copy of White Sands or a $15 gift card in-store at the Strand's main floor registers or at the door to attend. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Windham-Campbell Prizes Present: Geoff Dyer + Hari Kunzru

description:
From his self-starter beginnings in Brooklyn to the world stage, Isaac Mizrahi’s quintessentially American designs have helped define couture for the last three decades. His work has traversed and questioned boundaries of high and low style, cultivating classic glamour while broadening the appeal of the runway to the world beyond.

With Isaac Mizrahi: An Unruly History, the Jewish Museum’s lavish exhibit and monograph devoted to his designs from his 1987 debut show to the present day, he looks back on a career spent restless and rangy, spanning not just fashion but acting, directing, theatrical design, and cabaret, too. Join Isaac in the Rare Book Room for a conversation with Chee Pearlman, director of NYC’s Chee Company, former i-D magazine editor-in-chief, and curator of the Museum’s exhibit.

This event is free and open to the public, and will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street. Copies of Isaac Mizrahi will be available to purchase at the event.
title: DISCOVERING DESIGN: Isaac Mizrahi

description:
Bronwen Dickey, contributing editor at the Oxford American, turns her award-winning journalistic eye to the contentious history of an American icon: the alternately beloved and brutalized Pit Bull. From film sets to the White House, down into underground rings and black-market notoriety, she investigates the conflicting images and impulses that, even when she brought home a pit pup, rose to the surface in her perception as well as others’.

Bronwen will be joined in conversation by Ken Foster, writer and author of several books on dogs, and founder of the Sula Foundation, dedicated to responsible pit bull ownership.

Buy a copy of Pit Bull or a $15 gift card in-store at the Strand's main floor registers or at the door to attend. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Bronwen Dickey + Ken Foster

description:
Seasoned chefs and authors Dan Barber (Blue Hill, The Third Plate), Seamus Mullen (Tertulia, El Colmado, Seamus Mullen’s Hero Food), and Andrew Carmellini (Locanda Verde, The Dutch, American Flavor) come to Strand at Club Monaco for a chat about the vibrant world of New York cuisine with Chris Quinlan, the Deputy Editor of the venerable Food and Wine magazine.

Buy a copy of Seamus Mullen's Hero Food, The Third Plate, or American Flavor in-store at Strand’s Club Monaco location to attend this event. This event will take place at Club Monaco, 160 Fifth Avenue (at 21st Street). Please RSVP to RSVP@clubmonaco.com to let us know you’re coming.

Can’t make it to the event, but want a signed copy? Pre-order copies of Hero Food here, Third Plate here, or American Flavor here.
title: Dan Barber + Seamus Mullen + Andrew Carmellini + Christine Quinlan

description:
Join newfound talents and seasoned storytellers as they read their contributions to Watchlist: 32 Stories by Persons of Interest. From paranoid partners to undercover whistleblowers, personal and political privacy is up for grabs; for these authors, the Kafkaesque hall of mirrors that the surveillance state is built on is the perfect place to spin a yarn. Come on up to the Rare Book Room and watch your back as the secrets are spilled by:

  • Jim Shepard, author of The Book of Aron and Like You’d Understand, Anyway,
  • Katherine Karlin, author of Send Me Work,
  • Deji Olukotun, author of Nigerians in Space,
  • Mark Chiusano, author of Marine Park,
  • Carmen Maria Machado, recipient of the Richard Yates Short Story Prize, and
  • Miracle Jones, author of Sharing, Shifting, Seed, and Soil, and Fiction Circus editor, along with
  • Bryan Hurt, editor of Watchlist and author of Everybody Wants to Be Ambassador to France.

Buy a copy of Watchlist or a $15 gift card in-store at Strand's main floor registers or at the door to attend. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Watchlist: Readings from Persons of Interest

description:
Join the Strand and Hot Dudes Reading to celebrate the release of #HDRthebook, the irreverently witty book of photos and quips from bookish beefcakes based on the hit Instagram account, @HotDudesReading. 

In the spirit of a fun co-mingling happy hour, please bring a book you love for a boozy book swap! You know that "tell me about your book" is the best pickup line around so we're making it even easier. Drink some cocktails provided by Hooch, chat around, meet some new literary friends (maybe a hot dude or two), and if there's a connection, swap books. This event is also open to all aspiring hot dudes who like to read. You never know who might notice you!

Participation in the book swap is encouraged, but isn't mandatory. Ticket purchase is required to attend the event (see event admission below). Don’t miss this chance to get the new book signed by your Dudes of choice, pre-order the Hot Dudes calendar, snap some photos with friends, and sample some delicious cocktails and treats!

This event is 21+. Speciality cocktails will be provided by Hooch. Hooch is the first ever members only cocktail app. Hooch members receive 1 DRINK EVERY DAY at any participating venue. For as low as $9.99 a month, less than the price of ONE cocktail, our members can redeem up to 31 drinks per month! Hooch is currently available in NY, LA, Austin and Dallas.

 

Celebration Cupcakes will be provided as well by Red Velvet NYC, the gourmet baking delivery service! Simplify your kitchen with fine ingredients and easy step-by-step instructions to whip up some delicious treats.

Purchase a copy of Hot Dudes Reading or a $15 gift card in-store at Strand's main floor registers or at the door to attend. This event will take place in the Rare Book Room on the 3rd floor.
title: Hot Dudes Reading Happy Hour Book Swap

description:
Join us at Strand for an evening of debate and demystification as three leading voices in conversations of feminism and gender politics discuss the roles of women in the modern world. Kate Bolick, whose Spinster was one of the New York Times’ top books of 2015, will be joined by Rebecca Traister (New York Magazine writer-at-large, author of the “singularly triumphant” All The Single Ladies), and Marianne Schnall (co-founder & executive director of Feminist.com, and author of the Beyonce-endorsed What Will It Take to Make a Woman President?) for a talk about the presence and influence of women who seek fulfillment in non-traditional ways as a part of the feminist movement.

You won’t want to miss this wide-ranging confab on one of the biggest hot-button issues of the day!

Buy a copy of Spinster or a $15 gift card at the door to attend this event. Please note that payment is required for all online event orders at the time of checkout. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Kate Bolick + Rebecca Traister + Marianne Schnall

description:
Dr. Jonathan Fader, co-founder of Union Square Practice and team psychologist to the New York Mets, has devoted his career to helping people on and off the field, at all levels of work and play, perform to their fullest. As a sports psychologist, he’s had ample opportunity to observe not just how athletes work, but how they think and feel.

In Life as Sport: What Top Athletes Can Teach You about How to Win in Life, Dr. Fader shares the techniques and skills that top athletes across all disciplines use to enhance motivation, set productive goals, sharpen routines, and clarify thought processes, and applies them to real-world situations at work, home, and play. Whether you’re a season-ticket holder, a weekend warrior, or a novice with no clue, you’ll find something to learn from the pros that Dr. Fader’s worked with.

Please buy a copy of Life as Sport or a $15 gift card in-store at Strand's main floor registers or at the door to attend. This event will take place in the Rare Book Room on Strand's 3rd floor, accessible via the store or 826 Broadway.
title: Dr. Jonathan Fader: Life as Sport

description:
Nitehawk Cinema’s BOOZE & BOOKS invites you to visit a dystopic Britain with our 35mm presentation of Stanley Kubrick’s A CLOCKWORK ORANGE.

The screening will have prize giveaways & gift certificates courtesy of our partner Out of Print along with an inspired cocktail! Plus, The Strand will sell copies of A Clockwork Orange and other related books before the screening.

Darkly humorous, quasi musical, satirical…Controversial upon its release over four decades ago, Stanley Kubrick’s future-shock vision of Anthony Burgess’ 1962 novel continues to retain its power. Set in a dystopic England in the not-so-distant future, we’re shown a society where the line between good versus bad is, at best, blurry. Alex (Malcolm McDowell) and his “Droogs” spend their nights getting high and embarking on “a little of the old ultraviolence” until, one day, he’s jailed for murder. While in prison, Alex is subjected to intense governmental behavior modification that turn him from amoral punk to brainwashed proper citizen. His eventual return to society sees how this therapy doesn’t really solve the rampant crime problem.

For more information and to purchase tickets, click here. This event will take place at Nitehawk Cinema, 136 Metropolitan Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11249. The age policy for this screening is 18+.
title: Booze & Books @ Nighthawk Cinema: A Clockwork Orange

description:
The Very Hungry Caterpillar, by author/illustrator Eric Carle has delighted generations of readers since it was first published in 1969. The Very Hungry Caterpillar Show features a menagerie of 75 lovable puppets, faithfully adapting four beloved Eric Carle stories into interactive and live performances for children of all ages.

Some of the cast and creators of the ‘back by popular demand’ show will be joining us in the kids department to read us one of our favorite stories and to introduce us to some amazing new friends. There will be a raffle for free tickets to the show, and a chance to meet the Hungry Caterpillar in person!

This event is FREE and open to the public. The event will take place on the 2nd floor in the children's department at the Strand's store at 828 Broadway (at 12th Street). RSVP to events@strandbooks.com to let us know you're coming!
title: FREE! The Very Hungry Caterpillar Comes to the Strand

description:
Travis Barker, drummer for the multiplatinum punk band Blink-182, bares his soul in Can I Say: Living Large, Cheating Death, and Drums, Drums, Drums, his memoir of the climb to superstardom, the rocky road of recovery after the plane crash that nearly killed him, and the decades’ worth of hard-earned inspiration and insight that have kept him going. He’ll be at the Strand this summer to meet fans and sign copies of his book--don’t miss out on this chance to meet one of the most respected and prolific drummers of all time!

Buy a copy of Can I Say at the Strand's main floor registers to get it signed. Be sure to hang onto your receipt. If you already have a copy, bring it along and purchase a $15 gift card to reserve your spot. This is a signing of Can I Say only. The line for the signing will form in front of the Strand on Broadway at 12th Street starting at 5:30 PM.
title: Travis Barker

description:
Carrie Mae Weems’ stellar career in photography and the arts took off two and a half decades ago with the completion of her Kitchen Table Series, classic, revolutionary images of home life that dramatized theretofore unexamined aspects of black life. The series’ mix of personal and archetypal aspects of home life, its measured depiction of relationships between men and women, the old and the young, has made it a touchstone since its first exhibition in 1990.

For the first time, the Kitchen Table Series has been restored and recontextualized in book form, with a print edition from Damiani featuring an essay by Adrienne Edwards, scholar and curator-at-large at Minneapolis’ influential Walker Art Center. Join Adrienne and Carrie Mae in the Rare Book Room for a discussion of the genesis, execution, and legacy of the iconic work.

Buy a copy of Kitchen Table Series or a $20 gift card in-store at the Strand's main floor registers or at the door to attend. This event will take place in the Rare Book Room on Strand's 3rd floor, accessible via the store at 828 Broadway.
title: Carrie Mae Weems: The Kitchen Table Series

description:
James Franco returns to Strand to sign Straight James / Gay James, his latest genre-bending chapbook, featuring poetry that investigates the fluid divide between public and private, real and constructed. Drawing its title from an interview of “Gay James” as conducted by “Straight James,” it breaks down the many personas of James Franco as only the man himself could. Don’t miss the chance to get your copy signed and meet the author!

Please note: James will also sign other books, but no memorabilia/posters/photographs/fan art/etc will be signed. Photos are permitted when taken by a Strand staff member.

Buy a copy of Straight James/Gay James at Strand's mainfloor registers and then hop on line. You will receive a book in exchange for your receipt at the front of the line. Limited copies available, early arrival encouraged. 

The line will start forming at 11am. James will start signing around 12:30pm.
title: 6/26/2016 Event: James Franco Signs Straight James / Gay James

description:
The next volume in Mark Z. Danielewski’s latest, most ambitious undertaking arrives: The Familiar, Volume 3: Honeysuckle and Pain finds “America’s foremost literary Magus” (New York Times) continuing his wildly inventive, interwoven saga of fateful decisions and perilous sacrifice.

Released for the summer from the perils of school, Xanther and her nameless cat are settling into a comfortable routine at home. However, the rest of the Ibrahim family is growing more and more unsettled. Astair fears their stretched finances are already at a breaking point. Not even a visit from an old friend can mitigate Anwar’s feeling that he’s failing to support those he loves and that even worse things are to come. The twins, Freya and Shasti, sense something too and blame their older sister. Honeysuckles haunt the air and smell of offerings . . . Meanwhile, Cas and Bobby’s survival may depend on facing the one person they fear most. And on the other side of the world, Jingjing and Tian Li set out to find what was lost: their missing cat.

Don’t miss this chance to hear from the author of House of Leaves, Only Revolutions, and the burgeoning, epochal story of The Familiar.

Buy a copy of The Familiar, Volume 3 or a $15 gift card in-store at Strand's main floor registers or at the door to attend. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Mark Z. Danielewski

description:
Chloe Coscarelli, graduate of the Natural Gourmet Institute of Health and Culinary Arts NYC and the University of California, Berkeley, as well as the first vegan ever to win on a Food Network competition, comes to the Strand at Club Monaco to discuss her passion for meat-free cooking and living! She’ll be cooking up some treats and signing copies of her latest cookbook, Chloe's Vegan Italian Kitchen: 150 Pizzas, Pastas, Pestos, Risottos, & Lots of Creamy Italian Classics.

RSVP to this event at RSVP@clubmonaco.com. Admission will be granted on a first come, first serve basis. Copies of Chloe's Vegan Italian Kitchen will be available for purchase at the event.
title: Chloe Coscarelli @ Club Monaco

description:
With experience spanning across decades, genres and styles, each of these men has a unique and compelling perspective on gay life and its expression in literature. They’ll discuss the remarkable evolution of the LGBT community in literature with a special emphasis on the more recent and transformative decades in our nation. Join us as each panelist gives us a taste of his most recent work and responds to each other’s readings, peeling layers back on topics of race, gender, art, history and literature.

Brad Gooch is the author of the acclaimed biographies City Poet and Flannery: A Life of Flannery O’Connor (finalist for the National Book Critics Circle Award), as well as other nonfiction and three novels. The recipient of National Endowment for the Humanities and Guggenheim fellowships, he earned his Ph.D. at Columbia University and is professor of English at William Paterson University in New Jersey.

Darryl Pinckney is a longtime contributor to The New York Review as well as a frequent contributor to Granta, Slate, and The Nation. He authored the acclaimed novel, High Cotton in 1992. His most recent novel, Black Deutschland, picks up where High Cotton left off, and was published in February 2016.

Garth Greenwell is the author of Mitko, which won the 2010 Miami University Press Novella Prize and was a finalist for the Edmund White Award for Debut Fiction and a Lambda Award. A native of Louisville, Kentucky, he holds graduate degrees from Harvard University and the Iowa Writers' Workshop, where he was an Arts Fellow. His short fiction has appeared in The Paris Review and A Public Space. What Belongs to You is his first novel.

Paul Lisicky is the author of five books: The Narrow Door, Unbuilt Projects, The Burning House, Famous Builder, and Lawnboy. His work has appeared in the Atlantic, BuzzFeed, Conjunctions, Ecotone, Fence, The Offing, Ploughshares, Tin House, Unstuck, and in many other magazines and anthologies. He currently teaches in the MFA Program at Rutgers University-Camden, the low residency program at Sierra Nevada College, and at the Juniper Summer Writing Institute. He is the editor of StoryQuarterly and serves on the Writing Committee of the Fine Arts Work Center in Provincetown.

Chris Bollen is Editor at Large at Interview Magazine, and was previously the editor on V Magazine. His work has appeared in GQ, the New York Times, New York Magazine, and Artforum, among others. His first novel, Lightning People, was published in 2011. His second novel, Orient, came out with Harper in May 2015.

Buy a copy of Smash Cut or a $15 gift card in-store at Strand's main floor registers or at the door to attend. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Gay Life and Lit: Then and Now

description:
Ben Ehrenreich, National Magazine Award-winning journalist and author of the novel The Suitors, has lived in and traveled around the West Bank, observing and reporting on the daily life of Palestinian civilians in its remote corners and municipal hubs. Out of this intensive involvement comes The Way to the Spring: Life and Death in Palestine, a powerful and necessary investigation of a locale at the extremes of poverty and conflict. Join Ben for a discussion of this unflinching depiction in the vein of Kapuscinski and Gourevitch.

This event is FREE and open to the public.  RSVP to events@strandbooks.com to let us know you're coming. We'll have copies of The Way to the Spring on hand for you to purchase and get signed. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Ben Ehrenreich

description:
Join Kerby Rosanes, prolific artist behind the Sketchy Stories blog and the New York Times best-selling Animorphia for a night of slightly tipsy inspiration! He’ll be leading a drawing session based on his brand-new book, Imagimorphia: An Extreme Coloring and Search Challenge--we’ll have FREE supplies on hand for you to use and take home, as well as wine to get the creative juices flowing. Event ticket INCLUDES a copy of Imagimorphia for you to keep your imagination going after this amazing workshop. 

Bring a friend and bliss out in Kerby’s astoundingly detailed world of fantastic and bewildering forms.

This event is for guests age 21 and over.

Buy a ticket at the door to attend. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Drink & Draw with Kerby Rosanes

description:
Join Ken Pisani, screenwriter and producer, playwright, comic book author, and former cartoonist turned novelist (Ken needs to learn how to focus...) for a conversation about his debut novel, AMP’D, the story of Aaron, a ne’er-do-well turned amputee who falls deep into depression and obsession. It’s the kind of book that inspires deep feelings--Jenny Lawson, New York Times best-selling author of Furiously Happy, missing the characters when she finished the book, pleads with Ken: “Make them come back, Mr. Pisani. Make them come back now. I have a knife.”

Ken will be joined in conversation by David Seidler, the Oscar-winning screenwriter of The King’s Speech.

Buy a copy of Amp'd or a $15 gift card to attend. This event will take place in the Rare Book Room, on the 3rd floor of our store at 828 Broadway.
title: Ken Pisani + David Seidler

description:
Sloane Crosley’s debut novel The Clasp, a national bestseller (like the essay collections that preceded it), is a fun, funny, acutely observed romp around the world and across the psychic chaos of its variously neurotic and narcissistic central trio as they’re led on a wild-goose chase for a long-lost treasure. Now out in paperback, Sloane will be at Strand to discuss the novel, her writing at large, and her generation-defining skewering of late-20-somethings with everything to prove.

Joining her in the Rare Book Room will be Adelle Wadlman, fellow bestselling author of The Love Affairs of Nathaniel P., an acclaimed New York Times bestseller that’s been translated into German, Italian, French, Spanish, Portuguese, Russian, Czech and Dutch. Don’t miss this meeting of two brilliant, brainy chroniclers of young life looking in on itself.

Buy a copy of The Clasp or a $15 gift card at Strand's main floor registers or at the door to attend. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Sloane Crosley + Adelle Waldman

description:
Lindy West’s writing at GQ, the Guardian, the New York Times and elsewhere has garnered her an audience eager to hear her thoughts on feminism, culture, and body image. Her outspoken commitment to social justice issues as the founder of the destigmatization campaign #ShoutYourAbortion have placed her at the forefront of conversations over sexuality and reproductive rights. Her fanbase extends to Lena Dunham, who called her “an essential voice for women,” and Caitlin Moran, who called her debut memoir, Shrill: Notes from a Loud Woman “a thrilling, kick-ass, joyous ROAR of a book.” She’ll be at Strand to discuss Shrill and everything else--don’t miss this chance to hear from a hilarious and heartfelt breakout voice.

Lindy will be joined in conversation by friend and stand-up comic, Hari Kondabolu. 

Buy a copy of Shrill or a $15 gift card in-store at the Strand's registers or at the door to attend. This event will take place in the Rare Book Room on the 3rd floor of Strand at 828 Broadway.
title: Lindy West

description:
In this musical celebration of literature, a bookworm sings her way through Broadway and beyond. Journey with vocalist Gina Morgano as she shares classic stories of writers, readers and literature's most beloved characters amidst the backdrop of rare, leather-bound books.

  • Gina Morgano, vocalist
  • Directed by Eric Van Tielen
  • Music Directed by Eric Shorey 

Tickets to this event are $20 and include a $20 Strand gift card as well as one beverage (must be 21+ with valid ID) and a treat. Please note that payment is required for all online event orders at the time of checkout. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street. Admission is free for children 12 and under.

 

Tickets are available at Strand's main floor registers or at the door to attend. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: A Trip to the Library: A Musical Celebration of Literature

description:
Join us for a night with Brooklyn author of independently released Concrete Fever and the leader of the Greenpoint Writers Group, Nathaniel Kressen. He’ll give us the inside scoop on his brand-new novel Dahlia Cassandra, a haunting, heartfelt story of a family in the throes of change, a novel about faith and fantasy that examines the emptiness that resides within all of us, and the things we do to fill it. Check out the book trailer HERE!

Nathaniel will be joined in conversation Dallas Athent, editor of Bushwick Nightz and author of pieces for BUST Magazine, xoJane, The Gloss, VIDA and more.

 

Buy a copy of Dahlia Cassandra or a $15 gift card in-store at Strand's main floor registers or at the door to attend. This event will take place in the Rare Book Room, located on the third floor of Strand Book Store.
title: Nathaniel Kressen + Dallas Athent

description:
Jensen Karp, the man formerly known as Hot Karl, never guessed that he’d go from a 12-year-old rapping at a friend’s bar mitzvah in the Valley to a million-dollar deal. But when a label exec tuned into his record-breaking rap-battling streak on a popular radio contest, he was launched to the forefront of a search for new rap voices in the early 2000’s. In his brand-new memoir, Kanye West Owes Me $300 & Other True Stories from a White Rapper Who Almost Made It Big, Karp airs it all out: the artists he recorded with like Kanye, Redman, Fabolous, Mya, and will.i.am, the drama that kept his album in the vaults (two words: Slim Shady), and what he found instead of rap glory.

Joining Jensen to talk rap, comedy, and everything in between will be Saturday Night Live’s Vanessa Bayer.

 

Buy a copy of Kanye West Owes Me $300 or a $15 gift card in-store at Strand's main floor registers or at the door to attend. This event will take place in the Rare Book Room, located on the third floor, accessible via 826 Broadway.
title: Jensen Karp + Vanessa Bayer

description:
Michael Ian Black, comedian and author of books for adults, children, and those in between, turns his quizzical eye on the confounding phenomenon that stalks the political scene with A Child’s First Book of Trump, illustrated in classically whimsical style by Marc Rosenthal.

The Trump is a curious creature, very often spotted in the wild, but confounding to our youngest citizens. A business mogul, reality TV host, and now…political candidate? Kids (and let’s be honest many adults) might have difficulty discerning just what this thing that’s been dominating news coverage this election cycle is. Could he actually be real? Are those…words coming out of his mouth? Why are his hands so tiny? And perhaps most importantly, what on earth do you do when you encounter an American Trump?

Join Michael as he reads and discusses A Child’s First Book of Trump with author, blogger, Fox News host, and collaborator (on America, You Sexy Bitch), Meghan McCain, and signs the book along with Marc.

This event is FREE and open to the public. Copies of A Child's First Book of Trump will be available at the event. This event will take place in the Strand's Rare Book Room, on the 3rd floor, accessible via elevator from the store at 828 Broadway (at 12th Street).
title: FREE: Michael Ian Black +Meghan McCain

description:
Join some of NYC’s best bad women as they share their incendiary work and instigate further upending of good girl mores. Featuring prolific punk with a heart of gold, Lily Burana; unrepentant blond and genius illustrator, Jacqueline Frances; generation-defining wit, Ryan Gosling medium Danielle Henderson; deranged crafter and hugely successful DJ, Gabriella Paiella; gender transcending beauty authority Arabelle Sicardi; *last-minute addition* from Buzzfeed and the Internet Explorer podcast, Katie Notopoulos; and notoriously shameless opinion-haver, Charlotte Shane.

Buy a $15 gift card in-store at Strand's main floor registers or at the door to attend. This event will take place on the 3rd floor in the Rare Book Room, accessible via 826 Broadway.
title: Bad Advice from Bad Women

description:
Come celebrate Tin House editor Rob Spillman's All Tomorrow's Parties. It’s a night full of literary stars, from editors to agents, talking about how to make it in the publishing world. The panel will be moderated by New School professor Susan Shapiro, author of the novel What’s Never Said.

Panelists include:

  • Salon editor-in-chief David Daley (author of Ratf**ked)
  • Norton editor Jill Bialosky (author of The Prize)
  • Grove editor Corrina Barsan
  • Berkeley/Penguin Executive Editor Danielle Perez
  • Literary agent Ayesha Pande
  • Debut memoirist Aspen Matis (author of Girl in the Woods)

Buy a copy of All Tomorrow's Parties or a $15 gift card in-store at the Strand's main floor registers or at the door to attend. The event will take place on the 3rd floor in the Strand's Rare Book Room, accessible via elevator from the main store.
title: Rob Spillman + Susan Shapiro: The Secrets of Publishing

description:
One of the top novels of 2015 according to Kirkus, Buzzfeed, Electric Literature, and others, Kathleen Alcott’s Infinite Home tells the story of an ad-hoc family of spiritually, mentally, physically, emotionally crippled renters piecing together a life in a Brooklyn brownstone. Faced with their widowed landlady’s deteriorating condition and the eviction notices served by her unscrupulous son, the tenants—Paulie, an unusually disabled man and his burdened sister, Claudia; Edward, a misanthropic stand-up comic; Adeleine, a beautiful agoraphobe; Thomas, a young artist recovering from a stroke—must find in one another what the world has not yet offered or has taken from them: family, respite, security, worth, love.

Don’t miss this chance to celebrate the novel that the New Yorker called "captivating" on the occasion of its paperback release, and get your copy signed by the author.

RSVP to this event at RSVP@clubmonaco.com. Admission will be granted on a first come, first serve basis. Copies of Infinite Home will be available for purchase at the event. This event will take place at Club Monaco's flagship location, 160 Fifth Avenue at 21st Street.
title: Kathleen Alcott @ Club Monaco

description:
From homeless tagger to internationally renowned muralist and graffiti artist, Stik’s journey has left his mark all over his native London as well as buildings across Europe, Asia, and America. Now that his iconic, socially-conscious stik-figures have been collected into a book, he’ll be coming to the Strand (a block over from one of his drawings at 13th Street!) to sign copies and meet his fans. Don’t miss this chance to meet the man that the Daily Mail called “the next Banksy!”

Anyone who buys a copy of STIK to be signed is eligible to enter a lottery to win a set of limited-edition lithographic cardstock Stik posters, signed by Stik himself. The set, one orange and one blue, are one of only five printed and depict the same image seen on the book’s cover.

Please note: This event will take place on the Strand's 2nd floor, in the art department.

Copies of STIK can be purchased on the second floor at the event.
title: STIK

description:
Have you been a Harry Potter fan since day one? Did you sink into a deep depression after you finished the epilogue of book 7? Then today is your day.

Join us at Strand to celebrate the MIDNIGHT RELEASE of Harry Potter and the Cursed Child: Parts I & II, which--for those of you not on Pottermore--is the continuation of Harry’s story as a wizard and as a father after his kids have started at Hogwarts. Join us at 8pm at Strand to hang out with HP devotees while competing in trivia, winning prizes, and geeking out about our old friend Harry--costumes are encouraged! We'll also have a state-of-the-art photobooth from OM Digital to commemorate this magical night, treats to eat from Fat Witch and beverages from Boylan.

  • 9:00pm -- Kids (0-14 yrs) costume contest 
  • 10:00pm -- Group (2-5 people) costume contest
  • 11:00pm -- Adult (15+ yrs) costume contest
  • PLUS trivia, coloring, live sorting, and more!!

At 11:30pm after the store closes, we'll gather you all up to receive your book. Like First Years waiting to be sorted.  

When the clock strikes midnight and it’s Harry’s birthday, you'll all receive your books! Make sure you're at Strand before 11:30pm, because the doors will be locked after that point.

A few things to note: You must purchase your copy of the book before getting in line at 11:30; you may do so by placing your order at the store and holding on to your receipt (which will be your ticket to the event).  Limited copies are available. Your purchase only reserves your book, not your place in line. 

Limited copies are available for purchase in store. Please go to the main floor registers and ask to buy the book for the event-- hold on to you receipt as proof of purchase!  At 8pm, you can check in downstairs and get your wristband when you show your receipt. See you tonight!
title: Harry Potter and the Cursed Child MIDNIGHT BOOK RELEASE!!

description:
The Real Art Therapists of New York are back! Come to the Strand for a Pop-Up Coloring Bar: a day of relaxation, creativity, and self-reflection. The Real Art Therapists of New York Coloring Book features artwork by 50 professional art therapists living and working in New York who invite you to start a new journey towards a more creative and de-stressed life. Join a few of the artists in the Rare Book Room and choose a page from their beloved coloring book to see first-hand how art can be used for wellness and discovery.

Purchase of a book enters you in a raffle for a chance to win a private art therapy session with a licensed art therapist.

Colored pencils and coloring sheets will be provided!

Limited tickets ($10 gift card) will be available in-store at the door. This event will take place in the Strand's Rare Book Room, on the 3rd floor, accessible via elevator from the store at 826 Broadway (at 12th Street).
title: Pop-Up Coloring Bar at Strand Book Store

description:
Sarah Andersen’s “Sarah's Scribbles” webcomics have been beloved for their frank, honest depiction of body image, self-consciousness, introversion, relationships, and the frequency of bra-washing. Her first book, Adulthood is a Myth, chronicles the wasting of entire beautiful weekends on the internet, the unbearable agony of holding hands on the street with a gorgeous guy, and dreaming all day of getting home and back into pajamas. In other words, the horrors and awkwardnesses of young modern life. Oh and it’s totally not autobiographical. At all.

Sarah will be at the Strand to talk with her many fans all about the weird and wonderful world of not growing up. Commiserate and get your copy of Adulthood is a Myth signed by the author!

Buy a copy of Adulthood is a Myth or a $10 gift card in-store at Strand's main floor registers or at the door to attend. This event will take place in the Strand's Rare Book Room, on the 3rd floor, accessible via elevator from the store at 826 Broadway (at 12th Street).
title: Sarah Andersen: Adulthood is a Myth

description:
The idea that “b*tches be crazy” is not new. Since the dawn of Christianity, women have been construed and constructed as mentally unstable. We'll examine the origins of these ideas, the lack of protection women had because they were wards of their fathers or husbands, and investigate the lasting implications of this legacy of women and madness. In this class, we will look closely at women like Zelda Fitzgerald and Sylvia Plath, deconstructing their actual lived experiences and how that may have contributed to their perceived madness. We will also-- of course-- discuss their husbands F. Scott Fitzgerald and Ted Hughes and how these men factored into the mythologized stories of their respective wives. Topics will include: religion, European precedents, the first biologists and early gynecology.

Buy a $20 ticket to attend this event-- admission will include 1 drink, courtesy of Jenny & Francois. Please note that payment is required for all online event orders at the time of checkout. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Think Olio: The Myth of Women & Madness

description:
Chuck Palahniuk returns with the graphic novel Fight Club 2, picking up the influential and incendiary story of Tyler Durden ten years down the road. Chuck will be at Strand to sign copies of Fight Club 2 and meet fans of his copious bestselling and beloved books.

Please note:

  • This FIGHT CLUB 2 appearance is a signing only.
  • Chuck will not be performing or reading at this event.
  • This is a ticketed event and each ticket will include a copy of the FIGHT CLUB 2 hardcover.
  • Tickets must be purchased in order to join the signing line, one book per person--no exceptions.
  • Due to the overwhelming response to this event, signing will be limited to FIGHT CLUB 2 only--no other books or items of memorabilia will be signed. We apologize for the inconvenience.
  • Line formation will begin at the corner of 12th and Broadway at 2 PM.
  • We will cut off the line at 9 PM.

 

Due to the overwhelming response to this event, tickets for this signing are sold out. We apologize for any confusion and inconvenience this may cause. If you’ve already purchased a ticket, the line will be forming at 2:00 PM on the day of the event, at the corner of 12th Street and Broadway.
title: Chuck Palahniuk signs FIGHT CLUB 2

description:
Opium, prostitution, and murder. Welcome to Chinatown at the turn of the century. In this true crime account Scott Seligman tells of the DA’s struggle to suppress the newly forming secret societies (tongs) filling the streets with sin and the police with bribes. Each day brings more violence and the typical scare tactics of arrests and executions aren’t working. Seligman explores three decades worth of crime and reform in Tong Wars: The Untold Story of Vice, Money, and Murder in New York's Chinatown.

Join us in the Rare Book Room to learn about Chinatown’s dark past.

Event Admission
title: Scott Seligman

description:
First ­time author Nicolaia Rips has a teenage coming of age story like no other. She used to struggle to fit in with the kids at school because unlike her classmates who go home to regular apartments,  Nicolaia  has  lived  at  the  Chelsea  Hotel  all  her  life.  As  the  years  go  by  Nicolaia slowly realizes  that  her  neighbors,  from  the  lady  who  keeps  a  pink  handgun  strapped  to  her ankle to her babysitter who possibly works as an escort, may be teaching her the most valuable lessons for growing up and living in the big city.

Nicolaia will be joined in conversation by model, actress and author, Paulina Porizkova.

Join us in the Rare Book Room to hear first hand what it's like growing up in the legendary hotel!

Buy a copy of Trying to Float or a $15 gift card in-store at Strand's main floor registers or at the door to attent. This event will take place in the Rare Book Room, on the 3rd floor, accessible by elevator from the store at 828 Broadway (at 12th Street).
title: Nicolaia Rips

description:
Pop stars who live glamorous lives are the exceptions in the music business and not the rule. Standing in the wings are those many talented and deserving musicians who just barely missed their big break. Lost Rockers profiles musicians who were on the verge of success but never quite "made it." Some of them were so close they could taste it, and others never had a chance.

Join us in the Rare Book Room as authors Steven Blush (American Hardcore, .45 Dangerous Minds and American Hair Metal), Paul Rachman (director of seminal punk documentary American Hardcore in 2006) and Tony Mann (performer, designer, and musician) tell the stories of the stars that could have been.

This event will feature Gloria Jones and Jake Holmes.

Gloria is a Los Angeles soul singer, did the original version of “Tainted Love”, and became a Grammy-nominated songwriter for her work with Jackson Five, Marvin Gaye and Gladys Knight. Gloria appeared in the award winning film " Twenty Feet From Stardom ."

Jake Holmes is a New York based musician who wrote but never received credit for Led Zeppelin’s “Dazed and Confused.” The song was stolen by Jimmy Page after his Yardbirds shared a bill with Jake at The Village Theater. James quit to become a famous jingle writer, penning Dr. Pepper (“Be A Pepper”), Gillette (“Best A Man Can Get”) and the U.S. Army (“Be a All That You Can Be”).

This event is open to the public. Copies of Lost Rockers will be available to purchase at the event. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Lost Rockers - from the team behind cult classic American Hardcore

description:
Join the Vulture Insiders, Vulture’s most tuned-in pop-culture obsessives, Vulture books editor Boris Kachka, and author of one of summer's must-reads, Stephanie Danler,  to discuss Sweetbitter,  a lush, raw, thrilling novel of the senses.

Please RSVP to vultureinsiders@vulture.com. Feel free to buy a copy of Sweetbitter, but purchase is not required. It’s more important to bring your questions, comments, and insights! The event will be located on the 2nd floor of Strand at 828 Broadway at 12th Street. If you can’t make the meeting, we’ll be broadcasting the event on Periscope. Download the Periscope app from the App Store or Google Play, follow Vulture, and tune in Wednesday, July 6 at 7:30 p.m.!
title: VULTURE INSIDERS BOOK CLUB MEETING: Sweetbitter by Stephanie Danner

description:
Only in ‘Murica, it’s time to assemble in the _________, for a _ ________!

  • …Supreme Court, baby kiss-off.
  • …Situation Room, game of Nuclear Football.

STRAND’S RARE BOOK ROOM, CARDS AGAINST HUMANITY PARTY!

Almost just in time for Independence Day, Cards Against Humanity is back at the Strand! Vet your closest friends, assemble your campaign, and come on up to the Rare Book Room for an evening of all-American horrible fun, co-hosted and moderated by John E. Sullivan, organizer of the world's largest Cards Against Humanity Meetup! We’ll have snacks on hand from Sigmund’s Pretzels and beer from Coney Island Brewing Company to keep you from dropping out before November. (This event is 21+.)

Buy a $15 gift card in-store at the Strand's main floor registers or at the door to attend. This event will take place on the 3rd floor in the Rare Book Room, accessible via 828 Broadway.
title: All-’Murican Cards Against Humanity Party

description:
George Watsky’s fame as a slam poet and rapper has been earned through hard work and relentless performing and competing. In How to Ruin Everything, his first collection of essays, he opens up about everything: his life on the road, the loss of a friend to suicide, his expulsion from school for rap battling, and his role as an international ivory smuggler. Fans of Watsky’s outrageously dextrous wit won’t want to miss an up-close-and-personal look into the messy mind of this wordy wunderkind.

Buy a copy of How to Ruin Everything or a $15 gift card to attend this event. Please note that payment is required for all online event orders at the time of checkout. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.

The line for this event will be forming on Broadway at 12th Street at 5:30 PM. If you've already purchased a copy of How to Ruin Everything or gift card for admission, join the line and we'll check you in. Due to space constraints, we'll be admitting fans who haven't purchased in advance on a standby basis. Additionally, this event will be standing room only.
title: George Watsky

description:
Lucky young Americans in Paris during the 1920s, including Hemingway, Fitzgerald and Gershwin, measured themselves against monumental figures of the time: Joyce, Picasso, Stravinsky. Powerful personal connections link the works that grew from near-daily contact with other geniuses. What has been obscured by the halo of their success is that many were audaciously trying media with which they had little experience. Writers and composers painted up a storm, artists turned into poets, and the theater gathered dream teams of talent. Hemingway was a connoisseur of contemporary art, Gershwin and cummings exhibited paintings, Leger made films, Pound wrote an opera, and Picasso was spending more time backstage at the Ballets Russes than in the studio. This is a celebration of the courage to go beyond one’s specialty to experiment.

Buy a $20 ticket in-store at Strand to attend this event-- admission will include 1 drink. Please note that payment is required for all online event orders at the time of checkout. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Think Olio: The Other Side of Genius: Interdisciplinary Artists in the Jazz Age

description:
Oscar Wilde popularized the idea that Beauty, rather than Truth or Goodness, should be the aim of art -- and by extension pop culture. It was an idea that gave us stunning paintings that are just splashes of color and movies that are pure roller coasters. But did removing accuracy and moral aims from art lead us into our current predicament where we blame stories for preaching violence, patriarchy, racism and sexism? Join professor Geoff Klock, associate professor at BMCC-CUNY, for a lecture on art-for-art's-sake, elitism, and evil in the Rare Book Room.

Buy a $20 ticket to attend this event-- admission will include 1 drink, courtesy of Jenny & Francois. Please note that payment is required for all online event orders at the time of checkout. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Think Olio: The People vs Oscar Wilde: Aestheticism, Popular Culture, Evil

description:
Join Bob Mehr, music writer at Commercial Appeal and longtime contributor at MOJO, for a conversation with Superchunk drummer and Best Show cohost Jon Wurster about his blockbuster biography, Trouble Boys: The True Story of the Replacements, the Last Rock 'n' Roll Band. A decade in the making, featuring interviews with reclusive frontman Paul Westerberg, bassist Tommy Stinson, and the family of the late guitarist Bob Stinson, Trouble Boys tells a story of triumph and self-destruction that’s never before been told in full. ‘Mats fans, rock historians, and anyone with a soft spot for an underdog story won’t want to miss this conversation between two diehard buffs.

Buy a copy of Trouble Boys or a $15 gift card to attend. This event will take place in the Strand's Rare Book Room, on the 3rd floor, accessible via 826 Broadway.
title: Bob Mehr + Jon Wurster

description:
Join Mary Giuliani, caterer to the stars at the popular Mary Giuliani Catering and Events, comes to Strand’s Club Monaco shop to dish all about her dishes. She’ll be running down the essentials to a great party as she tells them in her book, The Cocktail Party: Eat, Drink, Play, Recover. From the legendary parties of her past to your own future unforgettable nights, she'll be talking stories and tips and signing books with superstar chef, writer, and restaurateur Mario Batali, who called the book a "handbook for living well and appreciating life with joyous abandon." 

Buy a copy of The Cocktail Party at Strand to attend this event. The event will be located at Club Monaco’s flagship store, 160 Fifth Avenue at 21st Street. If you're planning to attend, RSVP here.
title: Food Stories with Mary Giuliani @ Club Monaco

description:
L.A.-based artists and co-producers of Amazon's acclaimed Transparent, Rhys Ernst and Zackary Drucker document their six-year partnership in this photoseries that the New York Times called "extremely provocative" when exhibited at the Whitney Biennial. Relationship is the story of two people in love, in a culture where the notion of gender has become more fluid and at a time when trans people have never been more accepted. As both subjects and creators of these images, Drucker and Ernst, both of whom transitioned gender, represent themselves in the midst of shifting subjectivities and identities. Collectively, these photographs, which have been compared to the work of Larry Clark, Nan Goldin, and Cindy Sherman, document the story of their romantic and creative collaboration over a period of six years. Simultaneously narrative and documentary, they touch on a host of dynamics, offering autobiography as ambiguity and unraveling identity as a construction.

Male becomes female. Female becomes male. Life becomes art. Private becomes public. A major feature of the 2014 Whitney Biennial, this series of photographs that the New York Times called "extremely provocative" explores ideas of transformation both physical and psychological. It's the story of two people in love, in a culture where the notion of gender has become more fluid and at a time when trans people have never been more accepted. As both subjects and creators of these images, Drucker and Ernst, both of whom transitioned gender, represent themselves in the midst of shifting subjectivities and identities. Collectively, these photographs, which have been compared to the work of Larry Clark, Nan Goldin, and Cindy Sherman, document the story of their romantic and creative collaboration over a period of six years. Simultaneously narrative and documentary, they touch on a host of dynamics, offering autobiography as ambiguity and unraveling identity as a construction.

Rhys and Zackary will be joined in conversation by Stuart Comer, Chief Curator of the Department of Media and Performance Art at The Museum of Modern Art. His recent exhibitions at MoMA have included Bouchra Khalili: The Mapping Journeys Project (2016); Transmissions: Art in Eastern Europe and Latin America, 1960–1980 (2015); Cut to Swipe (2014); and Simone Forti and Charlemagne Palestine: illlummminnnatttionnnsssss!!!!!!! (2014). His forthcoming exhibitions include Tony Oursler: Imponderable (2016); the retrospective Bruce Conner: It's All True (2016); and a survey of Mark Leckey's work at MoMA PS1. Mr. Comer was co-curator of the Whitney Museum of American Art’s 2014 Biennial, and previously served as the first Curator of Film at Tate Modern, London. 

Also partaking in the discussion will be Kate Bornstein, author, performance artist, playwright and public speaker who has written multiple award-winning books in the field of Women and Gender Studies. Her 2006 book, Hello, Cruel World: 101 Alternatives to Suicide for Teens, Freaks, and Other Outlaws propelled Kate into an international position of advocacy for marginalized youth. She has earned two citations of honor from the New York City Council and garnered praise from civil rights groups around the globe. Affectionately known to thousands around the world as Auntie Kate, Kate lives in New York City with her girlfriend, author and sex educator, Barbara Carrellas, along with one cat, two dogs, and a turtle. Most recently, Kate co-starred in E! TV’s reality series, “I Am Cait.”

Buy a copy of Relationship or a $15 gift card in-store at Strand's main floor registers or at the door to attend. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Zackary Drucker + Rhys Ernst: Relationship

description:
Colorful grease paint, gravity-defying wigs, and elaborate sewing marvels: welcome to the wonderful world of cosplay. Comic book writer/artist, and animator Dash Shaw loving explores this costume-crazed fandom in his latest book Cosplayers.

Dash will be joined in conversation with writer and curator Dan Nadel. Additionally, Dash will be screening a preview of an upcoming animated movie he's been working on.

Buy a copy of Cosplayers or a $15 gift card in-store at Strand's main floor registers or at the door to attend. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Dash Shaw: Cosplayers

description:
What is the name of Thor’s hammer? What does J.A.R.V.I.S. stand for? In what Russian city was Black Widow born? Are these questions too easy for you and your friends? Then come on out and compete in our Marvel Trivia battle!

What better way to celebrate the release of Marvel: Absolutely Everything You Need to Know than with a head-scratching trivia challenge? Authors Lorraine Cink and John Sazaklis will be hosting the battle, awarding some prizes, and will be available for signing.

Join us in the Rare Book Room to test your knowledge against fellow comic-book enthusiasts and see who’s the real Marvel master! We'll have snacks from Sigmund's Pretzels, along with trivia, prizes, signings--’nuff said!

Buy a copy of Marvel: Absolutely Everything You Need to Know or a $15 gift card at the door to attend this event. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Marvel Trivia Night! with Lorraine Cink +John Sazaklis

description:
More than twenty Garn Press Authors will travel from the U.K., Canada, and from across the U.S. to join with readers in a celebration of the remarkable books by Garn Press thought leaders, activists, original thinkers and writers of conscience who inspire people to act. Throughout the week Garn Press will be featuring videos from all the events from the Garn Press Author Celebration.

This remarkable event will include a Readers Theater performance in which all attending Garn authors – fiction and non-fiction writers — will participate. Both profound and funny, the Readers Theater will combine big idea fiction with the power of science to stand up for human rights in the struggle for the future that is taking place all over the world.
