The Readers Theater will include literature, magical, quixotic and liberatory, sane and inane, world affairs, how we live and how we die, how we educate our children, how our political masters frame our lives, how we rebel and create our own frames, how we struggle for the future, struggle with existential risks that in past generations didn’t exist – or if they did we did not know about them.

We hope you will join us to cheer Garn authors on and then participate in the conversation with them that will follow about the sheer joyfulness of reading books and the angst we all feel as we make connections between these uncertain times and the books we read. Special thanks to Jerry Harste for the Hearts painting.

This event is FREE and open to the public. More information along with a full list of attending authors can be found here. The event will take place in the Strand's Rare Book Room, located on the 3rd floor, accessible via the elevators at 826 Broadway (at 12th Street).
title: Garn Press Author Celebration: Readers Theater

description:
How do we challenge beauty standards while being subject to them? How much does our appearance create our identity (or is it the other way round)? What kinds of beauty standards do we embrace or reject, and why? The Anti-Photoshopping movement and the Truth in Advertising bill are making the question of beauty more important than ever, and each of these celebrated New York authors have explored it in different ways.

Offering perspectives that are historical, heartfelt, harrowing and hilarious, Georgia Clark (The Regulars), Phoebe Robinson (You Can’t Touch My Hair And Other Things I Still Have To Explain), Emily Schultz (The Blondes) and Autumn Whitefield-Madrano (Face Value: The Hidden Ways Beauty Shapes Women’s Lives) will get down and dirty with the good, the bad and the ugly of beauty. The discussion will be moderated by Jennifer Goldstein, executive beauty and health editor at Marie Claire and cohost of the Fat Mascara podcast. Join the conversation and buy a copy of The Regulars or a $15 gift card to attend, then stick around after the talk for a signing!

Buy a copy of The Regulars or a $15 gift card in-store at Strand's main floor registers or at the door to attend. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Bad Beauty: How Women Write About Beauty (in a Post Lena Dunham World)

description:
New American Comedy is a Brooklyn-based collective that produces inclusive, alternative variety shows, providing comedians, musicians, authors, and performance artists a hate-free environment in which to share personal and experimental work. Join us at The Strand to celebrate the release of our second zine with readings from some of NYC’s best comedians and writers.

With Readings From:

  • Cynthia Schemmer (She Shreds, Swanning, Radiator Hospital)
  • Jacqueline Novak (Author of How To Weep in Public, The Late Late Show with James Corden)
  • Jeanette Wall (ATO Records, Miscreant Zine + Records)
  • Mitra Jouhari (Full Frontal with Samantha Bee, Three Busy Debras)
  • Steven Markow (founder, NAC)
  • Seth Simons (Paste Magazine, Splitsider)
  • Zach Mandeville (founder, NAC)

Hosted by Catherine Cohen (UCB, Brooklyn Comedy Festival) and Angelica Blevins (Sex and Monsters, NAC)

Doors will open at 7:30, with the show beginning at 8.

Buy a $10 gift card in-store at Strand's main floor registers or at the door to attend. This event will take place in the Strand's Rare Book Room, on the 3rd floor, accessible via elevator from the store at 826 Broadway (at 12th Street).
title: New American Comedy at The Strand

description:
Michael Wolf and Colin O’Brien, notoriously good readers and pretty okay writers, are back for another round of literary comedy in the Rare Book Room! The Pagemasters return with their inimitable blend of adult Reading Rainbow/drunk college writing workshop (complete with free drinks!), lowbrow fiction, highbrow erotica and celebrity guests performing stand up, storytelling, music and more.

Michael and Colin are two dapper young comedians (often referred to as the George Clooneys of the New York comedy scene) and together make up the comedy duo Nancy. They've performed at San Francisco Sketchfest, Comedy Central 'Comics to Watch' Showcase, MTV, The Upright Citizens Brigade Theater, Brooklyn Comedy Festival, NYC Sketchfest, the Boston Comedy Arts Festival, Austin Sketchfest, and The Special Without Brett Davis as well as running a monthly show at Union Hall.

They’ll be joined this time around by:
 
  • Jacqueline Novak (How to Weep in Public, Quality Notions)
  • Dave Hill (Dave Hill Doesn’t Live Here Any More, WFMU’s The Goddamn Dave Hill Show)
  • Joel Kim Booster (Billy on the Street, Conan)
  • musical guest Katie Von Schleicher

...and more!

Drinks will be provided by Brooklyn's own Sixpoint Brewery.

Buy a $10 gift card in-store at the Strand's main floor registers or at the door to attend. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Pagemasters with Colin & Michael!

description:
From xeroxed zines to glossy design tomes, lit journals to sci-fi anthologies, the Publishing community on Kickstarter brings all sorts of creative ideas to life — and on August 16, we’ll be talking about ideas inspired by the Big Apple. Join Margot Atwell (Kickstarter’s Publishing Outreach Lead) and Kickstarter creators Brian Foo (Continuous City), Tim Reitzes (The New York Pizza Book), and Jesse Reed and Hamish Smyth (NYC and NASA Transit Authority Graphics Standards Manual reprints) for a discussion on the creative process, building community around ideas, and making books in New York City. Stick around for audience questions, bookish conversation, and refreshments.

This event is FREE and open to the public; reserve your spot here. Copies of Continuous City, The New York Pizza Book, and the NYCTA and NASA Graphics Standards Manuals will be available for purchase at the event. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Kickstarter Presents: I Read New York: A Conversation on Creativity

description:
Join the Vulture Insiders, Vulture’s most tuned-in pop-culture obsessives, Vulture books editor Boris Kachka, and the author of one of 2016’s must-reads, Tony Tulathimutte, to discuss Private Citizens, which critics are calling “the first great millennial novel.”

Please RSVP HERE. Feel free to buy a copy of Private Citizens, but purchase is not required. It’s more important to bring your questions, comments, and insights! The event will be located in the Rare Book Room on the 3rd floor of Strand at 828 Broadway at 12th Street. If you can’t make the meeting, we’ll be broadcasting the event on Periscope. Download the Periscope app from the App Store or Google Play, follow Vulture, and tune in Thursday, August 11 at 7:30 p.m.!
title: Vulture Insiders Book Club with Tony Tulathimutte

description:
In a social circle comprised of the elites of black Chicago, the Pulitzer Prize-winning cultural critic Margo Jefferson was raised in a world of contradiction. “I call it Negroland,” she writes, “because I still find ‘Negro’ a word of wonders, glorious and terrible.” Her incendiary and icy, mischievous and provocative, celebratory and elegiac memoir of that name went on to win the National Book Critics Circle Award, and for its paperback release, she’ll be in the Strand’s Rare Book Room to discuss the world of exclusive sororities, fraternities, networks, and clubs—a world in which skin color and hair texture were relentlessly evaluated alongside scholarly and professional achievements.

Joining Margo in conversation will be Rachel Kaadzi Ghansah, contributor at The New York Times Magazine, as well as a finalist for the National Magazine Award with bylines at The Paris Review, The Believer, Bookforum, and many more.

Buy a copy of Negroland or a $15 gift card at the door to attend this event. Please note that payment is required for all online event orders at the time of checkout. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Margo Jefferson + Rachel Kaadzi Ghansah

description:
John Doe’s Under the Big Black Sun: A Personal History of L.A. Punk chronicles the friendship and love, ambition and feuds, grandiose dreams and cultural rage out of which grew groundbreaking bands like The Minutemen, Black Flag, the Go-Go’s, and of course, Doe’s own band, the iconic X. Featuring his own distinctive voice along with those of X-mate Exene Cervenka, the voluble Henry Rollins, Mike Watt, and many more, it’s a story of a vanguard moment in American musical history, when country, blues, Latin music, and many other strands were twisted up with the frustration, power, and back-alley energy that broke punk around the world.

John will be talking all about the book and the stories therein, and dipping into his 40-year songbook, in the Rare Book Room--don’t miss an evening with a legend of punk rock.

John will only sign copies of Under the Big Black Sun;  he will not be signing albums or other memorabilia.

Buy a copy of Under the Big Black Sun:A Personal History of L.A. Punk or a $15 gift card in-store at Strand's main floor registers or at the door to attend. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: John Doe of X

description:
“Every one of us is a zoo in our own right - a colony enclosed within a single body. A multi-species collective. An entire world,” opens award-winning science writer Ed Yong’s new book, I CONTAIN MULTITUDES: The Microbes Within Us and a Grander View of Life.

The study of biology has been teaching us about how we live and function for hundreds of years, but only recently have microbes gained much-deserved attention. I CONTAIN MULTITUDES lets us explore that world for the first time, allowing us to see how microbes do everything from defending us from disease to guiding our behavior.

Join Ed, in conversation with Radiolab's Robert Krulwich, as we think a little smaller and make our minds a little broader.

Buy a copy of I Contain Multitudes or a $15 gift card in-store at the Strand's registers or at the door to attend. This event will take place in the Rare Book Room on the 3rd floor of Strand at 828 Broadway.
title: Ed Yong: I Contain Multitudes with Radiolab's Robert Krulwich

description:
Tama Janowitz’s days in the literary Brat Pack of the 1980s, the wild ride chronicled in her genre-defining collection Slaves of New York, are long gone--much like her contemporaries in that storied, tumultuous cohort, names like Bret Easton Ellis and Jay McInerney, she’s moved on and moved out. In Scream: A Memoir of Glamour and Dysfunction, she chronicles the quirky literary world of young downtown New York in the go-go 1980s and her subsequent journey from the center of the action to her life today in a tiny upstate town.

Tama will be back in her old stomping grounds for the launch of this, her first memoir, to talk with Kat Kinsman (author of the upcoming book Hi Anxiety and the senior food and drinks editor at Time Inc.'s Extra Crispy) about how she, and the city, have changed since their younger, wilder days.

Buy a copy of Scream or a $15 gift card in-store at the Strand's registers or at the door to attend. This event will take place in the Rare Book Room on the 3rd floor of Strand at 828 Broadway.
title: Tama Janowitz

description:
In light of recent tragedies and widespread protests across the nation, The Progressive magazine republished one of its most famous pieces: James Baldwin’s 1962 “Letter to My Nephew,” which was later published in his landmark book, The Fire Next Time. Addressing his fifteen-year-old namesake on the one hundredth anniversary of the Emancipation Proclamation, Baldwin wrote: “You know and I know, that the country is celebrating one hundred years of freedom one hundred years too soon.”

Award-winning author Jesmyn Ward knows that Baldwin’s words ring as true as ever today. In response, she has gathered short essays, memoir, and a few essential poems to engage the question of race in the United States. And she has turned to some of her generation’s most original thinkers and writers to give voice to their concerns. Join acclaimed authors Mitchell Jackson, Daniel Jose Older, Garnette Cadogan, and Emily Raboteau as they excavate the darkest corners of our history, wrestle with our current predicament, and envision a better future. Writer and activist Shaun King will be moderating the conversation. 

Introductory remarks will be made by Elizabeth Howard, consultant to WOVEN, We Oppose Violence Everywhere Now, an organization founded on rejecting violence and identifying solutions to make the world safe. 

Buy a copy of The Fire This Time or a $15 gift card in-store at the Strand's main floor registers or at the door to attend. This event will take place in the Rare Book Room on the Strand's 3rd floor, accessible via the store elevator or at 826 Broadway.
title: The Fire This Time: A New Generation Speaks about Race

description:
Strand is proud to participate in the largest and most inclusive literary gathering in Queens. Stop by our booth and check out our selection of the latest thought-provoking, best-selling titles, from graphic novels to thrillers to history and beyond.

For the comics fans out there, we’re hosting one of our favorite artists from the world-renowned, groundbreaking publisher Fantagraphics--from 3:00 PM - 4:00 PM, Brooklyn’s own Leslie Stein will be signing the latest in her ongoing Eye of the Majestic Creature saga, Time Clock.

The Queens Book Fair is free and open to the public, and will take place at Kafuman Astoria Studios, 34-12 36th St, Astoria, NY 11106.--RSVP here, and find information about the festival and about transportation options can be found here.
title: Strand @ Queens Book Festival

description:
Join us in the Rare Book Room for a look at Dog Medicine: How My Dog Saved Me from Myself. This memoir captures the anguish of depression, the slow path to recovery, the beauty of forgiveness, and the astonishing ways animals can help heal even the most broken hearts and minds. Nothing can break the bond between the loveable golden retriever named Bunker, and the person he rescued: Julie Barton.

This event is presented in partnership with New York Therapy Animals; they are proudly the NYC affiliate of the R.E.A.D.® Reading Education Assistance Dogs® children’s literacy program. They’ll be joining us for the reading and will be accompanied by some furry friends. NYTA representatives are happy to answer any questions you might have about therapy animals.

This event is free and open to the public-- please RSVP HERE. You can reserve a copy of Dog Medicine here, or purchase the book at the event.
title: Dog Medicine: How My Dog Saved Me from Myself

description:
Sometimes it is the one who loves you who hurts you the most.

Lily hasn’t always had it easy, but that’s never stopped her from working hard for the life she wants. She’s come a long way from the small town in Maine where she grew up—she graduated from college, moved to Boston, and started her own business. So when she feels a spark with a gorgeous neurosurgeon named Ryle Kincaid, everything in Lily’s life suddenly seems almost too good to be true.

Ryle is assertive, stubborn, maybe even a little arrogant. He’s also sensitive, brilliant, and has a total soft spot for Lily. And the way he looks in scrubs certainly doesn’t hurt. Lily can’t get him out of her head. But Ryle’s complete aversion to relationships is disturbing. Even as Lily finds herself becoming the exception to his “no dating” rule, she can’t help but wonder what made him that way in the first place.

As questions about her new relationship overwhelm her, so do thoughts of Atlas Corrigan—her first love and a link to the past she left behind. He was her kindred spirit, her protector. When Atlas suddenly reappears, everything Lily has built with Ryle is threatened.

Colleen Hoover’s nine best-selling novels (including the New York Times number-one Hopeless) have thrilled and touched the lives of countless readers. With It Ends With Us, her latest captivating romance, she breaks exciting new ground, delivering a heart-wrenching story with a cast of all-too-human characters. Don’t miss this chance to hear her talk with Natasha of Book Baristas about how it came to be, and to get your copy signed!

  • Colleen will only personalize copies of It Ends With Us.
  • Purchase of It Ends With Us makes customers eligible to have 3 back-list titles signed (but not personalized); the gift card ticket option does not allow for getting back-list signed.  
  • Colleen will take posed photos with fans. 

Due to overwhelming demand, this event is at standby/standing-room capacity. The line will begin forming at 5:30 PM in front of the Strand on Broadway (at 12th Street). If you haven't bought a copy of It Ends With Us or a $15 gift card for admission, hop on line and, if there's space available, you can purchase one in-store.
title: Colleen Hoover

description:
The Real Art Therapists of New York are back and taking over Times Square! Come to the Strand's newest kiosk in the heart of Manhattan for a Pop-Up Coloring Bar: a moment of relaxation, creativity, and self-reflection in the busy city. The Real Art Therapists of New York Coloring Book features artwork by 50 professional art therapists living and working in New York who invite you to start a new journey towards a more creative and de-stressed life. Join a few of the artists at the Times Square plaza at 44th and Broadway and choose a page from their beloved coloring book to see first-hand how art can be used for wellness and discovery. Plus, enjoy 10% off all coloring books at the kiosk between 4 and 7 pm.

Colored pencils and coloring sheets will be provided!

This event is free and open to the public but we ask that participants be mindful and limit their stay to one hour to ensure maximum coloring for everyone. This event will take place at the Times Square plaza at 44th and Broadway.
title: Times Square Coloring Bar with the Real Art Therapists of New York

description:
Whether it’s the good-natured laddishness of the Beatles doing battle for hearts and minds with the ragged Rolling Stones, or Kanye West’s irrepressible button-pushing pitted against Taylor Swift’s kid-sister underdog persona, rivalry has defined pop music’s biggest stage for decades. Steven Hyden, music writer late of Grantland and the AV Club, delves into the lives and songs of tendentious tunesmiths in Your Favorite Band Is Killing Me: What Pop Music Rivalries Reveal About the Meaning of Life. He’ll be joined by Turn Around Bright Eyes author and fellow music obsessive Rob Sheffield in exposing the currents that run through such rivalries as varied as Biggie’s with Tupac’s, Toby Keith’s with the Dixie Chicks’, and Clapton’s with Hendrix’s.

Buy a copy of Your Favorite Band Is Kiling Me or a $15 gift card to attend. This event will take place in the Strand's Rare Book Room on the 3rd floor.
title: Steven Hyden + Rob Sheffield

description:
Join us in the Rare Book Room as Joanna Ebenstein, co-founder and creative director of the one and only Morbid Anatomy Museum in Brooklyn, celebrates the release of her new book Anatomical Venus. Joanna pulls back the veil on these life-size dissectible wax women reclining on moth-eaten velvet cushions complete with glass eyes, strings of pearls, and golden tiaras crowning their real human hair.

Evan Michelson, Morbid Anatomy Scholar in residence, co-owner of eerie East Village Obscura Antiques & Oddities and co-host of the Science Channel’s show, Oddities, will join Joanna for the discussion.

Introductory remarks will be made by Morbid Anatomy Museum co-founder and board chair Tracy Hurley Martin.

Buy a copy of The Anatomical Venus or a $15 gift card in-store at Strand's main floor registers or at the door to attend. This event will take place in the Rare Book Room on Strand's 3rd floor, accessible via 826 Broadway.
title: Joanna Ebenstein: Anatomical Venus

description:
Writers and readers (and parents of readers, too) of books for young people, rejoice! Cheryl Klein, executive editor at Arthur A. Levine Books/Scholastic, distills her inside knowledge of what makes a great kids’ or YA title in The Magic Words: Writing Great Books for Children and Young Adults. She’ll be joined by a panel of fellow editors, agents, and authors to discuss the ins and outs of the industry, from what they look for in a manuscript to how to get the word out about a finished title.

The other panelists include...

  • ...Kass Morgan, best-selling author of The 100 and young adult/middle grade editor
  • ...Alvina Ling, VP and Editor-in-Chief, Little, Brown Books for Young Reader
  • ...Brooks Sherman, agent, The Bent Agency
  • ...as well as moderator Eliot Schrefer, author of many books, including the National Book Award nominees Endangered and Threatened.

Buy a copy of The Magic Words or a $15 gift card in-store at Strand's main floor registers or at the door to attend. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: The Magic Words: A Panel on Children’s and Young Adult Publishing

description:
From the moment she was called upon to become the Slayer, and thus shoulder the weight of saving the world (Again!) Buffy the Vampire Slayer wrestled with understanding not only her place in the world as a superhero, but also finding her place as young woman tasked with such a role. Should her power be rooted in something different than our traditional masculine notions of strength? Or is power simply power—void of gender and value? In this Olio, we will examine Joss Whedon’s creation, Buffy, and analyze the significance of the slayer’s struggle to fight evil while remaining “just a girl.” 

Through discussion and the viewing of a few clips, we will look critically at the show’s overarching narrative, asking ourselves: Was Buffy truly a feminist icon? If so, what kind of feminist? Radical? Liberal? Marxist? What does it mean that she alone held power that others had no access to? That she used violence to solve problems? That in the eye of the struggle, she often found herself alone, having more in common with the evil she was fighting than with the good she was trying to protect. Why, for example, was she so hot for vampires? We will discuss and debate whether, in the end, Buffy reconciled these dilemmas as she saved the world. (Again!) Finally, we will ask ourselves what lessons we can learn from the slayer as we navigate modern patriarchy and capitalism.

This class will be taught by Jamie Warren, Assistant Professor of American history, the history of women and gender, and women’s studies at BMCC-CUNY and holder of a Ph.D. in American History from Indiana University. Her research focuses on slavery in antebellum South with a particular focus on death, the body, and the philosophy of history.

Buy a $20 ticket to attend this event-- admission will include 1 drink, courtesy of Jenny & Francois. Please note that payment is required for all online event orders at the time of checkout. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Think Olio: What Would Buffy Do? A Radical Feminist Seeks Answers from The Slayer

description:
Richard Misrach has spent years trekking along the border between the United States and Mexico, capturing magnificent landscapes and haunting images of artifacts left behind as people fled across the border. Border Cantos, his collaborative series with artist and musician Guillermo Galindo, shows the border as a place of political and cultural collision that Misrach captures and displays with his camera.

Join us in the Rare Book Room as the globetrotting Misrach gives a presentation from the print edition of Border Cantos, answers questions about his work and career, and signs copies of his books!

Please note: Richard will sign up to 3 back list titles per customer, provided said customer has purchased a copy of the featured book at Strand.

Strand is proud to partner with Aperture to celebrate photography. (Photo courtesy: c. William Hart 2016)

Buy a copy of Border Cantos or a $20 gift card in-store at the Strand's registers or at the door to attend. This event will take place in the Rare Book Room on the 3rd floor of Strand at 828 Broadway.
title: Aperture Presents: Richard Misrach

description:
The Mommy Shorts Guide to Remarkably Average Parenting is full of personal essays on parenthood, peppered with ridiculous infographics, photos and memes, all of which are hilarious, poignant, and tinged with that funny-because-it’s-true feeling. In chapters with titles like “Are You Sure This Newborn is Mine?” and “Even Ice Cream Causes Tantrums,” author and blogger Ilana Wiles discuss her experiences as a new mom, a wife and a working parent with both wit and wisdom.

Join us in the Rare Book Room as Ilana outlines her fun and honest guide that celebrates the silliness of being a parent. 

You can buy The Mommy Shorts Guide to Remarkably Average Parenting in-store at the event. This event will take place in the Rare Book Room on the Strand's 3rd floor, accessible via the store elevator or at 826 Broadway.
title: The Mommy Shorts Guide to Remarkably Average Parenting Book Launch!

description:
Danielle Trussoni, New York Times bestselling author of Angelology, takes an incisive look at romantic love in The Fortress, her memoir of a passionate ten-year marriage and its culmination in the south of France. In a haunted stone fortress built by the Knights Templar in Languedoc, she comes to understand the dark, subterranean forces that have been following her all along.

Danielle will talk love, history, and the subterranean forces that shape our lives with actress, writer, and singer Molly Ringwald. Don’t miss this chance to get your copy of The Fortress signed by the author that Cheryl Strayed called “magical!”

Buy a copy of The Fortress or a $15 gift card in-store at the Strand's main floor registers or at the door to attend. This event will take place in the Rare Book Room on the Strand's 3rd floor, accessible via the store elevator or at 826 Broadway.
title: Danielle Trussoni + Molly Ringwald

description:
Born into the beautiful bedlam of downtown New York City in the 1980s, iO Tillett Wright’s playground was the streets, inhabited by an edgy amalgam of self-invented characters from defiant punks and glamorous drag queens to cutting edge performance artists to heroin addicts.

One of the most unforgettable women in the neighborhood was iO’s own mother, Rhonna, a showgirl and young widow, was a mercurial, erratic glamazon. She was iO’s fiercest defender and only authority in a world with few boundaries and even fewer indicators of normal life.

With Darling Days, iO’s debut memoir, the vanished New York and the tumultuous relationships that defined it are evoked with sometimes harrowing, sometimes hilarious passion. From an early age, even before adopting a new persona as a boy at age 6, Wright has lived a life of self-invention and reinvention. Darling Days tells the story of that life, and iO will be back downtown at Strand to discuss a life lived at the boundaries of culture, gender, and identity.

iO Tillett Wright is an artist, activist, actor, speaker, TV host and writer. His work deals with identity, be it through photography and the Self Evident Truths Project/We Are You campaign or on television as the co-host of MTV’s Suspect. iO has exhibited artwork in New York and Tokyo, was a featured contributor on Underground Culture to T: The New York Times Style Magazine, and has had photography featured in GQ, Elle, New York Magazine, and The New York Times Magazine. He is a regular speaker at universities, discussing expanding one’s circle of normalcy and embracing those that are different than you. A native New Yorker, iO is now based in Los Angeles.

Buy a copy of Darling Days or a $5 gift card in-store at the Strand's main floor registers or at the door to attend. This event will take place in the Rare Book Room on the Strand's 3rd floor, accessible via the store elevator or at 826 Broadway.
title: iO Tillett Wright

description:
Leigh Bardugo, best-selling author of the Grisha series and Six of Crows, returns with the wildly anticipated Crooked Kingdom!

Due to overwhelming demand, she’ll be sticking around after the book’s launch to sign copies for fans who missed out on tickets to the talk. The first 100 people who reserve their book will get to meet Leigh and have Crooked Kingdom signed. Please note:

Leigh will sign and personalize one copy per person of Crooked Kingdom.

Please Note: Purchase of Crooked Kingdom here does not grant you admission to the talk at 7pm, only the 9pm signing.

Leigh will be celebrating the launch of Crooked Kingdom by donating 10% of book sales to GEMS. Girls Educational and Mentoring Services’ (GEMS) mission is to empower girls and young women, ages 12–24, who have experienced commercial sexual exploitation and domestic trafficking to exit the commercial sex industry and develop to their full potential. GEMS is committed to ending commercial sexual exploitation and domestic trafficking of girls and young women by changing individual lives, transforming public perception, and revolutionizing the systems and policies that impact sexually exploited youth. Support GEMS by attending the signing or purchasing any of Leigh's books from the Strand. MacMillan Publishing will match Leigh's donation. 

Buy a copy of Crooked Kingdom at the main floor registers to participate in the signing. The event will be located in the Strand's Rare Book Room, with the line forming at 8:00 PM on Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Leigh Bardugo: Crooked Kingdom ***SIGNING ONLY***

description:
Join BookCon, New York Comic Con, and Strand for games, a cosplay contest with tickets to NYCC 2016 for the winners, food, drink, fandom, and fun. The cosplay contest will be judged by none other than Book Barista's Natasha! 

Dig into a game of SLASH, the party game that crosses lines of logic, propriety and canon to create the wildest and truest of One True Pairings.

  • Daenerys Targaryen and Darth Vader?
  • Lady Macbeth and Lex Luthor?
  • Michonne and Morticia Addams?
  • Ron Swanson and Teddy Roosevelt?

Only the matchmaker has the power to determine the fate of your favorite characters.

This is a one-night only event! Don’t miss it!

Buy a $15 gift card in-store at the Strand's main floor registers or at the door to attend. This event will take place on the 3rd floor in the Rare Book Room, accessible via 828 Broadway.
title: Fandom Fest with BookCon & NYCC

description:
This event is SOLD OUT.  If you already have a ticket, the event will take place in the Strand's Rare Book Room-- the line for entry will start at 5pm on Broadway in front of the store. Seats are first come, first serve. A livestream will be broadcast here--tune in from home if you can't make it! 

If you still want to meet Leigh and have her sign Crooked Kingdom, be one of the first 100 people to buy a copy HERE. The line will start at 7:30pm on Broadway.  

Join Jesse the Reader in conversation with Leigh Bardugo for the New York City launch of the highly anticipated Crooked Kingdom, sequel to the New York Times bestselling Six of Crows!

Kaz Brekker and his crew have just pulled off a heist so daring even they didn't think they'd survive. But instead of divvying up a fat reward, they're right back to fighting for their lives. Double-crossed and badly weakened, the crew is low on resources, allies, and hope. As powerful forces from around the world descend on Ketterdam to root out the secrets of the dangerous drug known as jurda parem, old rivals and new enemies emerge to challenge Kaz's cunning and test the team's fragile loyalties. A war will be waged on the city's dark and twisting streets—a battle for revenge and redemption that will decide the fate of the Grisha world.

Please note: Leigh will personalize copies of Crooked Kingdom. In addition, she will sign (without personalization) up to 3 other titles, and pose for photos with fans.

All books by Leigh Bardugo, including Six of Crows, Crooked Kingdom, along with the Grisha Trilogy will be available for sale at Strand the night of the launch event!

There will also be a limited poster give-away during the event.

Leigh will be celebrating the launch of Crooked Kingdom by donating 10% of book sales to GEMS. Girls Educational and Mentoring Services’ (GEMS) mission is to empower girls and young women, ages 12–24, who have experienced commercial sexual exploitation and domestic trafficking to exit the commercial sex industry and develop to their full potential. GEMS is committed to ending commercial sexual exploitation and domestic trafficking of girls and young women by changing individual lives, transforming public perception, and revolutionizing the systems and policies that impact sexually exploited youth. Support GEMS by attending the signing or purchasing any of Leigh's books from the Strand.  MacMillan Publishing will match Leigh's donation.
title: Leigh Bardugo: Crooked Kingdom Launch

description:
Mark D. Sikes’ career as an interior design has brought the influence of his early days in the fashion industry together with a modern and unfussy interpretation of classic American indoor and outdoor living. His first book, Beautiful: All-American Decorating and Timeless Style, collects his approachable, stylish looks: from "Blue and White Forever," which features indigos, stripes, batiks, and wicker in casual rooms such as porches and pool houses; to "Timeless Neutrals," presenting semiformal rooms filled with chinoiserie, gilt, glass, mirrors, banquettes, and French chairs; to "Garden Greens," featuring happy, casual family rooms and kitchens inspired by the garden with treillage woodwork, rattan, and cotton. There are also "Beautiful Brights," colorful rooms that are eclectic, layered, and fun, with chintz, florals, and Middle Eastern influences; and "Sun Faded Hues," rustic coastal rooms with weathered fabrics and furniture.

Mark will pay a visit to the Strand’s pop-up shop in Club Monaco’s flagship location to launch Beautiful with a meet-and-greet signing with fans of his contemporary take on classic American strains.

RSVP here to let us know you’re coming, and buy a copy of Beautiful to have it signed. The event will be located in the Strand's pop-up shop in Club Monaco’s flagship location, located at 160 Fifth Avenue (at 21st Street).
title: Mark D. Sikes @ Club Monaco

description:
Strand is thrilled to participate in this year’s Children’s day at the Brooklyn Book Festival! Stop by our booth and check out our selection of the latest best-selling children’s titles!

Joining us at our booth will be Nathan Catlin, author of the hit book Animals with Insecurities! He will be at our booth (#3) from 2:00PM-3:00PM for a read-aloud, craft time, and a book signing.

Brooklyn Book Festival Children's Day is free and open to the public, and will take place at the Metrotech Commons, located at 1 MetroTech Center, Brooklyn, NY 11201. The Strand's booth will be located at tent #3.
title: Strand @ Brooklyn Book Festival’s Children’s Day!

description:
Lobbyist K. Riva Levinson has worked in some of the most dangerous places on earth – from Mogadishu to Baghdad.  In her memoir, she reveals the inner workings of the lobbying/public relations business in Washington, D.C. and the making of U.S. foreign policy. However, it was her efforts on behalf of Ellen Johnson Sirleaf that form the heart of Choosing the Hero. Riva describes how she met the then-exiled Sirleaf, who was determined to return to Liberia and run for the presidency against the warlord Charles Taylor. Riva chronicles her behind-the-scenes lobbying for Sirleaf in Washington, D.C., as well as her on-the-ground efforts supporting the presidential campaign in Liberia. It took three tries for Sirleaf to finally win the presidency in 2005 and become the first woman elected to lead an African nation.

Levinson will joined at Strand by Her Excellency, Ellen Johnson Sirleaf, President of the Republic of Liberia. Don’t miss this opportunity to hear the inside story of one of the most inspiring stories in global politics! 

K. Riva Levinson is the President and CEO of KRL International LLC, a Washington communications and government relations firm that focuses on the world’s emerging markets. A top strategist in managing international policy issues, Levinson has been interviewed by Forbes, Fortune and National Public Radio's All Things Considered. She has been profiled in the London Guardian, Le Monde and in CQ Roll Call, featured on C-SPAN, and is a regular contributor to The Hill. She has served as a long-time advisor to Liberia’s President Ellen Johnson Sirleaf and her firm is the consultancy of record for Liberia in Washington, D.C. Levinson has a bachelor’s degree from Tufts University and a master’s degree from Georgetown University. Choosing the Hero is her first book.

President Ellen Johnson Sirleaf is the 24th President of Liberia and Africa’s first democratically elected female Head of State. She is serving her second term as President after winning the 2011 presidential election. She’s shared the Nobel Peace Prize with Leymah Gbowee of Liberia and Tawakkol Karman of Yemen in 2011, and was awarded the Indira Gandhi Prize for Peace, Disarmament and Development in 2012.

Buy a copy of Choosing the Hero or a $15 gift card in-store at the Strand's main floor registers or at the door to attend. This event will take place in the Rare Book Room on the Strand's 3rd floor, accessible via the store elevator or at 826 Broadway.
title: K. Riva Levinson + President Ellen Johnson Sirleaf: Choosing the Hero

description:
The Colombian literary sensation Juan Gabriel Vásquez returns after taking the States by storm with his singular novel The Sound of Things Falling. In his new novel, Reputations, he follows one of the most powerful men in Bogota as his past catches up with him, and examines the construction of public identity, the burden of memory, and the intersection of the personal and the political, all within the bounds of a taut, electrifying page-turner. Don’t miss this opportunity to hear from one of the most explosive talents in fiction when he stops by New York to visit the Rare Book Room.

This event if free and open to the public. Copies of Reputations as well as Juan's other books will be on hand at the event. The event will take place on the 3rd floor in the Strand's Rare Book Room, accessible via elevator from the main store.
title: Juan Gabriel Vásquez: Reputations

description:
Mary Karr is here and ready to teach us the art of memoir-writing! After having her own memoirs top the best-sellers lists, who better to teach the world how to write one?

Mary has taught writing for thirty years and is credited for sparking a renaissance in memoir. Her three entries into the genre, including the infamous The Liars' Club, have all gone on to climb the best-seller charts. Join us in the Rare Book Room as Mary uses her prize-winning teaching skills to show us her process, share her dark secrets, and teach us the art of writing a memoir. Stick around afterwards to get your book signed!

Buy a copy of The Art of Memoir or a $15 gift card in-store at Strand's main floor registers or at the door to attend. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Mary Karr: The Art of Memoir

description:
Strand is excited to participate in this year’s Brooklyn Book Festival! Stop by our booth and check out our selection of the latest best-selling titles, from graphic novels to thrillers to history and more!

Joining us at our booth will be Imbolo Mbue, author of Behold the Dreamers and Alexandra Kleeman, author of You Too Could Have a Body Like Mine! Imbolo will be signing her book at 1:00PM-2:00PM and Alexandra will be signing her brand-new short-story collection Intimations, at 2:30PM-3:30PM; both signings will take place at Strand's booth (#404).

The Brooklyn Book Festival is free and open to the public, and will take place at the Brooklyn Borough Hall and Plaza, 209 Joralemon Street, Brooklyn NY 11201. The Strand's booth will be located at tent #404, right in front of Burough Hall.
title: Strand @ Brooklyn Book Festival!

description:
Once there was a boy, and that boy loved stars very much. So much so that he decided to catch one of his very own. But how? Join the Diverging Elements Theatre Company, a group of multitalented performers committed to devising original and culturally diverse stories for the stage, for an adventure with colorful puppets, music, and dance, adapted from the book by Oliver Jeffers.

These free events will be located on Strand’s second floor, in the children’s department.
title: Diverging Elements Theatre Company: How to Catch a Star

description:
Thousands of people work on Wall Street, coming from various backgrounds and parts of the country, but Julissa Arce is the only one who can say that during her time as a Vice President at Goldman Sachs she was an undocumented immigrant.

Julissa started her life in Mexico, moved to Texas as a child, and dreamed all the while of becoming rich. When her visa expired she tried to find ways to stay in the country, going so far as to try to convince her family to let her be adopted by friends. Even without a social security number, she managed to get into college and into an internship at Goldman Sachs. All the while, she lived each day with the fear of being discovered and the regret of having crossed the border knowing that she might not see her gravely ill father again. 

Now that she’s left Wall Street, Julissa has become an advocate for rights for undocumented immigrants. She will be joined by award-winning writer and filmmaker Alberto Ferreras, who most recently directed HBO Latino's Habla y Vota, in the Rare Book Room as she discusses and signs her memoir, My (Underground) American Dream: My True Story as an Undocumented Immigrant Who Became a Wall Street Executive.

Buy a copy of My (Underground) American Dream or a $15 gift card in-store at Strand's main floor registers or at the door to attend. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Julissa Arce: My (Underground) American Dream

description:
In a conversation moderated by the effervescent Phong Bui (author and artist, as well as co-founder, Editor-in-Chief, and publisher at the Brooklyn Rail), this group of experts will delve into the ever-evolving debate around the idea that “print is dead,” in the digital age. With well-founded optimism, each panelist will share his or her experiences with the medium of print, and discuss how it has continued to grow and even flourish in the 21st century. You see, print matters. But what is the future of print?

Participants in the panel include:

  • Michael Bierut, partner at Pentagram, the world's largest independent design consultancy, as well as professor at Yale and author of How To.
  • Dan Simon, founder, President and Publisher of Seven Stories Press.
  • Sharon Helgason Gallagher, founder, President and Executive Director of D.A.P./Distributed Art Publishers.
  • Paula Cooper, owner & founder of the influential Paula Cooper Gallery as well as co-founder & operator of 192 Books.

The panel will be introduced by Joan K. Davidson, founder of Furthermore grants in publishing program in association with the JM Kaplan Fund, of which she the President Emeritus.

Buy a $15 gift card at the door or at Strand's main floor registers to attend this event. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Print Matters: Art, Literature and Design in the Digital Age

description:
Once there was a boy, and that boy loved stars very much. So much so that he decided to catch one of his very own. But how? Join the Diverging Elements Theatre Company, a group of multitalented performers committed to devising original and culturally diverse stories for the stage, for an adventure with colorful puppets, music, and dance, adapted from the book by Oliver Jeffers.

These free events will be located on Strand’s second floor, in the children’s department.
title: Diverging Elements Theatre Company: How to Catch a Star

description:
Many of the men and women doing today’s most consequential environmental work--restoring America’s grasslands, wildlife, soil, rivers, wetlands, and oceans--would not call themselves environmentalists; they would be too uneasy with the connotations of that word. What drives them is their deep love of the land: the iconic terrain where explorers and cowboys, pioneers and riverboat captains forged the American identity. They feel a moral responsibility to preserve this heritage and natural wealth, to ensure that their families and communities will continue to thrive.

Unfolding as a journey down the Mississippi River, Rancher, Farmer, Fisherman: Conservation Heroes of the American Heartland tells the stories of five representatives of this stewardship movement: a Montana rancher, a Kansas farmer, a Mississippi riverman, a Louisiana shrimper, and a Gulf fisherman. In exploring their work and family histories and the essential geographies they protect, Environmental Defense Fund veteran Miriam Horn challenges pervasive and powerful myths about American and environmental values. Join Miriam in the Rare Book Room as she paints a powerful picture of the hidden stewards of America’s natural legacy.

Joining Miriam in conversation is Ian Frazier, author of Hogs Wild and Great Plains.

Buy a copy of Rancher, Farmer, Fisherman or a $15 gift card at the door to attend this event. Please note that payment is required for all online event orders at the time of checkout. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Miriam Horn + Ian Frazier: Rancher, Farmer, Fisherman

description:
From the dawn of the first television shows to today’s plethora of options for any viewer there comes the ultimate question: what is the greatest TV show ever made? Is it a classic such as I Love Lucy or a modern show like House of Cards? A comedy or a drama? Is it even possible to pick only one?

Television critics Matt Zoller Seitz and Alan Sepinwall have been trying to come up with the answer ever since they shared a TV column at Tony Soprano's hometown newspaper. They’ve combed through the shows, made a list of the top 100 scripted shows in American TV history, and have finally figured it out. Now they’re ready to share the answer in their book TV (The Book): Two Experts Pick the Greatest American Shows of All Time.

Join us in the Rare Book Room for a lively discussion on television and see whether or not you agree with Matt and Alan’s picks!

Buy a copy of TV the Book or a $15 gift card at the door to attend this event; due to popularity, tickets are limited. We cannot guarantee admittance without advance purchase. Please note that payment is required for all online event orders at the time of checkout. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Matt Zoller Seitz + Alan Sepinwall: TV the Book

description:
Photography can be a powerful tool, and in the hands of a master, it can change a community. LaToya Ruby Frazier is one such master. She uses her camera to capture inequality and racism in her hometown of Braddock, Pennsylvania, and presents it in her award-winning book The Notion of Family.

Kellie Jones is an associate professor of Art History and Archaeology as well as at the Institute for Research in African American Studies (IRAAS) at Columbia University, and a 2016 MacArthur Fellow. She will join LaToya in conversation.

Strand is proud to partner with Aperture to celebrate photography.

Buy a copy of The Notion of Family or a $20 gift card in-store at the Strand's main floor registers or at the door to attend. This event will take place in the Rare Book Room on the Strand's 3rd floor, accessible via the store elevator or at 826 Broadway.
title: Aperture Presents: LaToya Ruby Frazier in conversation with Kellie Jones

description:
What better way to close out a week-long celebration of all things STEIDL than with a huge book launch and signing bonanza? Below are the lists of all the photographers, editors, and artists featured for the day!

  • Philip Trager – New York in the 1970s and Photographing Ina

  • A-chan – Salt’n Vinegar

  • Romney Mueller Westernhagen – Portraits 

  • Victoria Whyte Ball & Ken Ball, editors of The Golden Decade 

Buy a copy of any of the authors' Steidl titles at Strand to have it signed. You are only permitted to bring 3 titles from home and must make a purchase at Strand in order to have other books signed. Strand cannot guarantee that the artists will sign everything-- signatures and inscriptions are given at the discretion of the artist. This event will take place in the Rare Book Room, on the 3rd floor of the Strand at 828 Broadway and 12th Street).
title: STEIDL X STRAND: Book Launches and Signings!

description:
Join Amy Pereira, MSNBC’s photo editor, for a stimulating conversation on the stimulated political landscape as we crash-land in the final weeks of a turbulent presidential election.

Mark Peterson, whose photographs have immortalized moments from the fall of the Berlin Wall through the decades since, will discuss his Political Theater project, which documents the various campaigns that have clashed and intersected in the run-up to November 8th in all their operatic glory. The black-and-white visages of Trump, Clinton, et al display the heightened stakes and unrelenting glare of the would-be presidential spotlight, as well as Peterson’s gift for the split-second reaction that’s made him a modern master.

Buy a copy of Political Theater or a $20 gift card in-store at the event to attend. This event will take place in the Rare Book Room on the Strand's 3rd floor, accessible via the store elevator or at 826 Broadway.
title: STEIDL X STRAND: Mark Peterson + Amy Pereira

description:
Robert Polidori’s work has been the subject of exhibitions around the world and his series of photographs of New Orleans after Hurricane Katrina was exhibited at The Metropolitan Museum of Art. He’s received multiple awards over the years.

Robert will talk about making a book with  the German-based publishing company STEIDL, renowned for their art and photobooks. Stick around after the talk for a conversation between Steidl and fellow renowned photographers, Joel Sternfeld and Frank Gohlke, about their new book, Landscape as Longing. After the talks Robert will sign copies of his new books Hotel Petra, which looks at the now destroyed Hotel Petra in Beirut, and 60 Feet Road - Bhatiya Nagar Facades, a composition of images building one panoramic view of Mumbai.

Buy a copy of Hotel Petra, 60 Feet Road, or a $20 gift card in-store at the event to attend. This event will take place in the Rare Book Room on the Strand's 3rd floor, accessible via the store elevator or at 826 Broadway.
title: STEIDL X STRAND: Robert Polidori

description:
Photographers Joel Sternfeld and Frank Gohlke and writer Suketu Mehta launch their new book Landscape as Longing, a collection of photographs which is all about one of the most diverse communities in the world - Queens. The project of capturing all things ‘Queens’ took well over a year to complete and features everything from bodegas to temples and apartments to shorelines. Each photographer focuses on different aspects of the borough and with a powerful essay by acclaimed writer Suketu Mehta they suceed in creating a vast and detailed representation of Queens.

The two photographers and writer will be in conversation with Gerhard Steidl, founder of the German-based publishing company STEIDL.

Buy a copy of Landscape as Longing $20 gift card in-store at the event or at the main floor registers to attend. This event will take place in the Rare Book Room on the Strand's 3rd floor, accessible via the store elevator or at 826 Broadway.
title: STEIDL X STRAND: Steidl + Sternfeld + Gohlke + Mehta

description:
The legendary photographer William Eggleston will join Steidl Verlag to celebrate his new book The Democratic Forest - Selected Works (co-published with David Zwirner Books) for a rare book signing!  Eggleston will also be signing the The Democratic Forest 10-volume box set edition published by Steidl. Strand will have a few additional monographs on hand for purchase. 

The man credited with bringing artistic recognition to color photography will sign not only his newest collection, but also other STEIDL titles: Los Alamos Revisited, Before Color, and From Black and White to Color.

We kindly ask that customers bring no more than 3 Eggleston collections from home for his signature. Purchase of one of the featured titles is required to gain access to the signing. 

Please call (212) 473-1452 x380 with any questions.

Eggleston’s accompanying exhibition will open at David Zwirner Gallery on October 27th.

Buy a copy of The Democratic Forest: Selected Works or a copy of  The Democratic Forest 10 volume box set in-store at the event to have them signed. This event will take place in the Strand's Rare Book Room, located on the 3rd floor at 828 Broadway.
title: STEIDL X STRAND: William Eggleston

description:
Bruce and Anna Mia Davidson are two preeminent photographers renowned for their ability to capture a unique view of people. Their work over the years has had their careers cross paths countless times, an intersection marked by the unique dynamic between father and daughter.

Join these two as they discuss their lives in a photography-centered family and their own artistic pursuits over the years. The discussion will be led by Brian Wallis, former curator at the New Museum of Contemporary Art and International Center of Photography deputy director of exhibitions and collections and chief curator. Signed copies of Anna Mia’s Cuba: Black and White and Bruce’s books Nature of Los Angeles 2008–2013 and In Color, as well as a few other titles will be available for purchase after the event.

Buy a $20 gift card in-store at the event to attend. This event will take place in the Rare Book Room on the Strand's 3rd floor, accessible via the store elevator or at 826 Broadway.
title: STEIDL X STRAND: Bruce Davidson + Anna Mia Davidson + Brian Wallis

description:
Broad City's Abbi Jacobson brings together an evening of multimedia, reading and conversation centered on her latest book, a wonderfully weird and weirdly wonderful illustrated look at the world around us--all through the framework of the things we carry.

Abbi will be joined for a Q&A by Lena Dunham, a writer and director from New York whose essay collection Not That Kind of Girl was one of the New York Times’ top ten books of 2015.

This event is presented by Symphony Space.

Tickets to this event are $32 ($30 for Symphony Space members), and can be purchased here. Ticket price includes a copy of Carry This Book. This event will take place at the Peter Jay Sharp Theatre at Symphony Space, located at  2537 Broadway, New York, NY 10025.
title: Abbi Jacobson: Carry This Book

description:
Television producer turned award-winning L.A. chef, the owner of Sqirl has finally launched her much-anticipated cookbook, Everything I Want to Eat: Sqirl and the New California Cooking! Jessica Koslow’s years as part of the television industry were spent thinking of her love of food. This led to her working nights at Village Bakery and eventually leaving entertainment for her true passion: food. Starting with preserves and growing into a restaurant of her own, her recipes have combined new ingredients into delicious dishes; it’s caused her little restaurant to have a near-constant line out the door!

Join us as Chef Jessica signs copies of her cookbook at Strand’s Club Monaco location on 160 5th Avenue by 21st Street.

Copies of Everything I Want to Eat will be available at the event--purchase one to have it signed. The event will be located in the Strand's Club Monaco Location at 160 5th Avenue by 21st Street.
title: Chef Jessica Koslow

description:
In his groundbreaking study, The History of Sexuality: Volume 1, philosopher and historian Michel Foucault provocatively argued that the thing we call sexuality, the supposed essence of our sexual core, our desires, our selves, is in fact “a name that can be given to a historical construct.” In this Olio, we will discuss the significance of Foucault’s claim that sexuality is not an essential and fixed quality inherent to our being, but rather the result of historical shifts in power and knowledge. We will examine how and why it is we have come to think of sexuality as a “problem of truth,” as a secret to be revealed.

We will look closely at the philosopher’s controversial claim that at the very moment we imagine sexuality as being repressed, driven under, made to hide, it was indeed “exploding,” “inciting,” and proliferating unto every aspect of human experience. We will also ask ourselves about the value of Foucault’s work for challenging our own ideas about our personal desires, our identity categories, and our cherished notions of the self.

Jamie Warren has a Ph.D. in American History from Indiana University, and she is an Assistant Professor at BMCC-CUNY where she teaches American history, the history of women and gender, and women’s studies. Her research focuses on slavery in antebellum South with a particular focus on death, the body, and the philosophy of history.

Buy a $20 ticket on ThinkOlio’s website or at the door of the event. Please note that payment is required for all online event orders at the time of checkout. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Thinkolio Presents Emergence of Sexuality: Foucault, Sexual Identities, and the Modern Self

description:
It’s been a tough year for Dash and Lily since readers first watched them fall in love in the beloved, New York Times best-selling Dash and Lily’s Book of Dares. With only twelve days left until Christmas—Lily’s favorite time of the year—Dash, Lily’s brother Langston, and their closest friends take Manhattan by storm to help Lily recapture the holiday magic of New York City in December.

The Twelve Days of Dash and Lily rekindles the fire that brought the pair together--celebrate with authors Rachel Cohn and David Levithan as their favorite couple takes the city by storm, and get your copy of the new book signed!

Joining David and Rachel for a conversation will be fellow authors Melina Marchetta (Tell the Truth, Shame the Devil), Scott Westerfeld (Swarm), Justine Larbalestier (Razorhurst and the forthcoming My Sister Rosa), and Paul Griffin (When Friendship Followed Me Home).

This event is free to attend--please note: backlist titles (up to 3) will only be signed if you have purchased The Twelve Days of Dash & Lily at Strand. Copies will be available at the event, which takes place in the Rare Book Room, on the 3rd floor of the store at 828 Broadway.
title: David Levithan + Rachel Cohn

description:
The record-breaking, multi-platinum selling, Grammy-winning Lil Wayne will drop into the Strand to sign his first book, Gone ‘Til November: A Journal of Rikers Island. At the height of his career, a fixture in the rap game for more than a decade, Lil Wayne (aka Weezy) had established himself as both a prolific musician and a savvy businessman, smashing long-held industry records, winning multiple Grammy Awards, and signing up-and-coming talent like Drake and Nicki Minaj to his Young Money label. All of this momentum came to a halt when he was convicted of possession of a firearm and sentenced to a yearlong stay at Rikers Island. Suddenly, the artist at the top of his game was now an inmate at the mercy of the American penal system. At long last, Gone ’Til November reveals the true story of what really happened while Wayne was behind bars, exploring everything from his daily rituals to his interactions with other inmates to how he was able to keep himself motivated and grateful. Taken directly from Wayne’s own journal, this intimate, personal account of his incarceration is an utterly humane look at the man behind the artist.

Please note: This event is a signing for Gone ‘Til November only. It will take place on the Strand’s main floor. The line will begin forming at 12:00 PM in front of the store on Broadway. Lil Wayne will sign (NO personalizations and NO records or memorabilia) one book per customer. Photos are permitted from the line, but posed photos with Lil Wayne are NOT permitted.

If you order a book, you will be checked in while in line, and receive your book at the end to have it signed. Please note that signed copies will be available while supplies last, and ONLY for the duration of the event. If you have any questions regarding the status of your order, please call the Strand customer service department at (212) 473-1452 x420.

Buy a copy of Gone Til November at Strand's main floor registers to attend. Please note that payment is required before getting in line. Once tickets are sold out, we will start a STAND BY LINE in front of the store to accommodate as many guests as possible. The event will be located in the Strand's main floor at our buying desk at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Lil Wayne

description:
We’re excited to be at this year’s New York Comic Con! Our booth will feature some of the latest comics, buttons, and Strand merch.

We will have several authors coming to sign copies of their books throughout the convention.

Signings include:

  • Phoebe Robinson signs You Can't Touch My Hair on Thursday, 10/6 at 11:00AM-12:00PM.
  • Lev Grossman signs The Magicians on Thursday, 10/6 at 1:00PM-2:00PM.
  • Sarah Andersen signs Adulthood is a Myth on Friday, 10/7 at 1:00PM-2:00PM.
  • Ryan North signs Romeo and/or Juliet and To Be or Not to Be on Friday, 10/7 at 3:00PM-4:00PM.

New York Comic Con takes place at the Jacob K. Javits Convention Center, 655 W 34th St, New York, NY 10001. Ticketing info and much more about NYCC is available here. Come visit us at Booth #2082!
title: Strand Books @ NYCC

description:
Join the Vulture Insiders, the most plugged-in up-to-date obsessives from New York Magazine’s pop-culture site, for an evening with Tim Murphy, debut author of the “hugely ambitious” Christodora. He’ll be joined by Vulture’s books editor, Boris Kachka, to discuss the iconic Alphabet City building of the title and the stories of its inhabitants that make up his sprawling tale. 

From the devastation of the 1980s AIDS epidemic to the influx of drug addicts and alcoholics to the transformation of boho artists to yuppie ones, a privileged young couple with artistic ambitions and their adopted son grapple with their shifting neighborhood and the unforgettable events of the past that will forever define their future. As the junkies and protestors of the 1980s give way to the hipsters of the 2000s and they, in turn, to the wealthy residents of the crowded, glass-towered city of the 2020s, enormous changes rock the couple’s personal lives and the constellation of people around them. Christodora recounts the heartbreak wrought by AIDS, illustrates the allure and destructive power of hard drugs, and brings to life the ever-changing city itself.

Please RSVP to vultureinsiders@vulture.com. Feel free to buy a copy of Christodora, but purchase is not required. It’s more important to bring your questions, comments, and insights! The event will be located in the Rare Book Room on the 3rd floor of Strand at 828 Broadway at 12th Street. If you can’t make the meeting, we’ll be broadcasting the event on Periscope. Download the Periscope app from the App Store or Google Play, follow Vulture, and tune in Wednesday, October 19th at 7:30 PM!
title: Vulture Insiders Book Club: Christodora by Tim Murphy

description:
Your dog’s favorite monthly subscription now has a treat for you, too!

The makers of the much-loved BarkBox have put together a wonderful collection of photographs and stories of over two-hundred dogs! This book captures the powerful bond between humans and their canine sidekicks and what better way to feature that than with some Instagram famous dogs! Below are the instapups coming out for the launch!

  • Noodle - @showmenoodz
  • Monty- Doodle mafia @montydoodledoo
  • Andi- buthead @weirdwiener
  • Chloe k- senior dog @chloekardoggian
  • Gizzy- host @newyorkdog

Join us in the Rare Book Room for a celebration of dogs and the people who love them! Although the Strand is dog-friendly, you’ll need to leave your pups at home for this one. We don’t have space for everyone to bring their canine pals! Thanks everyone.

Buy a copy of Dogs and Their People or a $15 gift card in-store at Strand's main floor registers or at the door to attend. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Dogs and Their People

description:
Not all black cats look alike. Each cat has its own distinct look and personality and the team at Studio Goldsparkle is here to teach you how to look beyond the fur. All Black Cats are Not Alike is their project straight from Kickstarter, featuring fifty hand-drawn all black cats and their stories submitted by their backers. Each cat is distinct and each story is one that will make any cat-lover laugh or groan in empathy.

Love cats and wanting one of your own? The ASPCA is here to help! There will be some adorable and adoptable cats at this event! Come out up to the Rare Book Room for a night of cat-talk, cat-themed books, and cats! Black-only dress code encouraged, kitty costumes optional. 

Hosted by the Strand in partnership with Kickstarter, Studio Goldsparkle and Chronicle Books. Drinks, signings and goodie bags will be provided. 

Standing-room tickets for this event will be available at the door (and they include a copy of the book!). The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: All Black Cats Are Not Alike OFFICIAL LAUNCH!

description:
The allure of the cinema, the place where people gather to get away from the hustle and bustle of their everyday lives, to escape into another world. It’s an almost mystical location made more captivating with detailed architecture. A perfect place to capture in a photograph as Hiroshi Sugimoto has done in his series Theatres. For this project, he opens the camera shutter and exposes a roll of film for the duration of the movie, letting the screen be the only source of light. The result is something beautiful.

Hiroshi will be joined in conversation with Darius Himes, International Head of Photographs for Christie’s and co-author of Publish Your Photography Book.

The conversation will be followed by a signing of Sugimoto’s book Theatres.  In addition to Theatres, Sugimoto will sign one back list title per customer (Damiani-published Dioramas or Seascapes only). 

Buy a copy of Theatres, or a $20 gift card to attend. Please note that payment is required for all online orders at the time of checkout. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Hiroshi Sugimoto: Theatres

description:
Vigorously demanded and highly anticipated, Heart and Brain: Gut Instincts is the follow-up to the tremendously popular New York Times bestseller, Heart and Brain: An Awkward Yeti Collection. Gut Instincts features the same lovable characters from Awkward Yeti and introduces a host of other vital organs like insatiable Tongue, irritable Bowels, and abused Stomach--all of whom we know so well despite having never met them.

Join us for snacks, trivia, coloring, prizes, and fun in the Rare Book Room, and get your book signed by Nick Seluk, the creator of Awkward Yeti!

Buy a copy of Heart and Brain: Gut Instincts or a $15 gift card at the door to attend this event. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Pre-release Party! Heart and Brain: Gut Instincts: An Awkward Yeti Collection

description:
Join us to celebrate the launch of Grace Bonney’s newest book, In the Company of Women. Bonney founded Design*Sponge in 2004, and it was an immediate success. She has worked tirelessly since its inception to connect and support women running creative businesses. In this book, Bonney profiles over 100 of these influential and creative women from all ages, races, backgrounds, and industries. Chock-full of practical, inspirational advice for those looking to forge their own paths, these interviews detail the keys to success and dispense advice for the next generation of women entrepreneurs and makers.

Tickets for this event are sold out. This event will take place at the Parsons School of Design, 66 West 12th Street, New York, New York 10011.

 

Prepare for a fabulous evening as several experts discuss their unique perspectives as enterprising and ambitious women. Panelists include:

  • Jodie Patterson is a mother of five, an entrepreneur, and a distinctive voice in the beauty industry, having cofounded two companies: Doobop, and Georgia by Jodie Patterson. Her brands have been profiled in five issues of O Magazine, and appeared in almost every major mainstream publication, including the New York Times, Glamour and Vogue. She is an active LGBTQI ally who has been recognized by The Advocate, GLAAD and numerous other websites. Many years ago, Jodie was the Director of PR for the fashion designer Zac Posen and most surprisingly, an acrobat in the Big Apple Circus. She lives in Brooklyn, New York, where she and Joseph Ghartey raise their children with love, education and family solidarity.
  • Malene Barnett is an award-winning designer who creates bespoke carpets, fine art wall coverings and artisan tiles from her studio in Brooklyn, New York. An Alumni of the Tory Burch/Goldman Sachs 10K Small Business Program, Malene has been featured in both national and international publications, including Interior Design Magazine, House Beautiful and New York Magazine. Her company, a M/WBE certified business, has attracted the gaze of the luxury market including Saks Fifth Avenue, Chatsworth Building, The Astor - Luxury Residential, Revel Hotel, The Baystone Hotel in Mauritius, Duke University, Avalon and Arianna Huffington. Malene B is also a proud partner of Kravet and Goodweave.
  • Anna Bond  is co-owner and Creative Director and her illustrations and designs have molded Rifle Paper Co.’s unique aesthetic. Born and raised in Summit, New Jersey, Anna got her bachelor’s degree in Graphic Design and made her way to Florida to work as an Art Director at a magazine. After a few years of magazine and freelance illustration work, she fell in love with stationery and began working toward developing a line of products. As Creative Director, Anna designs Rifle Paper Co.’s collection as well as oversees the creative direction of the brand including marketing, business strategy, and product development. She was also recently honored as an ADC Young Gun.
  • Tina Roth Eisenberg grew up in the mountains of Switzerland but moved to New York City to work as a graphic designer in 1999. She worked in various prominent design firms to then start her own design studio in 2006. With the birth of her second child in 2010 she decided to take a client sabbatical to focus on her various side projects. The hiatus has been extended indefinitely and Tina now runs four businesses out of DUMBO, Brooklyn. She runs a collaborative workspace called Studiomates, organizes a global, monthly lecture series called CreativeMornings, is the inventor of the to-do app TeuxDeux, and has changed the world of temporary tattoos with her latest project, Tattly. Tina is often referred to as Swissmiss after her popular design blog, which is also the name of her Twitter handle.

This program is organized in collaboration with PARSONS SCHOOL OF DESIGN at The New School.

A limited number of free tickets (book is not included) are available to students and faculty at Parsons School of Design until September 21-- click HERE to register.
title: Grace Bonney: In the Company of Women @ The New School

description:
Padma Lakshmi’s career as a chef, actress, and author has brought her into contact with flavors from all around the world. With The Encyclopedia of Spices and Herbs, she provides a definitive and beautifully photographed A-Z guide to the spices, herbs, salts, peppers, and blends that make for a well-stocked kitchen, along with a wealth of explanation, history, and cooking advice. She’ll be at the Strand to discuss the trials and errors along with the successes that culminated in the brand-new book!

Kerry Diamond, the co-founder and Editorial Director of Cherry Bombe, will be joining Padma to discuss this soon-to-be culinary classic. 

Buy a copy of The Encyclopedia of Spices and Herbs, a copy of Love, Loss, and What We Ate, or a $15 gift card to attend. Please note that payment is required for all online orders at the time of checkout. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Padma Lakshmi

description:
The Best American Comics series launches its latest collection with this year’s guest editor: Roz Chast, beloved New Yorker cartoonist and award-winning author of Can’t We Talk About Something More Pleasant? She’ll be joined by the series editor, comics sage and evangelist Bill Kartalopoulos, along with a panel of the artists behind her picks for the year’s best comics:

  • Liana Finck, author of "All the Paintings Here Agree"
  • Char Esme, author of "Blinky-Jinks Playhouse" and "Big Rudy’s Cowgirls Club" (with Lauren Poor)
  • Anne Emond, author of "The Swim" and "Today"

Buy a copy of The Best American Comics 2016 or a $15 gift card in-store at the Strand's main floor registers or at the door to attend. This event will take place in the Rare Book Room on the Strand's 3rd floor, accessible via the store elevator or at 826 Broadway.
title: Best American Comics 2016: Roz Chast + Bill Kartalopoulos

description:
The ultimate guide for feminists is finally out! Three of the wonderfully witty women of the satirical site Reductress have gotten it all down in their book How to Win at Feminism: The Definitive Guide to Having It All—And Then Some!

Join us in the Rare Book Room for a night of female-fueled conversation featuring the following authors:

  • Sarah Pappalardo (editor, co-founder of Reductress; author of How to Win at Feminism) She has written and performed at IO Chicago, The Second City, and the Magnet Theater, and The Upright Citizens Brigade.
  • Beth Newell (editor, co-founder of Reductress; author of How to Win at Feminism) Beth has over a decade of experience in the NYC comedy scene, having performed at The Upright Citizen’s Brigade, Caroline’s on Broadway, and The Magnet Theater. She has contributed to The Onion, McSweeney’s, and Pendulous Breasts Quarterly.
  • Charla Lauriston (writer, Unbreakable Kimmy Schmidt) Charla is a writer and stand-up comedian who has performed stand-up all over the country including the New York Comedy Festival, the She-Devil Festival, and the Chicago Women’s Funny Festival. She is the creator of the critically acclaimed original series Clench & Release.
  • Jessica Bennett (author, Feminist Fight Club) Jessica is an award-winning journalist and critic who writes on women, sexuality and culture. She is a contributing writer at the New York Times, where she has covered feminism and Greek life, sexual consent, and authored the first profile of Monica Lewinsky in a decade. A former staff writer at Newsweek and columnist at Time.com, she is also a contributing editor at LeanIn.Org, where she cofounded and curates the Lean In Collection, a photo partnership with Getty Images to change the way women are depicted in stock photography.
  • Gaby Moss, associate editor at Bustle and author of forthcoming book GLOP: Nontoxic, Expensive Ideas That Will Make You Look Ridiculous & Feel Pretentious.

The conversation will be moderated by Joanna Rothkopf (writer and editor, Jezebel) Joanna’s work has appeared in Vanity Fair, The Atlantic, Foreign Policy, The Huffington Post, and Epicurious.com, among others, and her body has performed at UCB, Standup NY and the Secret Theater, among others.

Buy a copy of How to Win at Feminism or a $15 gift card in-store at the Strand's main floor registers or at the door to attend. This event will take place in the Rare Book Room on the Strand's 3rd floor, accessible via the store elevator or at 826 Broadway.
title: Reductress: How To Win At Feminism

description:
On the heels of his hit first book, 1 Page at a Time, graphic designer, artist and author Adam J. Kurtz delivers another intimate and engaging book that offers perspective, hope, and perhaps the best advice of all—your own. (Plus some goofs because why not.)

Join us at Strand for the official launch of the DIY journal/book/existential experience, Pick Me Up: A Pep Talk for Now and Later. First, we’ll hear from NYC comedic sensation Aparna Nancherla, then Adam and Grace Bonney, founder of Design*Sponge, will discuss creativity and the little things we can make and do for ourselves. We'll also enjoy some poetry performed by Sarah Jean Alexander. Naturally, Adam will stick around after the talk to sign copies of Pick Me Up, and he’d love to see you there! 

And what event would be complete without drinks and snacks? DRY Sparkling will have sweet sips on hand.

Buy a copy of Pick Me Up or a $15 gift card in-store at Strand's main floor registers or at the door to attend. The event will be located in the Strand's 3rd floor Rare Book Room at our store at 828 Broadway at 12th Street.
title: Adam J. Kurtz: Pick Me Up

description:
David Lida is the author of four books, including First Stop in the New World, a critically-acclaimed street-level panorama of contemporary Mexico City; Travel Advisory, a collection of short stories; and Las llaves de la ciudad, which he wrote in Spanish, his second language. When he's not writing, he is a mitigation specialist, conducting investigations for lawyers who defend Mexicans who are in jail in the US, facing charges of capital murder and, as such, the death penalty. Using this work as an inspiration, Lida's first novel, One Life, follows Richard, its protagonist, along the back roads of Mexico, as he tries to save the life of Esperanza, in jail in Louisiana, accused of murdering her 11-month-old baby.

David will be joined in conversation by Daniel Alarcón. Daniel is the author of At Night We Walk in Circles, which was a finalist for the 2014 PEN-Faulkner Award, as well as the story collection War by Candlelight and the novel Lost City Radio.
